This structure is called the Nilometer, measuring the level of the Nile River. This particular Nilometer is located on Rhoda Island in Cairo.

To measure the depth of the river, it is enough to lower a rope/stick in the right place. But no, you have to build a whole "castle" to know the depth of the river. There are many such structures and all to measure the depthðŸ¤”

I'm sure the original purpose of these structures was unclear even to the Egyptians themselves.

text:
Fragment of a map of 1578.

On all maps before 1700, the Caspian Sea has a very different shape. There is no Aral Sea at all. The Caspian is oval in shape. There are a large number of rivers and cities in the area of modern deserts, of which we have no idea.
We can definitely conclude that the Karakum and Kyzylkum desert areas were densely populated. There were mountains and cities, rivers and lakes. At the same time, rivers had quite a different direction from the present one.

text:
Was Samara flooded a couple of centuries ago, too?

During construction in the historical part of Samara you can see very old buildings.

In the photo you can see windows and arched entrances, which are much lower than the ground. Not even the foundations of the old structures were exposed, but entire floors.

No one would imagine that there is a whole buried city under the ground. I am becoming more and more convinced that we know nothing.

text:
During the construction of the bridge over the Yenisei, a part of the railroad, laid in the 1890s, was discovered. Interestingly, the railway line was hidden under a one and a half meter layer of soil.

Once again, 1.5 meters of soil. Is that a cultural layer? Away from settlements? If all railroad lines were sagging at this rate, we'd be relining them every 5 to 10 years. The funny thing is that the modern road that passes next to it doesn't suffer from this rate of sinking.

text:
The Museum of Archaeology in Moscow has an unusual map on which a cartographer has captured the existence of the Patagonian Giants.

It is one of the few maps mentioning this people before they were exterminated, and perhaps the only one that captures the figures in color. What do you think of the bearded blond giant on the South American continent? Does it look much like the other Indians? Could it have been those "white gods"?

text:
Clerksdorp's Spheres.

South American miners discovered strange spheres in mines; they were in Precambrian sediments, some of which were up to 2.8 billion years old.

The spheres range in diameter from 0.5 to 4 inches. They are also very difficult to scratch. Some believe that the spheres are of artificial origin. Their mystery is as unsolved today as when they were first discovered.

text:
The book of Ura-Linda is a Frisian manuscript, the origin of which is still disputed today. The book contains texts of various topics that describe such concepts as matriarchy, catastrophism, and mythology.

It also states that this Frisian civilization had its own alphabet, from which the Greek and Phoenician alphabets were created. The Book of Ura-Linda is believed to have been written between 2194 and 803 B.C.

text:
The size of the prehistoric flora and fauna was many times larger than today's flora and fauna. In the photo is a stump, to which even the word "giant" would not be enough. The poor thing does not give up, but the modern shoots of this colossus seem like a small blade of grass against the background of a huge base.

It is in America that the most strange stump-shaped mountains have survived. While we are persuaded that these stumps appeared due to the weathering of rocks, those same "mountains" cheekily begin to give sprouts.

text:
There is a stone block in South America whose peculiarity is the inscriptions in an unknown language, covering the entire area of 600 m2. The writing resembles Egyptian, Phoenician, ancient Greek, Cretan, and there are signs in common with the Proto-Indian civilization of Mohenjo-Daro and the Kohau Rongo Rongo of Easter Island.

Theoretically, of course, it is possible that a whole crowd of people wandered across Eurasia and brought their culture and script to the new regions. But how to explain that in doing so, they "incidentally covered" territories scattered across oceans and thousands of kilometers practically all over the planet?

Apparently, the vertical masonry framed an arch or a window, but according to the BTI documents, the building has neither a basement nor a ground floor.

However, if the building is not excavated up to the foundation and passages to the backfilled floor, the documents will not show anything.

text: Under the streets of San Francisco are the remains of dozens of sailing ships that once brought people to San Francisco. The official version is this: in 1850, hundreds of migrant ships sailed to become one of the gold miners. The ships were no longer needed after the voyage. Further, scholars believe that the new-found gold miners, in the best traditions of Ostrovsky's "Bespridannitsa" said "So don't get you!" and sank the ships. And, apparently, they filled in, because now there is solid earth on the site of the bay. But this does not embarrass the officials.

text:
In Kyzlasov's book "Ancient Cities of Siberia" there is information that Russian merchants in the 12-13th century traded with the cities of the Kyrgyz Kaganate.

However, the mummies found on the Altai mountain plateau Ukok in the 1990s belonged not to the Mongoloid, but to the Caucasoid race. So it is quite possible that the Russian merchants traded not with the Kyrgyz Kaganate, but with their compatriots, and the distribution area of the Slavic tribes of that time should have been clarified.

text:
Historical paradox, wild Slavic barbarians did not know statehood before Norman-Rurik and writing before the Greeks.

But, as the excavations of the burials of the 10th-12th centuries show, the wild Slavs performed the most complex skull operations. Of the three skulls found with traces of surgery, two survived and lived long enough for the wound to heal. Not a bad statistic, huh?

text:
In May 2008, archaeologists from Bristol University, conducting excavations on the territory of the Chateau Gaillard, which is located in France, made a sensational find, which dates back to the 12th century. At a depth of 2 meters a bicycle was found, but a peculiar one.

It strongly resembles modern bicycles, but made more crudely. It has armor, handles are made of sword handles, and the wheels have horse hair instead of tires.

According to the history we know, the bicycle was invented in 1818.

text:
Metro 2."

"Metro 2" is the conventional designation for the secret transport lines under the Moscow Metro.

The existence of "Metro 2" was neither confirmed nor denied by the authorities. But to date, a lot of facts have accumulated indicating the existence of such a network.

Unofficial researchers of underground structures testify about various corridors under alarms, bunkers and warehouses not indicated on publicly available maps.

text.text: Someone tries to contact us every 16 days.

text:
Astronomers have discovered a mysterious radio signal that repeats every 16 days in a very cunning pattern. Namely, it first repeats every hour. Sometimes the rhythm is broken, and two signals come every hour. This goes on for four days. Then it goes silent for 12 days, and then it repeats all over again. All in all, the whole cycle lasts 16.35 days. Reminds me of morse code!

The bad news: we are being signaled from a distance of half a billion light years, and the mysterious "operator" hardly exists yet. After all, the entire history of mankind is much less than 500 million years.

text:
The sixth mass extinction began on Earth

Biologists have presented evidence of the beginning of a new mass extinction caused by human activity

The authors of the paper disagree with the claim that a new extinction is the natural order of things. Currently, humans are the only significant force capable of having a significant impact on the Earth's biosphere. As the experts conclude, in the face of a growing crisis, scientists should apply preventive archaeology, collecting and documenting as many species as possible before they go extinct

text:
Rumors about Edgar Allan Poe's Time Machine

Edgar Poe's A Tale of the Adventures of Arthur Gordon Pym tells how four shipwreck survivors were forced to eat a young sailor named Richard Parker. Poe said it was based on true events, but in reality it was not.
Forty-six years after this book was written, a shipwreck actually occurred and the rescued crewmen decided to eat their yungu, whose name was... Richard Parker. This fact sparked rumors that the writer had a time machine. And he had access to extraterrestrial technology.

text:
By discovering wireless electricity, any scientist would rob the world oligarchy of money. No need for oil, wood, coal, gas, expensive hydro and power plants - one receiver can endlessly create energy virtually out of thin air.

Financial magnate Morgan instantly stopped funding Nikola Tesla's experiments when he came up with wireless power transmission and the extraction of energy "out of nowhere" - from the world's ether. After that, no one helped Tesla financially - the solidarity of the financial tycoons turned out to be like that of the thieves in the law.

text:
The Al Naslaya Stone (Saudi Arabia).

This famous stone has a perfectly even cut line and astonishes all explorers - the surfaces on both sides are perfectly smooth.

Who exactly cut this stone and how it was cut remains a mystery. Scientists believe that nature did its best to create this perfect smooth line, as it was caused by weathering. But this version seems untenable - there are no similar formations in nature.

text:
The terrible and mighty Mongol-Tatar yoke left no "Mongoloid trace" in the genetics, culture, language and writing of the Slavs.

It's funny that those who wrote the story of the Tatar-Mongol invasion didn't know that back in the Genghisid times, the Mongols themselves still lived in Tibet and were called "Oirats", but not "Mongols" until the 20th century. Even more absurd is the fact that to these Tatars, who are "Tatar-Mongols", are drawn the Kazan Tatars, who until the same 20th century were called "Bulgars" and themselves were under the attack of Batyi's army.

text:
In 2018, the Arch of Chastity of the Qing Dynasty was excavated at a Chinese construction site.

The arch is not small, 4x6 meters, the media reported in detail about the find, showed the smallest details of the patterns, stopped at the memorial inscription, but no one could explain what disaster caused this structure to be buried six meters deep. Well it is unlikely that Jing Biao Fei Hou Ting dedicated this arch to his wife and for the sake of honoring her memory ordered it buried (the arch of course, not his wife). It is unlikely!

text:
The photo shows polygonal masonry in Peru and Turkey. Between the builders there was an ocean of time of a couple of millennia and a real ocean separating the continents. So we can't talk about technology transfer.

What conclusion can be drawn from such coincidences? If the facts are out of bounds versions of the official history, then it is untenable. I do not call to believe only in alternative history, but traditional history should be able to admit mistakes and update knowledge, not to turn a blind eye to what it cannot explain.

text:
Although the most adequate of official historians neatly hint at a reduction in the historical number of the Tatar-Mongol yoke from 500,000 to 50,000, the cruel myth of "100 Russian cities burned by the Mongol-Tatars" continues to live on in historical literature.

Although, judging by the chronicles, in reality most of these cities were burned before the arrival of Batyi. Consequences of the baptism of Russia by fire and sword and the ensuing internecine strife of the princes. The simplest calculation of time shows that even having at its disposal transport and transport helicopters Batu Khan's army would not have had time to burn so many cities during his short campaign. Especially at a time when there were no modern highways and freeways.

text:
The map by Giovanni Giacomo de Rossi of 1688 features the marvelous city of Petersburg, which according to the official version, was still 5 years away from being built. I would suggest that Rossi produced a map after Petersburg was laid in 1703, so to speak, a historical version with modern relief, but he died in 1691, never knowing that the Russian emperor had decided to found a city "among the swamps".

Not a cartographer, but a soothsayer! What a talented man he was.

text:
There are stones scattered all over the world that have been sawn up by an unknown technology, some of which, if they can be explained by nature, obviously not all of them. Many sawing lines are not just flat, but at a certain angle with a machined surface of the rock, which I think it is impossible to explain by nature.

And by the way yes, what is the most interesting, on some stones at the edges of the sawing lines there were traces of white markings, as if they were drawn with chalk. I think it is unlikely that nature made markings on the stones. And if seriously it is not quite clear why stones could be sawed and thrown.

text:
This is a painting of Saul's Suicide. Painted by Pieter Brueghel in 1562

Scholars say it depicts camels. You know what camels look like, don't you? But doesn't it look like dinosaurs?
The painting was painted in the 16th century. A man is riding a dinosaur? They went extinct millions of years ago! Didn't they? Maybe scientists are lying to us and dinosaurs didn't go extinct that long ago.

text:
Temples of distant antiquity may well have been devices for obtaining electricity from the atmosphere. The theory looks strange, but scientists cannot yet explain why the same elements are located on the ritual structures of different cultures.

Spire-like structures are present in almost every architectural tradition of the past. The belfries of cathedrals, the tops of Chinese pagodas, Indian temples - from a practical point of view these elements are unnecessary.

text:
Loladoff stone plate from Nepal.

On top of the spirals an alien is depicted. His arms and legs are arranged symmetrically on the drawings from the central axis of his body and large bald head.

On the left side of the alien are drawn objects that resemble in appearance spiders with round heads and 8 twisted paws. Also on the disk is a picture of a reptile, resembling a dragon.

This artifact was found in Nepal. The images and the clear lines carved on the surface of this flat stone have led many researchers to believe that it is of extraterrestrial origin.

text_entities.text:
Loladoff stone plate from Nepal.

On top of the spirals an alien is depicted. His arms and legs are arranged symmetrically on the drawings from the central axis of his body and large bald head.

On the left side of the alien are drawn objects that resemble in appearance spiders with round heads and 8 twisted paws. Also on the disk is a picture of a reptile, resembling a dragon.

This artifact was found in Nepal. The images and the clear lines carved on the surface of this flat stone have led many researchers to believe that it is of extraterrestrial origin.
Forbidden Science

text:
Swiss clock from an ancient tomb.

A few years ago, Chinese scientists excavating an ancient tomb in the Guangxi region unexpectedly discovered an object that resembled a ring. When they dusted it off, they found that they were holding an elegant Swiss lady's watch in their hands.

The unusual find resembled a ring with a dial. On the dial, the time was frozen at 10:06. On the back of the find was engraved the inscription in English "Swiss". Which means Swiss.

The tomb where the find was made was four hundred years old and had never been opened.

text:
This mermaid was a gift to the British Museum by Queen Victoria's grandson, and is said to have been caught in Japan in the 18th century.

The peculiar structure of this creature is surprising - literally two halves: the upper part of the body resembles a monkey, and the lower part resembles a fish tail. You involuntarily think about the old tales of underwater cities and their inhabitants, which may very well be real, judging by such findings.

text:
An archaeologist discovered in Bosnia a huge stone sphere 1,500 years old; stone spheres of various sizes had been found in the former Yugoslavia before, but this one-and-a-half-meter sphere was a sensation.

The giant orb was found nearby in a wooded area near the town of Zavidovichi. Similar spheres, called kugli by the locals, had been found on this territory before, but this was the first time a sphere of such large size had been found.

text:
"God" who fell from the sky.

The Anthropological Museum of Mexico City has many sculptures and images of one of the main gods of the Indians, Tlaloc, god of water, thunder and fire, floods and destruction.

Now imagine the following picture: a plane crashed (caught fire) and made an emergency landing, during rain and thunderstorms, on the cornfields of the natives. Can you imagine? Look closely at the figure of this (pilot) god. That's exactly how you'll look from the outside, I assure you.

Why not assume that the first close contact between the two civilizations looked like this? And the image of Tlaloc was reflected in the myth-making of the Native American milieu from exactly this angle.

text:
"Robot" from the city of Caba

Curious shape of the hands of local statues. They look more like the arms of a mechanical robot. It is quite possible that such a strange shape of the hands of the statues is just the result of stylization, the interpretation of the sculptor-stonemason who created them.

If we compare these statues to one of the descriptions of the god Tezcatlipoca in local legends. In one of his frightening images, Tezcatlipoca appears without a head and with two doors on his chest, which opened and closed with the banging of an axe on wood. How is that not a description of a robot?

text:
A few years ago, off the coast of California, an unusual disc-shaped artifact was discovered, measuring 2 by 4 km and 150 m thick. In addition, it is mounted on massive stone columns.

While ufologists are convinced that it is an underwater base, and geologists are convinced of a uniform "washout of column and disk shaped rock", in my opinion, there is a simple and logical explanation (no, not a flood). California is on a lithospheric plate fault and this area can sink or rise out of the water quickly during tectonic shifts. The question is different, what age should the disc-shaped structure that ended up 10km off the coast be? There is no mention of it after the discovery of the Americas, and for the pre-Columbian era atypical shape of the structure and scope.

Coordinates 33Â°59'34.77 "N 119Â°01'18.83 "W

text:
It seems that the plateau with the pyramids in Egypt has been studied up and down, but satellite images with clear, high-quality images reveal new details.

If you zoom in on the details of the image, you can see the outlines of giant, clearly man-made rectangular formations facing the pyramids of Miquerinos and Chephren. Either underground structures or the remains of above-ground structures.

I wonder what is there? Only the Egyptian Supreme Council of Antiquities issues permits for archaeological work in strictly designated areas and not for free. Moreover, excavations at many sites are not allowed at all.

text:
When people were big.

Fedor Andreevich Makhnov was a peasant from Vitebsk province (Russian Empire, now Belarus). According to a number of sources, the tallest man who ever lived on Earth. His height, according to these sources, was 285 centimeters. His foot was 51 centimeters and his palm 32 centimeters. The young peasant weighed 182 kilograms and was reputed to be very strong.

text:
The Ogden Standard-Examiner of November 10, 1929 published an interview with archaeologist Ralph Glidden, who for about 10 years was engaged in excavations in the Californian island of Catalina:

"Irrefutable proof that light-skinned, fair-haired men of great stature lived on Catalina Island about 3,000 years ago." According to him, these skeletons belonged to people between 210 and 270 cm tall.

This is not the only or first claim that giants lived here. In 1913, a German doctor, A. FÃ¼rstenan, found a 240 cm tall human skeleton on Catalina Island.

text:
It is believed that the Greek mathematician, astronomer, and head of the Library of Alexandria, Erastopheanus of Cyrene, who lived in the 3rd-2nd century BC, accurately calculated the Earth's meridian and determined the size of our planet, and did so with incredible accuracy.

However, in the 15th century, Columbus believed the earth was three times smaller than it really is. An amazing fact that is not explained by historians - why did not Columbus know that? The full sense is that the story of Eratosthenes' calculations came from the same author who wrote about how Fibonacci cleverly counted fractions before they were even known to mathematicians.

text:
The Peruvian Cumbe Mayo Aqueduct is located about 3.3 km above sea level. There is no exact data about its creators, but it is attributed to the period before the Incas, about 1500 B.C.

The aqueduct has straight canal walls all along its 10 km, turning at perfect angles. The builders were not impeded by the rocks that got in the way - they dug the canal straight through. It is obvious that here there was a need for more serious equipment than a hammer and chisel, but historians deny the existence of such equipment to the pre-Inca civilizations and the Incas themselves. But they are in no hurry to explain the origin of such structures.

text:
In the 1930s, an underground sea was discovered 300-1000m below Moscow. Academician I.Gubkin suggested that it was left over from the Devonian period, the lower layers being salty, like the Dead Sea, the middle layers being mineral, and the higher layers being fresh water.

But to the question of how this underground sea with different degrees of salinity in different horizons could have been formed, geology does not provide a proving model. If there ever was a sea on the Central Russian Plain, then with the rapid accumulation of sediment (from volcanic eruptions, for example) - it would have turned at least into a swamp or would have ceased to exist at all.

text:
To the great joy of all couch archaeologists, with the development of the Internet came the digitization of printed editions. Searches in newspapers and magazines of past centuries quickly yielded unexpected results.

In 1919, the skeleton of a humanoid 5.5 meters tall was found at a mine in Texas. The skeleton was examined by numerous witnesses and a professor of geology, who estimated the geological formation at 3,000 years old and the skeleton was given the same age. The publication writes that skeletons the size of 3m are found very often in Texas.

The story ended sadly - the skeleton was reported to important specialists and authorities, officials took it away and no one ever saw it again.

text:
In the National Museum of Guatemala lies the Altar Stone of the Great Incas, dating back to 653 A.D. A metal pipe emerges from the limestone, and the pipe cavity is also filled with limestone.

The question is, how did the Indians, running across the prairies without pants, make the pipe in the 7th century? There were no pipe-rolling machines yet, I can tell you that.

text:
Among the photos of late Qing dynasty Beijing, we found a photo of a non-standard tower - a classic Chinese roof resting on a huge, massive building with thick walls. By the way, the photos, to the misfortune of historians, were signed - Tower of the Tartarian Walls.

And where, excuse me, the wall itself? It is frightening to imagine how big it must have been, if one of its towers looks like an armored wall. How was such a miracle erected, and why is the roof of the ancient building overgrown with shrubs?

text:
Mammoths became extinct not long ago.

The founder of Yekaterinburg Prince V.N. Tatishchev in 1720 wrote "The Tale of the Mammoth Beast". According to the inhabitants of the Urals "Mammoth is a beast of great size with an elephant and more, a kind of black, has a head of two horns. Hunters presented to prince tusks of a mammoth in fresh blood as from a carcass of recently killed animal.

Tatishchev also writes: "I happened to hear from Swedish captives that they themselves saw the beast swimming across the river at night". Tatishchev's scientific investigation of mammoths (the first in the world) for unknown reasons was not published in Russia, it was published in Sweden and London.

text:
In addition to the same pyramids or, for example, dolmens all over the planet, we found another coincidence - seids. Seids are sacred objects, and, as Wikipedia specifies, seids are characteristic of the Northern European peoples.

On the left is a seid in Pedro de Santana, Brazil, on the right is a seid on the Kola Peninsula, Russia. Well, or vice versa.

You cannot even understand, what is more surprising, that the ancient people on the different ends of the planet invented to put a huge boulder on three supports or that both civilizations considered it as a religious construction. In that case, maybe we should talk about one civilization?

Wild Indians meet an envoy of civilization, Cortez. In a multistory city with beautiful architecture. So who was wild after that? Yes, the outfits of leaves and feathers are somewhat extravagant, but in a hot climate it's just right.

text:
At the moment, scientists believe that the Horde nomadic warriors had a marching horse and a "transport-carriage" for transporting weapons, equipment and supplies in addition to the war horse. This is without taking into account the transport vehicles.

It turns out that somewhere had to find food not only for 300-500.000 warriors, but also forage for at least 900.000 horses.

Clearly the historian is not a hippologist, the historian has not studied horses and does not know that the average horse eats 10-15kg per day. Do you have a good idea of the daily volume of food of the beasts of the Horde? And with several days of standing in one place? Do you still believe in the number of Tatar-Mongolian troops?

text:
Chang Baori Stepping Well (India) is located away from hiking trails. Its depth is 30 meters, the well has 3,500 stairs made of immaculate blocks. Resistant to earthquakes. It was built in the 9th century. According to local legend, it was created in one day by "white spirits". There are no quarries or traces of construction. Official purpose: to collect groundwater.

Let's turn on our heads, engage logic and imagination: stairs have no handrails, water carriers would be exposed to deadly risk. In addition, water stagnates and is dangerous to health. The structure resembles a silo launcher. The standard depth of modern rocket silos is 30 meters.

text:
Pyramid in Krasnoyarsk.

This is a pyramidal mountain near the settlement of Zykovo a few kilometers from Krasnoyarsk. This pyramid is really artificial, too correct. And at the foot, next to the road the stones are made of large poured (according to modern concepts) in concrete. So this stone is probably part of the inner wall of the object.

And here is what is surprising, the neighboring hills do not have such smooth edges.

text:
The 3c fresco from the Roman catacombs of St. Callista is considered the oldest depiction of the baptism of Jesus by St. John the Baptist.

A question for historians - what makes you think this is Jesus and John? Because of the difference in height, Christ here looks quite a child, although according to traditional accounts he was baptized as an adult.

Nearby is a fragment of another man, in a seated position he is even taller than the adult John.

On the other hand, historians are always like this - any find is either a military scene or a religious one, there is no other way (not enough imagination). And people of gigantic stature are necessarily indicative of a dominant position and importance, despite evidence from various parts of the world of the existence of giant peoples.

text:
Where did saucer flying machines come from? Few people think about it, but the image of "saucers" in modern life and comes from the distant past, but where did it all come from?

In bas-reliefs, drawings and various writings, ancient peoples mentioned "gods" and saucer-like vehicles. In Egypt, South America, Asia, Europe, everywhere these images were found

And everything can be written off as a joke, a fake or a coincidence, but how realistic are such coincidences and single images around the world, going back to the distant past?

text:
Strange coincidences.

A total of 57 people from Hillary and Bill Clinton's inner circle have died in strange circumstances over the past 30 years.

15 of them committed suicide, including the billionaire pedophile Jeffrey Epstein. Eight died in car and plane crashes, and 14 were killed under mysterious circumstances.

All of the victims on the "Clinton List" had information that could potentially ruin the couple's careers.

text:
Eleanor Rigby's grave and the Beatles' song "Eleanor Rigby"

In 1957 John Lennon and Paul McCartney met at a party at St. Peter's Church in Woolton. It was a fateful meeting that undoubtedly changed the course of musical history. But their meeting was even more mystical. A few meters from where they met was the grave of Eleanor Rigby. There was also a Rigby & Evens Ltd. store in Bristol. According to Paul McCartney, when he was composing the song "Eleanor Rigby," the name suddenly popped into his head. He later admitted that it is quite possible that Eleanor Rigby's grave may have played a part on a subconscious level when he was composing the famous song.

text:
"Summer Holiday. Belgium.

The tapestry called "Summer Feast" was created in Bruges (capital of the province of West Flanders in Belgium) around 1538. Today it can be seen in the Bavarian National Museum.
 
It is famous for depicting very UFO-like objects that hover in the sky. Judging by the numerous depictions of flying machines in this and other paintings, and even in the Bible, the ancients flew safely and were not such savages.

text:
Nazca Plateau, Utu. Ancient airfields in Peru?

The sliced mountain of the Nasca Plateau and it is perfectly flat. Just imagine the scale of the work, to cut an entire mountain.

And all this was done by ancient natives with picks and shovels? And what, to cut the top of the mountain - to spit. Only why would they need an airfield? It doesn't look like anything else. It would be interesting to look at the vehicles that landed on these runways.

It seems to be safe to say that Peru is an open-air museum of human civilization before the Flood. After all, there is the same cut-off mountain in Utu, Peru.

In fact, what else could the ancient inhabitants of South America (or once another continent) have used such structures for?

text:
Baigun pipes

Mysterious iron pipes were discovered in 1966 on Mount Baigongshan, China. Their age is more than 5 thousand years, in those days iron was not smelted in China yet. There is a version of an alien origin of pipes; analysis of their microstructure ruled out the possibility of human involvement in their creation.

text:
The Mystery of Stonehenge.

One of the most interesting challenges that the greatest minds have been pounding on for centuries, but solving the mystery is still to come.
Stonehenge consists of 82 megaliths weighing 5 tons, 30 blocks, each weighing 25 tons, and 5 trilithons (arches of three stones) weighing 50 tons each.

Now we can only guess who built this structure, what its mission and purpose are. And also how was it built?

text:
The Kremlin in a painting by artist F.Y. Alekseev, 18th century. Catching the eye is incomprehensible debris of stones lying directly on the road leading to the Borovitsky tower, look at the tower on the left, it has already sprouted shrubs, on the buildings on the right you can also see the debris of the spire as if this city has suffered some disaster and was inhabited very recently. Especially striking is the filled-up arch, it looks like even a man would have to bend his head when entering.

And the next picture of the same author, it is already visible that the church on the left has a cross, huge stones from the road were removed, the arch was excavated to a normal depth. Is this a fantasy of the author or the author drew what, saw?

text:
There were other clocks on the Spasskaya Tower until the end of the 17th century

This is a picture of the chimes on the Moscow Kremlin, which counted 16 hours a day ("3I" in this case means "zero hour").
But Peter the Great changed Russia's system of weights and measures from Russian to European.
It turns out that our ancestors divided the day not into 24, or even 12 hours, but precisely into sixteen.
 
An hour was divided into HOURS, one hour had 144 parts; one part (a prototype of a minute) had as many as 1296 fractions.

Why, as they say, "the primitive bearded men" had the need to count 1296 seconds?

text:
Sculptural portrait of Maria Duglioli Barberini

1621. Preserved in the Louvre. And it is marble.

For the 1600s, if the official science is to be believed, it was a piece of cake to make such sculptures - without special machines or technology, simply, by hand, using the means of the "primitive Middle Ages".

In the present, even a CNC machine would not do this. This was either cast or 3D printed. Marble. In the 17th century.

text:
Moving roads of the 19th century

The moving electric sidewalk (street of the future) was presented at exhibitions in 1893 and 1900 in Chicago and Paris. It was 3.5 km long and had 9 stops. Fourteen thousand people could pass on the sidewalk at the same time. The exhibition of 1900 lasted 7 months, and during that time 50 million people were able to ride on the electric road. It was said that such sidewalks would soon be in operation everywhere, but we never got around to it.

I wonder why?

text:
Who dug Baikal and the Black Sea?

1 photo - still operating Udachny diamond mine, Republic of Sakha (Yakutia)
2 photo - flooded mine, nowadays it is often called Lake Baikal
3 photo - another flooded mine, which is incorrectly called the Black Sea

You do not need to be a spanner in the sky to understand the origin of the last two. Only who and what was extracted there remains a mystery. Most likely forever.

text:
The Sumerian civilization itself is one of the most mysterious known in history. But the so-called Sumerian list of kings raises even more questions

At the site of Sumerian cities experts have found a large stone with the listed events of the past and all the kings of the Sumerians, some of whom ruled for 20-30 thousand years

In total such "long-lived kings" there were 7 and in total they ruled for about 240 000 years, and then Sumerians describe a global flood, and governors already began to rule adequate terms on 10-20, a maximum of 40 years

It is hard to imagine that an ancient civilization made it all up, and what is the point?

text:
Without even realizing it, our dear American partners are preserving our history. And better than they do in Russia itself.

The engraving shows the goddess of Glory and Oleg's shield at the gates of Tsargrad from the book "The Temple of Glory of Russian Heroes, 1803. It is clear why the book is unknown - it says that Novgorod is over 2000 years old, that Rurik came from the Lake Ilmen region, about the Slavic goddess Glory, of which no one has heard now, about the Slavic civilization, the same age as Solomon. Not the most popular ideas in the modern world, right?

According to the Chinese chronicles, he arrived from the star Xu-ayu-Yuan - the Alpha Lion star of the constellation Leo (the court of Race).

Images of flying devices from the Far East are present in great abundance.

text:
Part of the metal saw in the coal

Information about the find appeared about 8 years ago, when a man discovered an unusual object in a layer of coal.

It was, by the way, in Vladivostok. The coal artifact turned out to be something like a part with a toothed part. Obviously, the only logical appearance of the artifact in the coal is that it has grown into it.

Proceeding from this, the age of the find itself has been defined as 300 million years according to the coal deposit. And although the age is huge, the fact remains, and no other origin of the object was found.

text:
In the Russian State Archive of Ancient Acts (which are digitized, but accessible only by permission. Surprise!) we found a document with the inventory of the search of the headman of the Vodskaya Pyatina at the mouth of the Neva. "Earlier it was not published and was not involved in the study of pre-Petrine Petersburg" - it would seem, what pre-Petrine Petersburg and what is there to search on the marshes?

The document mentions a search on 25 May 7108 (1600s), made by order of tsar Boris Godunov and tsar Vasily Shuisky, and describes the presence of a ship wharf, a guest house and a church. Only in 1615 there were 16 ships from Vyborg, Ivangorod, Ladoga, Narva, Novgorod, Norrkoping, Revel and Stockholm. The inhabitants of the marshes didn't settle too badly, did they?

text:
That's how they built it?

Historians claim that the buildings are not backfilled. This is a feature of the architecture of the time, allegedly, so built. Here, looking at this photo, I have a question: "They built this way too?"

They also say that buildings sag, but again I have the question, "How could it have sagged HOWEVER?" It's obviously not heavy enough to sink that much under the ground, and why hasn't it cracked and warped?

text:
The mark of the Master of the Second Veil.

The hand behind the sinew is a symbolic representation of the sign that was given to Moses by God Himself.

At this step, the Master utters the following words: "In order to reach this step, you had to become perfect Masters, but you cannot go on without my words. Here they are: Shem, Japheth, and Adoniram; and my sign is this (hides hand behind sinew)."

Herein lies the reason why the "hidden hand" gesture is so popular among famous Freemasons. This sign allows members of the secret Fraternity to recognize "their own". In addition, the invisible hand behind the cloth can also be a hint of the secret, closed to the uninitiated in Freemasonry.

text:
At the ruins of the ancient Mayan city of Lubaantun, British archaeologists found a polished crystal human skull. Its size corresponded to the size of an adult woman's skull. It weighed about 5 kilograms.
 
The skull is made of a single piece of crystal, which consists of three joints. It is impossible to process such a piece of crystal, even with modern technology. It must collapse due to the internal stress of the material. In addition, in both Mexico and Central America, there is no deposit of rock crystal. Where did the Indians get it from?

text:
Shifts of the Earth's poles or the angle of its axis to the orbit have already occurred in the history of our planet.

This is proven by coal deposits in Antarctica and above the Arctic Circle. Hard coal is not taken from stone, if anything, which means that long ago, these areas were near the equator. This is also evidenced by other findings. The third Antarctic expedition to the South Pole excavated charred wood remains, leaf prints and lush vegetation that existed there 200-250mln years ago.

text:
The Jesuit missionary Martinius in the 17th century wrote a book called "History of China" based on ancient chronicles. In it he writes in ink on paper about the shift in the axis of the earth: "The pillar of heaven collapsed. The earth was shaken to its very foundations. The sky began to fall to the north. The sun, moon, and stars changed the path of their motion. The whole system of the universe came into disarray. The sun was in an eclipse, and the planets changed their paths."

Simply put, these annals testify to the global catastrophes of the past, the existence of which is completely ignored by modern official science.

A huge number of tektites!

In a nuclear explosion there is a rapid rise in temperature and near the source rocks and rocks begin to melt and evaporate, fusing into a vitreous formation.

This is exactly what was found during the excavations of Mohenjo-Daro, and the level of residual radiation there is still high. It would seem, what nuclear explosions in 1900 BC?

text:
Each time before landing, astronauts carry a small suitcase in one hand. These suitcases are connected by flexible tubes to the spacesuits and supply them with air. Mobile ventilation is needed because of the tightness of the spacesuit: vapor and its own heat production quickly create an unbearable climate and overheating.

A similar device on the bas-reliefs of the Sumerians and Mayans was called "bag of gods". Here it is enough that the Sumerians and Mayans lived across the ocean from each other and painted identical briefcases of their gods who descended from heaven. And remembering the modern analogue in the cosmonauts, the question of the origin of the ancient gods can be considered closed.

text:
The "Kiev synopsis" by Innokenty Gisel, archimandrite of the Kiev-Pechersk monastery, was the basis of the "Histories" of Lyzlov, Lomonosov, and Tatishchev. And it is always interesting to read the original source, even if it does not coincide with the opinion of modern historians.

On the origin of the Slavs and Russians: they are "the essence of one people, like the related Sarmatians and Roxolans. About the antiquity of the Slavs and Russians: they fought the Romans and Greeks 300 years before Christ, and received a charter from Alexander the Great, which claimed the Slavic lands in Europe for them. Let us add the record that "the Slavic-Russian prince Odonacer" seized Rome and ruled it for 30 years. Rome is ours!

Have you read something like this in modern history textbooks?

About the antiquity of the Slavs and Russians: they fought the Romans and Greeks 300 years before Christ, and received a charter from Alexander the Great, which claimed the Slavic lands in Europe for them. Let us add the record that "the Slavic-Russian prince Odonacer" seized Rome and ruled it for 30 years. Rome is ours!

Have you read something like this in modern history textbooks?
Forbidden Science

text:
The Kremlin in a painting by F.Ya.

Some debris lies directly on the road. The tower on the left has sprouted shrubs, on the building on the right, too. You can see the debris of the spire and, of course, the applied layer of silt and clay, as if it is a city after the disaster and settled quite recently.

On the right is a picture of the same author, huge stones have been removed from the road, the buildings have been restored, crosses have appeared, and the arch has been dug up a bit and made larger. Not to dig up tons of dirt from all over the city.

text:
St. Andre's Pyramid.
 
This ancient pyramid of Saint-AndrÃ©, more than 50 meters high and 200 meters at its base, was located northeast of Nice, dating back to 4000 BC and was an important historical record of European civilization on the continent before the Roman Empire and the emergence of Christianity.

However, despite its historical importance, the pyramid was completely demolished in the 1970s to make way for the freeway.

text:
Archaeology, paleontology, very important sciences that reveal to us the secret of life on the planet in the past. But sometimes the bowels of the Earth give out something amazing. Fossils - as each of us knows this formation occurred thousands and millions of years ago, and it makes no sense to oppose it, but it is also difficult to believe in the findings stuck in them.

Here, for example, a fossilized palm print of a man found in limestone, which is about 110 million years old. The question is, who could have imprinted his fingerprint as on the Walk of Fame, when man was not even a thing?

One would think it's a child - but no, children of that height and age have completely different body proportions, with the head taking up 1/5 of the body and adults 1/6. And where have you seen children with such proportions and height below the waist, and even next to a corpse walking freely, as it should be? What was going on there, in those days?

text:
Glass can be brittle and breakable, it can be bulletproof, but what about flexible glass that cannot be broken? It is mentioned in Pliny the Younger, Petronius and Dio Cassius, where it is said that a certain alchemist surprised everyone with his invention so much that it was delivered to Emperor Tiberius himself.

The inventor threw a bowl made of flexible glass onto the marble floor, it sagged slightly, and then the alchemist easily repaired the dent. Tiberius demanded to share the secret of creating the flexible glass, and after he refused, he ordered the execution of the alchemist, fearing that the glass would affect the value of gold and silver.

Cultural layers. Accumulated.

text:
The Fatal Connection between Abraham Lincoln and John F. Kennedy.

Lincoln was elected to Congress in 1846 and Kennedy in 1946. Lincoln was elected president in 1860 and Kennedy in 1960. Both were shot in the head. Both were shot on Friday. Lincoln's secretary's name was Kennedy. Secretary Kennedy's name was Lincoln. Lincoln and Kennedy's successors were named Johnson. Lincoln was assassinated in the Kennedy Theater. Kennedy was assassinated in a Lincoln automobile. Assassin Booth escaped from the theater and was captured in the attic. Killer Oswald escaped from the attic and was arrested in the theater.

text:
Attack on the Twin Towers and the Simpsons

The series came out in 1997. In this episode, Bart stands next to a magazine advertising $9 tickets in front of the Twin Towers. Together they form the date 9.11. Also, Lisa has a triangle of hair popping out, which many researchers associate with the pyramid of the All-Seeing Eye. And in Bart's hand is a bill bearing a symbol reminiscent of Freemason money.

In fact, there are many hints of an impending terrorist attack in this series, from the production number of the series to references to Jesus and the Pentagon.

On September 11, 2001, there was an attack on the Twin Towers in New York City.

text:
Discovered the horn of a dinosaur, only 30 thousand years old.

Everyone knows that dinosaurs went extinct about 65 million years ago due to a meteorite fall. However, during the excavation of the soil, which is about 30 thousand years old, archaeologists found the remains of Triceratops, in the form of a horn and some well-preserved bones.

The researchers sent the horn for radiocarbon analysis, which confirmed that these remains are about 35,000 years old. This finding refutes the theory that dinosaurs ceased to exist 65 million years ago. Scientists are trying not to widely advertise such findings, which every year becomes more and more.

text:
Traces of an ancient civilization have been found.

In the Arctic Circle there is a mountain Karnasurt, which is well known to researchers of ancient civilizations. The fact is that on this mountain was found a large number of amazing artifacts of an unknown civilization that existed on Earth long before ours, reports Chronoton.

On the mountain Karnasutra found basalt slabs with perfectly flat faces. Nature simply could not create such objects.

According to some versions, these are the remains of the mysterious Hyperborea, a mythical northern country. Interestingly, the name Karnasurt is similar to the Indian name, it is possible that it is in Sanskrit. The name of the mountain can be translated as "invisible ear".

text:
It is believed that one of the major modern conveniences, the sewer system, appeared to mankind about 3,000 years ago.

In the 1850s, a storm hit the Orkney Islands and when it passed, the residents saw stone structures sticking out of the sand. According to analyses, the 8 stone houses connected by tunnels are about 5,000 years old. There are beds, closets, bureaus, armchairs, storage drawers in each room, and each house has a toilet connected to a common sewer.

Yes, sewers are an indicator of development, but the people of the Scottish Orkney Islands had them a couple of thousand years earlier than the most advanced civilizations of Crete and Mohenjo-Daro.

text:
An ancient airport of the Mayan civilization?
 
As many know, the Mayan civilization at a certain point disappeared without a trace, leaving all the cities, and this fact history still can not explain.Besides all this, the civilization had a good knowledge of astronomy, the solar system and even described contact with extraterrestrial civilization

But the most interesting thing is the unique pyramids. Every major Mayan city has pyramids that are not found anywhere else in the world, namely with a platform on top. Well, the most important city of civilization, Teotihuacan, translates as "the place where the gods come from the sky," literally. What do you think, could these pyramids have been intended for an aircraft landing site?

text:
Gambia is home to the mysterious Yundum airfield, which NASA has chosen as an alternate airfield for landing its reusable Shuttles.

Gambia and NASA were lucky: the most costly part of the airfield - the runway - did not even have to be built, the carefully fitted monolithic stone slabs "have been there for centuries," as the locals say.

During the construction of the airfield they only laid asphalt and paved and marked it with a 3,600 meter runway, capable of receiving planes and shuttles of all weights and sizes. And who would have needed such a runway centuries ago?

text:
In 2008, in a coal mine in the Rostov region made a discovery that would shock the scientific world.

At a depth of about a kilometer (corresponding to the age of the rock of 300 million years) in the rock was a wheel. To get it out the miners failed, now the mine is flooded, and the researchers have not been called to the place (not to stop all work on the mining?).

Thanks to the ubiquity of cell phone cameras and selfies from one of the miners. No one asked how the wheel could ever have appeared at a depth of one kilometer? I won't say anything about the age of the rock.

text:
An explorer who came as a tourist to China noticed that the Beidongshan temple was strangely similar to the Egyptian temple of Osirion.

Stone locks between stacked blocks to block the entrance are found in all the corridors in Beidongshan. In Osirion the blocks are connected in the same way, moreover, it is believed that this method was used only in Egypt.

I would have thought it was built by the same people, with the same technology, but there is nothing in the history books about fraternal Sino-Egyptian peoples.

text:
American paleontologists found a dinosaur tooth of the Ceratopsidae family in Mississippi.

No, the fact that triceratops lived in Asia and western North America was known before, but the funny thing is that the tooth was found in the eastern United States. Historical background: it is believed that 68-66 million years ago, when triceratops lived, North America was divided into two parts. We conclude that since dinosaurs could move freely across the continent, it means that the idea that the continent was divided can be crossed out of the historical reference books.

text:
Archaeologists found the trunk of an ancient fossilized coniferous tree in Greece, on the island of Lepnos. Scientists gave the age as 20 million years. The question is - by what signs was it dated, if the tree is almost on the surface? Radiocarbon analysis doesn't work that deep into the past.

The trunk is also fossilized. Scientifically speaking, the fossilization process takes hundreds or thousands of years. But why hasn't the tree rotted away at the surface in that time? Wood is an organism that insects, microorganisms, and fungi feed on. In a humid climate, any trunk will turn to dust in a couple of years. Something got in the way and turned the organics into stone.

These are not the only examples. Petrified tree remains can be found all over the world.

Metal attachment

Continuing to talk about Puma Punku; it is worth noting that at this construction site, as well as at the Korikancha Temple, the ancient city of Ollantaytambo, Yurok Rumi and in ancient Egypt a special metal fastener was used to fasten the huge stones . Archaeologists have found that the metal was poured into grooves cut into the stones, which means that the builders had portable factories. It is unclear why this technology and other methods of building megaliths have been lost.

In 1925, N.A. Grigorovich discovered a large silicon boulder that resembled a human brain. The resemblance was simply striking: a furrow between the right and left hemispheres, in the "occipital part" of the find was the torcular herophili (the connection of the large sickle-shaped process with the cerebellum).

Geologist Milkovich estimated the age of the layer of deposits of the Mindel glaciation (i.e., at 450-500,000 years). Brains identical to those of modern homosapiens for walking half monkeys at that time steeply contradict the theory of Darwinism.

text:
In a Peruvian necropolis, in addition to the obvious artificial artifacts, scientists discovered an elongated skull 2,500 years old. The skull had a metal piece embedded in it. At first it was thought to be an exception, but a number of similar remains were soon discovered here.

Officials believe the metal inlay may be an indicator of the owner's status - other skulls have had bamboo and gold inlays. However, let's analyze the decorative insert on its own - the skull clearly shows signs of trauma, and metal plates are still applied to trepanation holes when the bone has suffered too much.

text:
The photos taken by the German expedition in 1938-1939 show the Gyantz Plain of Tibet, its ghostly walls and fortified entrance.

After the return of the expedition began a debate that lasted for many decades - are these formations natural? I do not know what arguments geologists, historians and scientists make, but, in my opinion, if there is an even straight wall, of the same width, with the same "towers" of the same height, separated by equal gaps - it is quite a man-made structure. I suggest that critics show at least one such creation of nature on the globe (after all, if nature created these walls in the Gyantz Plain, then there must be others).

text:
In 1991, geologists found small spiral-shaped parts in the sand samples of the Narada River. Then similar spirals were found several times in the Circumpolar Urals in the region of the rivers Kozhim and Balbanyu, as well as in Tajikistan and Chukotka.

Geologists have framed the orthodox story more than once and have done it again, sending the spirals for study. The results are fascinating - they consist of tungsten and molybdenum, and are between 20,000 and 318,000 years old. By the way, tungsten melts at 3,400Â°, and I can hardly imagine how these parts could have been made in the Late Paleolithic.

The final touch is a photo of the spirals under the microscope - the grooves with melted edges clearly indicate their man-made origin.

text:
If we stop perceiving myths as a sick fantasy of authors, they can lead researchers to sensational discoveries.

The clay tablets of Sumer named five cities that existed before the Flood: Eridu, Bab Tibir, Larak, Sippar, and Shuruppak. If the Flood was a fiction, then the cities must have been the same fiction. But there were archaeologists who were not such prejudiced skeptics and their efforts were rewarded - Eridu, Sippar and Shuruppak were found, and the excavations revealed traces of a great flood.

The notorious flood of which the Sumerian (and Biblical) texts narrate had as its basis a real event.

text:
The Roman cup of Lycurgus is about 1600 years old. It is remarkable in that when the light changes, the color of its walls changes from greenish to red.

First, its age is based only on the fact that historians believe that the first high results in the manufacture of glass and glassware showed the Romans, there are no other facts proving its creation in 4c.

Secondly, it has a unique composition. Per 1 million particles of glass - 330 nano-particles of silver and 40 gold, the size of only 50 nanometers. This explains how the color changes at different light angles, but does not explain how the Romans (okay, let's say Romans for now) in the 4th century AD were able to get nano-particles of the right size?

An explorer who came as a tourist to China noticed that the Beidongshan temple was strangely similar to the Egyptian temple of Osirion.

Stone locks between stacked blocks to block the entrance are found in all the corridors in Beidongshan. In Osirion the blocks are connected in the same way, moreover, it is believed that this method was used only in Egypt.

I would have thought it was built by the same people, with the same technology, but there is nothing in the history books about fraternal Sino-Egyptian peoples.

text:
Scientists believe that most of the Earth's surface layers were deposited slowly over millions of years. But there are many examples on Earth of fossilized trees vertically passing through stone.

The point is that the trees must have either been quickly covered by the earth, or rotted away. In other words, there is no way these layers could have been deposited slowly over millions of years.
 
The only explanation is that the tree was quickly covered with soft soil and it hardened along with it. Hence the question: what catastrophe caused tens of meters of earth to fall out all over the world? And most importantly, why are scientists silent about this catastrophe?

text:
The city of Mari was mentioned in many ancient documents, but it was searched until the 1930s. The city was destroyed by its famous neighbor, King Hammurabi, in the 2nd millennium BC.

Mari's excavations found 24'000 cuneiform tablets from the archives of the palace. Every single one settled in the Louvre collection (Syria was a French colony at the time of Marie's excavations). In the translation of the texts found, references to biblical cities and patriarchs were found.

The Vatican became interested in the translations, and after reading them, banned the publication of Marie's texts under the pretext that "the tablets could undermine the very foundations of modern world religions.

text:
Genetic disc from Colombia

An artifact 6000 years old, made of lidite. It is practically impossible to cut it even in modern conditions, as the stone is very crumbly. The images on the disc show the fertilization of an egg and the subsequent stages of embryo development. Scientists claim that the stone depicts the intrauterine development of humans with amazing accuracy. Some of the drawings have not been explained.

What civilization possessed the knowledge that our society discovered only in the 18th century? What was the artifact used for? What is depicted in the drawings that could not be identified?

text:
Manna from heaven is some kind of food that God sent to the Jews from heaven. Believers will see confirmation of God's existence, ufologists will see that UFOs handed Moses a food printer.

There is a simpler explanation. Manna can be found in the Sinai Peninsula export list, in the botanical reference book it is the plant Tamarix Mannifera. In 1823 the botanist G. Ehrenberg published an article, Symbolae Physicae, explaining that manna is simply the secretion secreted by tamarisk trees and bushes when they are attacked by a certain species of aphid found in Sinai. 

In 1483 Breitenbach wrote: "This heavenly bread falls almost at dawn and hangs in balls on the grass, stones and twigs. It is sweet as honey and sticks to the teeth" - it is picked at dawn because it is food for ants and simply melts in the daytime temperatures.

text:
Tibi Dam. Built in 1594.

The 42-meter dam was built incredibly competently for its year of construction - 1580. After 14 years the construction was completed. Not only is it arch and gravity-type - it is also located in the place where the river crosses a high rocky ridge. The dam rests against the rocky shoreline, and the pressure of the water is pushing against it.

Design institutes work on such structures. And all modern dams and levees are made of reinforced concrete. And here - stone blocks.

By the way, many modern dams are already deteriorating; they are either in an emergency condition or require constant maintenance.
And how many blocks had to be cut, moved and laid? And all this in 14 years.

Design institutes work on such structures. And all modern dams and levees are made of reinforced concrete. And here - stone blocks.

By the way, many modern dams are already deteriorating; they are either in an emergency condition or require constant maintenance.
And how many blocks had to be cut, moved and laid? And all this in 14 years.
Forbidden Science

text:
A 16th-century map of Africa from Castel Farnese.

In addition to the full-flowing rivers, lakes, and their basins, it shows the mountains that divide the continent, of which there is now no information either. Many towns on the coast of the Gulf of Guinea and in the interior of Africa. Even today's settlements in this area can hardly be called cities, and back then... Whose were they?

And the African coast of the Mediterranean Sea is rather empty, although, according to traditional notions, northern Africa was densely populated and there should have been dozens of cities.

text:
In modern Great Zimbabwe the remains of the old town of the early 12th century were found. We found traces of active trade, large-scale mining of ore, developed blacksmithing, which indicates an unusually high, compared to its neighbors, level of cultural development in the city. Well-designed planning of the city, separating fortified stone part and wooden "settlement" for poor people. Numerous stone temples.  

Simply put, poor hungry pygmies, as the Africans are now represented as, were not capable of creating such a thing. All the evidence adds up to a picture that there was an advanced civilization, of which, however, the history is silent. But you can read about the primitiveness of the population in any textbook.

Lately, the topic of buried first floors of buildings has been gaining popularity among people of absolutely different occupations, education, and social status. More and more people are beginning to ask questions, and trying to search for answers on their own.

What is this but evidence of a cataclysm? After all, no one in their right mind would bury buildings underground. And this means that something terrible has happened, which, as usual, has been hidden from us.

I wonder. Are there still people left who think and believe that it was the cultural layer that buried old buildings all over the world in this way?

text:
Mysterious pyramidal mountain in the Circumpolar Urals.

This mountain is located in the Circumpolar Urals. It is hard to believe that nature could create such regular geometric shapes.

The unusual mountain has caused many years of disputes among people. There is a group of people who believe that it is a man-made pyramid. Some journalists write that the size of the Ural pyramid exceeds the largest Egyptian pyramid - the Cheops pyramid.

Some people believe that it is left over from ancient civilizations. Looking at this mountain, it is easy to believe such theories.

By discovering wireless electricity, any scientist would rob the world oligarchy of money. There is no need for oil, wood, coal, gas, expensive hydro and power plants - one receiver can endlessly create energy virtually out of thin air.

Financial magnate Morgan instantly stopped funding Nikola Tesla's experiments when he came up with wireless power transmission and the extraction of energy "out of nowhere" - from the world's ether. After that, no one helped Tesla financially - the solidarity of the financial tycoons turned out to be like that of the thieves in the law.

text:
In 1945, a U.S. pilot saw a huge pyramid, and later an entire valley of pyramids in China, completely by accident, although previously it was of course not known.

Twenty years after that, the media mentioned the Chinese pyramids, but then at one point everyone forgot about them. And in the 2000s the Chinese government itself recognized the existence of pyramids.

But almost immediately a military base was established there and the territory became inaccessible for any research. Coincidence?

To this day it is not known what kind of pyramids in China, what was found in them, and how old they are? However it is possible to assume that China is not going to reveal these mysteries.

text:
Archaeologist Liana Suvalidis and her team stumbled upon a huge ancient royal burial complex in the Egyptian oasis of Siva.

The inscriptions inside were made in Greek by Alexander the Great's closest friend and associate, Ptolemy Lagos. He buried Alexander at the place indicated by him, and a pseudo-tomb was made in Alexandria for worship.

Sensation? Should we investigate further and try to find Alexander's body? Egyptian officials think otherwise - they broke the contract and prohibited any work on the site, and the Egyptian scientists simply ignored the inscriptions found.

text:
Scientists reliably know that 6,000 years ago, the Sahara was teeming with bodies of water, rivers-lakes, cities, and trees.

Looking at medieval maps, it begins to seem that scientists are somewhat confused about the dating. Up to the beginning of the 18th century, Africa was blooming and smelling, verdant with forests and fields, and apparently unaware that, according to historians, it had long ago turned into a desert.

Mistake of the cartographers? Excuse me, this territory over the centuries has been crossed by many peoples, traders and merchants know exactly where they go and which way they go on the map.

text:
A group of copper door handles was found in a 300-million-year-old coal seam.

The find immediately fell into the group of uncomfortable artifacts. Logically, what could be door handles, when the first reptiles walked on Earth and the dinosaurs were tens of millions of years old? The second logical question - how in general could objects get into the coal seams, which are located at a depth of about one kilometer?

No matter how you look at it, the artifact turned out to be uncomfortable for both historians and geologists.

text:
In the mid-1960s, a sword of Guojian was found in China from the 5th century B.C.

The sword is like a sword, were it not for one but two - the sword has a unique alloy, and the scabbard in which it was stored was fitted so tightly that it literally created an airtight environment.

An alloy of bronze, copper, tin, lead and iron added sulfur. Closer to the center, the blade contains more copper, which increases its flexibility and strength, while the edges have increased tin, making them tougher. A unique creation! A masterpiece! Which, according to historians, was made with a hammer and chisel only with a hammer, anvil and horn 2,500 years ago.

text:
The main position of skeptics and adherents of traditional history: if the catastrophe is not mentioned anywhere, it did not happen. There is no evidence of floods and cataclysms in the annals of the 16th-17th centuries, and that's it.

But I do not agree - there are more than 600 references to the flood from different peoples, including the indigenous peoples of Russia. They do not write about them in textbooks of a history that is logical, in fact the history of separate peoples especially did not interest anybody, except for representatives of these peoples, and expansion of Russia on the East to Siberia has not been directed on preservation of culture of subdued peoples. So it turns out that the stories of the arrival of the "great water" have different peoples from the Caucasus to Siberia, the buildings are covered with soil with traces of silt, and in history books about them not a single word.

text:

"Psychomotor disorders are observed in the first hours and days in all cosmonauts upon return to Earth".

Let's compare photos of American astronauts and descriptions of Russian cosmonauts. Have they just returned from space, having been in weightlessness and cramped conditions for 6 days? It is a pity that Russians do not smile into the camera and wave - after returning from orbit a person can at best move around on all fours until the organism re-adapts to the conditions of Earth's gravity.

So where did the Americans come from?

And this in a cave that has never been a seabed! Archaeologists have discovered four disasters that befell not only the cave itself, but also the man who lived in it.
 
What did the Mayans say? We are the fifth civilization living on Earth, and the previous ones were destroyed by cataclysms?

text:
Overlaying old maps on modern terrain, finding old Tartarian cities would be difficult. How can you not believe in pinpoint strikes on the planet when perfectly flat craters are at the site of each city?

In Siberia, such sinkholes often become "devil's lakes". In Mongolia, on the other hand, rivers and lakes often dry up and the craters clearly show that only flat land, different in color from the surrounding area, is left in place of the city. Space bodies enter the atmosphere at an inclination, and to imagine that thousands of fragments fall all over the planet at right angles, leaving a crater of 5-7 km. is something from the realm of science fiction. They didn't manually tear down the mountains and earth with a shovel, did they?

text:
Nazca Lines, Peru, Nazca Plateau

Under the heading "The world's oldest structures with unsolved mysteries".

A 47-meter spider, a 93-meter hummingbird, a 134-meter eagle, a lizard, an alligator, a snake and other zoomorphic and humanoid creatures... Giant images from a bird's eye view seem scratched into the vegetation-free rock, as if by one hand, in the same style. In fact, these are furrows up to 50 cm deep and 135 cm wide, made at different times in the V-VII centuries.

text:
No decent structure can be built without mathematical methods. Many dams built since 1900 all over the world have a single problem - they crack and fall apart, they regularly have to be either repaired or rebuilt, and entire institutes have worked on them.

Could it be that the quality of our education has fallen? Or are today's engineers all hackers and lack the knowledge to build a dam that will stand as reliably as the Tibi Dam, which has been holding back the river reliably for 5 centuries?

text:
Ancient cell phone

A few years ago in Salzburg, archaeologists found an unusual object. It is a clay mold, which resembles an ordinary cell phone. The inscriptions on the object are in cuneiform, which means that the object came to Austria from Mesopotamia. Theorists claim that the Salzburg artifact proves the existence of a time machine, and some argue that the find directly proves the existence of UFOs and that they visited the Earth in ancient times.

text:
An ancient map of the galaxy.

The galactic disk is a map of our universe, with an exact marking of the solar system, several thousand years old.  Scientists could not give an exact answer as to what it was and why it was intended. 

However, they agreed that the shape of this object, painfully resembles our galaxy, and the risks left on it, correspond to our position in it. Perhaps this is just a bunch of coincidences, but then what is this object?

text:
Cipher from Chaboro.

Look from afar at the 18th-century Shepherd's Monument in Staffordshire, Britain, and you might mistake it for a sculptural reproduction of Nicolas Poussin's famous painting The Arcadian Shepherds. But look closer and you'll notice a strange sequence of letters DOUOSVAVVM, a code that hasn't been deciphered for over 250 years.

text:
5 Russian spies

Sometimes life is stranger than fiction. This is true in the case of author Norman Mailer. When he wrote his novel Barbary Shore, he added a secondary character of a Russian spy to the story. As Mailer wrote more, the Russian spy's role in the story grew larger and larger, and eventually he became an important character. The strange thing is that after the novel was finished, the U.S. Immigration Service arrested the Russian spy who lived just one floor above Norman Mailer in his apartment building. The spy was Colonel Rudolph Abel, and he was reportedly one of the chief spies working in the United States at the time. One might say that this is a strange coincidence. Or maybe Mailer somehow sensed that there was a Russian spy near him... No, it's just a strange coincidence.

text:
If the love of the ancients for stone constructions is quite understandable, the way of their extraction makes one puzzle. Those traces that remain on the mountains, stone quarries and megaliths do not give answers to the question "How? Officials are happy to assign these traces as a natural phenomenon.

For example, straight, flat notches in the mountain that are tens of meters long. Weathered? Collapsed? Hollowed out with a bronze chisel?

text:
In what is now Algeria are the vast ruins of the ancient Roman city of Timgad.

According to the offversion, the emperor Trojan in the 1st century founded Timgad for the veterans of the Parthian campaign (the war between Rome and Parthia). And then the first question to connoisseurs is: where is Mesopotamia and where is Algeria? Why not leave the veterans in the conquered territories? The second question, purely domestic, as we like to do - who built it in the foothills of the Atlas Mountains, if it is even now a sparsely populated territory with hundreds of kilometers between small towns. And back then? And where did the supplies come from? The Roman Empire never had any problems with land, so why build in a remote place that was hard to reach, hard to supply, and hard to control?

text:
Will we ever know the real age of the Great Pyramid?
 
It is generally believed that the pyramid was completed in 2540 B.C. However, some scientists question this theory because of the inventory stele found at Giza. The text carved on it says that Khufu did not order to build, but only to restore the sphinx. In addition, modern research shows that the furrows on its body are the traces of precipitation, and this level was the last time in this place 8 thousand years ago. 
 
So how old is the Great Pyramid then, if the sphinx is considered a later structure than the pyramids themselves? There is no answer!

text:
Siberian Megaliths.

Everyone knows Stonehenge, but no one knows that researchers are finding megaliths all over the globe. In the harsh Siberian regions were found not just freestanding boulders, but real stone cities. Huge buildings are assembled from different-sized Lego pieces.

Ancient masonry similar to that used by the ancient Egyptians in the construction of the pyramids. While everything is clear with the Arabian cones, in the case of the Siberian stone cities there are more questions than answers.

Why did ancient people need such huge stone walls? From whom were they defending themselves? How could they pull on themselves heavy boulders? Finding the answers would take too much time...

text:
The Patom crater was long thought to be the result of the Tunguska explosion. When scientists studied the trees growing on its slope, it turned out that they appeared before the meteorite impact, but, instead, they witnessed... A nuclear explosion?

Judging by the annual rings of trees, in 1845 in the crater area there was a fivefold increase in the radioactive isotope in the wood, which lasted for several decades. The same pattern is observed in the nuclear test area. The reasons for the increased background radiation at a time when nuclear research was out of the question are still not clear.

text:
Alien in a painting by Leonardo da Vinci.

There is one painting by the artist that has recently attracted considerable attention. We are talking about his work "John the Baptist". Researchers have placed a mirror perpendicular to this canvas. And what did they see? In front of them appeared the image of a strange creature, reminiscent of an alien. His eyes, nose, and the shape of his head were indicative of this.

What did the artist want to say? He lived in the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries. It is clear that at that time no UFOs were heard of.

text:
Pyramid in Bosnia.

This finding is so fantastic that the official science flatly refuses to recognize it. Because, having agreed that in the center of Europe there are ancient pyramids, similar to the Egyptian pyramids, we have to come to the conclusion that the history of our planet was not at all the same as written in history textbooks.

Under the 1.5 meter layer of earth, on which grows trees and shrubs, there are huge stone blocks, tightly docked one to another. Moreover, excavations were carried out at different points of the mountain, and everywhere under the soil layer there was a stone base. In addition, an aerial photograph showed that the sides of the mountain are perfectly straight and form angles of 90 degrees.

text:
Three ingredients are needed to make gunpowder: saltpeter, sulfur and coal. There has always been coal in China. Until the 18th century, native sulphur was only available at the mouth of the volcano Etna, in Sicily. The nearest deposit of saltpeter was on the island of Ceylon. Of the entire Mendeleev Table, only saltpeter and sulfur can be components of black powder, all other fast-acting substances are explosive, and any cannon would be blown to pieces if used.

How could China invent gunpowder with only 1 of 3 components?

text:
Take a look at the painting called "The Suicide of Saul," which was painted in 1562. So people knew about dinosaurs back in the 16th century?

If you look closely, you will see 3 dinosaurs in the center of the painting, with riders sitting on them. Many people would think they were camels, but they weren't.

The ancient legends of many nations mention dragons. If you go into detail, this mythical creature is very similar to dinosaurs. In other words, dragon is the folkloric name for a dinosaur. 

How could these ancient animals get into myths and legends, if, according to the generally accepted scientific theory, dinosaurs became extinct tens of millions of years before the appearance of man?

text:
The opening of a Chinese tomb in Taiyuan city has given people a find in the form of a gold sarcophagus from the Tang dynasty. The official position of scientists is that the gold coffin has not been opened until now because scientists fear that the contents will react with the air, oxidize and turn to ashes. 

Sounds reasonable, in contrast to the second part of the description of the precious sarcophagus - a red silk bow is still wrapped around the coffin. So the metal sarcophagus has oxidized over 12-15 centuries in the ground, but the silk ribbon has not? Silk is known for its durability, unlike metals!
