text:
Every fairy tale has only its share of fairy tales.
 
In today's world, the word "fairy tale" is understood as something invented. But it's not that simple. "A tale" is an oral narrative about something, a story or event told. 

My point is that Russian fairy tales should be taken more seriously. They have a lot to tell. 
 
I came across an original picture of the tale "Repka" published in 1863 by folklore researcher A. N. Afanasyev. In addition to the familiar characters, in the picture we see the legs of giants. The fact is that mentions of giants is absolutely everywhere - from European engravings and frescoes to entries in the diaries of different people. But the story is written differently and there are a lot of inconsistencies, they don't tell about this in school. 

Relatively recently there may well have been another civilization on earth, which was much larger.

P.S.
In 1860, Afanasiev published a collection of Russian Folk Legends, which was withdrawn from sale by the censorship.

text:
10,000-year-old cave paintings depicting aliens in the Indian state of Chhattisgarh.

The caves in which the paintings were discovered are located about 130 km from the city of Raipur, between the settlements of Chandeli and Gotitola.

The paintings are made with natural colors which have not faded in spite of the past years. The figures have practically no nose, large eyes and a narrow slit of the mouth. In general, they resemble the classic portrait of an alien, as it is shown in the movies.

text:
The territory of Mexico holds many mysteries and mysterious artifacts. And now one of these artifacts has been found, which by its existence raises very uncomfortable questions.

The artifact itself is a stone tablet that was found in a cave during excavations. The tablet depicts a tall figure with thin limbs but a large head. On the head are convex eyes, a flat nose, and a small mouth. It remains a mystery who was depicted on the stone.

At the moment, the excavation site is classified to prevent theft and looting, because there have been such cases before.

text:
200 years ago Russia had a subtropical climate?

As strange as it may seem, but there are many obvious inconsistencies and facts in the history, which are completely contrary to the official chronology. There are many such facts, but for starters it is fruit not typical of many parts of modern Russia. Well-known Pushkin wrote about pineapples, which he tasted at the landlord in the Kaluga region.

Also about 300 years ago there were vineyards, not only in the southern cities as now, but in Russia in general. In St. Petersburg, for example, there were palm trees, as well as in Moscow. Now, all this can be seen only in some southern cities. But most interestingly, in the Pskov chronicles there were mentions of crocodile attacks in 1581.  But if you consider these and other facts, what could have caused the climate to change so much over several centuries?

text:
"Waffle Rock," located on the shores of Lake Jennings Randolph. There seems to be nothing special about it, but if you look closely at the outlandish, regular geometric pattern, many questions arise. The imprint on the rock is controversial, whether it is a geological formation or a remnant of ancient technology. According to some scientists, this huge piece of rock could have originated 300 million years ago.

Those who have seen the rock are confused by its construction and composition. The lines are so parallel and so smoothly polished that it is hard to imagine that it could have been produced by natural phenomena. To this day, no one knows for certain for what purpose, by what or by whom this structure was created. Everyone offers their own theory, trying to explain the incredible origin of this piece of stone.

"Three hundred he placed in the heavenly watch...
And on earth he placed six hundred."

text:
The mystery of the ancient map, which is several hundred years ahead of its image. 

The Piri Race map still leaves many questions. 

This map of 1500, is still a mystery to many scientists. Even the simplest person who has only seen an Yandex map will probably ask himself: How was it possible to create the present earth 500 years ago? 

If you dig a little deeper, a number of other questions pop up, one of which is: How did the cartographer manage to create a map of America, if at that time it was only known about it by hearsay? 

It is worth noting that some of the lands on the map, in those years was not known to people at all. They were discovered decades after this highly accurate map was created. Antarctica was discovered three centuries later. But most surprisingly, the subglacial continent has the clear outlines of today. Many scientists agree and believe that the map was made thanks to data from other civilizations.

text:
The mystery of the ancient iridium mask 12 thousand years old

Amazing artifacts of antiquity are causing a sensation not only among people, but also among scientists. When an old mask made of an unusual unearthly metal was found, many hypotheses were expressed.

But none of them could explain how ancient people managed to extract iridium from a cosmic body.

The mask was found in Florida. The uniqueness of the mask lies in the fact that it is made of the rarest metal - iridium. There is no such metal in the bowels of the earth. It can only be found in meteorites that fell to the earth's surface.

Experts have determined the age of the mask. The age of the mask was determined: about ten to twelve thousand years. The mask is very fine work and many archaeological experts are surprised at the technological process used in the manufacture of this artifact.

text:
Welding technology was known in the 19th century, but apparently was not considered as effective as riveting. They fastened everything from pipes to bridges to ships with the same ease as nails to wood. They were somehow melted into even the hardest-to-reach places, even though they were made of steel.

Today, such a perfect connection can only be achieved with a CNC riveting press. But you understand yourself - it's difficult, expensive, and also noisy and vibrating. But how did our ancestors do it?

In the old pictures there is a riveter's tool, to which some kind of hose is attached. Apparently, this device melted the rivet and firmly seated it in the hole of the joint, requiring no helpers, no time, and no effort.

text:
A puzzle for scientists was found in Shelbyville, Illinois, USA. The town was founded in 1827, which is very recent by historical standards.

How the town ended up 4-5 meters above ground is a mystery. It seems that it was built recently, the sea and oceans are far away, typhoons do not reach the center of the country. There is, however, a lake about a kilometer from the city, but in order for it to reach the city and turn it into a small Atlantis, it will take a whole sea of water to pour into it.

The excavated structure itself is also impressive - the arched openings, columns, and red bricks seem vaguely familiar. In most of the excavated cities, surprisingly, the buildings are built as if from a template.

text:
Slavic Vendian village in Germany survived to this day. The main feature is the circular construction (Circular Villages)

The Slavic peoples in the 8th-9th centuries occupied huge territories, reaching as far south as the Byzantine Empire and as far west as the Kingdom of the Franks.
All of the Pomerania and most of present-day Germany were inhabited by the Polabian Slavs. They were so named for their residence on the Elbe River, which the Slavs called the Labe. They plowed the land, kept cattle and were engaged in trade along the rivers.

It was the Polabian Slavs who founded the city of Berlin. All cities with the accented ending in -in,-ov-its-au refer to Slavic names. Berlin, Schwerin, Witzin, Lubov, Teterev, Lutov, Kemnitz, Dobranitz, Lubenau, and Torgau are all Slavic names.

text:
The Rosenthal Effect

A psychological phenomenon in which a person's expectations of the fulfillment of a prophecy largely determine the nature of his actions and interpretations of the reactions of others, which provokes the self-fulfillment of the prophecy. 

For example: a group of college students (none of whom knew each other) were divided into pairs. One person in each pair, chosen at random, was given special information: some students in the pair were told that their partner liked them, and some that they didn't. The pairs of students were then given the opportunity to meet and talk to each other. As the researchers predicted, those students 
who thought they liked their partner were nicer to their partner. They were more frank, disagreed less on the topics discussed, and were generally more cordial and agreeable than students who thought they did not like their partner.

In 1937, a census was conducted in the Soviet Union. After it was completed, it was classified and those responsible for it were arrested.

It was supposed that more than 165 million people lived in the USSR at that time. In fact it turned out that the population was not more than 162 million people. 

Where several million Soviet citizens disappeared to remains a mystery

Are these really the remains of Atlantis?

In May 1968, divers discovered thousands of enormous flat limestone blocks in the sea off the coast of Bimini, Bahamas. All of them were neatly stacked, forming a road more than one kilometer long. You must agree that nature itself could not have created anything like this without human intervention.
This is interesting: Some researchers believe that these blocks are the ruins of an ancient civilization, while others call them an amazing natural phenomenon. But then how can one explain the prophecy made by the great soothsayer Edgar Cacy? Back in 1938, he said the following: "The ruins of the lost Atlantis will be found in the depths of the sea off the coast of Bimini... It will happen in 1968 or 1969. The prediction came true with amazing accuracy.

text:
The painting "The Miracle of Snow". The late medieval work of the talented artist da Panicale is linked to the past of his native country, Italy. According to legend, it was a very hot summer in 4th century Rome. People were no longer hoping for rain. But suddenly it snowed. This was seen by the townspeople as a miracle sent from heaven. The event made such a big impression on his contemporaries that an artist decided to paint a picture in honor of it 1000 years later!

At first glance, it would seem that there is nothing unusual on the canvas. So people thought until the mid-twentieth century. It is not difficult to guess that now some researchers say that we have in front of us the image of UFOs. For ufologists this is an additional reason to remind the public of the importance of studying hypothetical contact with alien life in the distant past. According to their logic, humanoids come to us not only today, but also did it centuries ago!

Albert Fernick's 1888 photo of the Eiffel Tower is photographed in an unfamiliar way. It's not the angle, but the stone base of the tower.

"On the ruins of the old world we will build a new world."

text:
Vorontsov Palace in Alupka was built in the 1820s from a particularly hard stone dolerite (old name - diabase). 

Dolerite is such an interesting material with a hardness of 6-7 on the Mohs scale. To make it clearer, the material of hardness 6 is taken with a file, while the hardness 7 is taken only with a diamond. You can translate into more understandable units of hardness. In other words, with what force you have to press the chisel so that it enters the material and can be machined. 

As you can see, diabase is 6 times harder than marble, 2 times harder than granite and 62% harder than such a stubborn material as basalt. To build buildings out of it means the same thing as to build out of diamonds. The material is so hard that it is usually used for paving roads, such as Red Square. 

Get it? In the early 19th century, wild serfs scraped the rock with diamond scrapers and the Vorontsov Palace turned out.

text:
The Lake of Death

This place is not far from Pereslavl-Zalessky. The lake is famous for the fact that every year a large number of tourists drown there. And those who have managed to get out, say that as if from the depths someone is pulling down. But the strangest thing is that to date not a single body has been found. The locals try to avoid this strange place, and certainly none of them can be made to swim in the terrible lake. The old-timers tell how they once saw a man who had swum to the middle of the lake and then suddenly just disappeared somewhere. All that was seen were air bubbles on the surface of the water. And then, on the same day, but only at night another person disappeared. To date, no one can give an explanation for this phenomenon. By the way, even divers don't dare dive into the depths of the scary lake.

The old-timers tell how they once saw a man who had swum to the middle of the lake and then suddenly just disappeared somewhere. All that was seen were air bubbles on the surface of the water. And then, on the same day, but only at night another person disappeared. To date, no one can give an explanation for this phenomenon. By the way, even divers don't dare dive into the depths of the scary lake.
Forbidden Science

text:
What is medievalism?

The first Latin phrase recorded in 1469 is "media tempestas," where the word tempestas means not just time, but "a time of storms, cataclysms," that is, it conveys the clearly negative nature of events of the preceding time period. 
Then appears the form "media antiquitas" (1494), "middle antiquity," the interval from about the middle of the thirteenth to the middle of the fifteenth century. In French, the word antique, like antico in Italian, came into use in the fifteenth century; it comes from Latin, but in Latin "antequos" means "before any event. 

And here's an interesting coincidence. 
In the 14th century, because of constant storms, seafaring in the Atlantic ceased.Since that time, people began to build dams and dikes - in Holland and in Moscow! Excavations near the Borovitskaya Tower of the Kremlin have uncovered a four-tiered dam. Traces of the "Dunkirk Transgression" remain in northern Germany - silt-covered forests and villages.

54'174 temples, 25'593 chapels, and 1'025 monasteries. As of 1987, only 6,893 remained. So 7,3884 structures were destroyed or remodeled. This is an effective destruction of history and erasure of memory!

text:
Among the photos of late Qing dynasty Beijing, we found a photo of a non-standard tower - a classic Chinese roof resting on a huge, massive building with thick walls. By the way, the photos, to the misfortune of historians, were signed - Tower of the Tartarian walls. 

And where, excuse me, the wall itself? It is frightening to imagine how big it must have been, if one of its towers looks like an armored wall. How was such a miracle erected, and why is the roof of the ancient building overgrown with shrubs?

text:
What they read to children at bedtime is nonsense. Real Russian fairy tales are different: smarter, more interesting, and scarier. 

Baba Yaga is a hunched over old woman with a blue hooked nose, uncombed hair, and a dead leg. She is dressed in a shirt without a girdle, and her eyes burn red. Yaga's hands are dry, bones come out of her body in some places. She lives alone in a dense forest in a hut on chicken legs.

"Dremuchy Wood" in Russian legends means death. Yaga's hut is on a crossroads, but the entrance from the forest, i.e. from the world of death. In the past Kur'ya Noga was called a fork in the road, a bad and dangerous place where evil spirits gathered. Chicken legs" were also used to stand poles smoked by smoke and to put the "house" with the ashes of the deceased on them, without windows and doors. 

 Baba Yaga is not a human being, she is a dead man and lies in a coffin, so "her nose is in the ceiling".

text:
A cyclist on the wall of an ancient temple in India

The fir tree will touch a quite ordinary bas-relief. You can easily recognize the cyclist on it. And everything would be fine, except that the sculptor's work is not one thousand years old!

India is famous for its ancient temples. They are not hundreds of years old, as in Europe, but thousands. They attract the attention of tourists from all over the world. One of them is called the Panchavarnaswamy temple. It was built about 2000 years ago. On its walls and found a bas-relief, which has attracted so much attention not only professional researchers, but also ordinary tourists and travelers.

The fact is that bicycles were invented in the XIX century. In the ancient world, they could not know about them. But what if modern historians are wrong?

text:
The image of an astronaut on a medieval temple

If you look at the figure, you can easily recognize the astronaut in it. But how could this be? After all, the temple was built at a time when travel into space was out of the question. And even if someone made such assumptions, then how in that era could know about the spacesuits? The science of that period had not yet reached the understanding that one could not be in space without special equipment.

In fact Athens is no older than St. Petersburg, built exactly the same way on more ancient ruins and at the same time - in the nineteenth century. The French geographer and historian Jacob Reklin, a member of the Geographical Society of Paris, wrote in one of his works, black and white, that King Ludwig of Borussia

Attention!

For those who have forgotten or do not know, let me remind you that Greece as a state came into being on March 25, 1821. And Greece was preceded by the creation of its "ancient history," which was written in advance, beginning in the second half of the eighteenth century. text:
What is it all coming to?

It's no longer just on TV how long it will take for nuclear missiles to reach, BUT also...

German authorities, against the background of the crisis in Ukraine, declared the need to "reactivate" bomb shelters and advise citizens to stockpile food for 10 days.  The authorities also advise to have a stock of necessary medicines at home.

We would also like to remind you that the Danish authorities decided to purchase 2 million iodine tablets "in case of a nuclear accident in the immediate vicinity" of the country's borders, because "the world is unpredictable" (news from April 11, 2022).

The figurines are not badly preserved, as they turned out to be about 17'000 years old. The problem is that at that time civilizations did not even exist yet.

text:
Until recently, it was considered impossible to extract DNA from mummies because it was believed that embalming destroyed the deoxyribonucleic acid. More recently, however, scientists have been able to develop a new method that allows DNA extraction.

They first tried the method on Neanderthals, and then moved on to mummies. As a result, they got the genes of more than 80 mummies, among which were the pharaohs. Detailed study of the genes shocked the scientific world, because as it turned out - the pharaohs have nothing in common with the Egyptians. Moreover, all ancient Egyptian rulers were Caucasoids.

The innovative method has pleased the scientific world and has strongly upset the government of Egypt. Authorities have reacted negatively to information about the color of the pharaohs, they believe that "white" deliberately change the history and heritage of Egypt, in order to assign it to themselves.

text:
The Williamson Tunnels in Liverpool.

Are a vast network of underground structures of unknown purpose, according to Wikipedia. They are believed to have been created "for no apparent reason" by tobacco merchant, landowner and philanthropist Joseph Williamson between 1810 and 1840, who bought the land and hired former Napoleonic soldiers for secret work.

But they were only excavating something that already existed.
Although they are called "tunnels," they are brick or stone vaulted galleries with halls.
Backfilled in the late 19th century with trash (used as a city dump), the dungeons remained inaccessible until 1995, when archaeological research began.

text:
The tapestry called "Summer Feast" was created in Bruges (capital of the province of West Flanders in Belgium) around 1538. Today it can be seen in the Bavarian National Museum.
 
It is famous for depicting very UFO-like objects that hover in the sky. Judging by the numerous depictions of flying machines in this and other paintings, and even the references in the Bible, the ancients flew safely and were not such savages.

text:
Underground cities

In different areas of the planet Earth periodically find ancient buildings. And if in 2009 we knew about only four underground cities, now it is said about a hundred. They are located on different continents, though most of them are located in Eurasia.

For what reason the cities, which could live up to ten thousand people at the same time built underground? According to the position of the scientific community, this was done for safety. Like a refuge in a war, only much larger. It is assumed that underground cities were built by peoples who did not have their own armies to hide there.

text:
Mosaic from the ancient Roman city of Palestrina. 100 BC.

It depicts a recognizable dinosaur (similar to iguanodon). The inscription is easily readable in Russian "crocodilopardalik". Pardus or pardalik was a leopard in Ancient Rus. Two proofs in one: the proximity of "extinct" reptiles to humans and the Russian writing before the Cyrillic alphabet.

text:
In 1638, the English antiquary, mathematician, and astronomer John Greaves visited Egypt and published the first ever study of the pyramids. He was also the first to sketch a cross-section of the pyramid of Cheops.

Greaves saw with his own eyes the descent from the entrance, the ascending corridor, and the galleries into the chamber of the king and queen. But is it possible to stand in a 46-meter corridor and not see the vaults above your head, which are about the height of a three-story house?

I assume that at the time the pyramids were witnessed there was no such vault. I cannot explain otherwise the through embedded cast-iron staples fastening the stones of the vault, about which Egyptologists keep tactfully silent. Egyptians, of course, are advanced guys, but the pharaohs did not think of cast iron. But who dug inside the pyramid and why rebuilt the space is a question.

text:
What confuses me about the settlement map of the first people from Africa? The explanation is that at some point in their migration, the first people sailed across the Earth's largest ocean in primitive watercraft (boat, raft, canoe, and all around the ocean - beautiful!). 

Looking at the blue arrows: can you imagine cruising Papua New Guinea to Hawaii 55'000 years ago? How did they navigate such a vast expanse? Officials like to talk about navigating by stars, but excuse me, how can you use the stars to find islands in the middle of a vast ocean if you don't even know they exist?

text:
Millions of years, the level of oxygen in the atmosphere of the planet was about 40% (according to the analysis of air bubbles inside the amber), now it is not higher than 20%

Oxygen level is higher, gravitational force is slightly lower, let us add warm climate (all officially recognized by traditional science) and we obtain that in ancient times there were all conditions for the flora and fauna of that time to reverberate with gigantism everywhere. 

However, if images of gigantic animals, plants and temples of incredible size are the norm and do not raise doubts about the credibility of historians and scientists, then all images of people of gigantic stature are metaphor, fiction and "so painted".  Logic? There is none.

text:
Vorontsov Palace in Alupka was built in the 1820s from a particularly hard stone dolerite (old name - diabase). 

Dolerite is such an interesting material with a hardness of 6-7 on the Mohs scale. To make it clearer, the material of hardness 6 is taken with a file, while the hardness 7 is taken only with a diamond. You can translate into more understandable units of hardness. In other words, with what force you have to press the chisel so that it enters the material and can be machined. 

As you can see, diabase is 6 times harder than marble, 2 times harder than granite and 62% harder than such a stubborn material as basalt. To build buildings out of it means the same thing as to build out of diamonds. The material is so hard that it is usually used for paving roads, such as Red Square. 

Get it? In the early 19th century, wild serfs scraped the rock with diamond scrapers and the Vorontsov Palace turned out.

text:
In St. Petersburg in Peterhof there is the so-called Ruin Island. Officially it is believed that, during the construction of the Engineering Castle, left "extra" columns and, on this island, from them erected artificial ruins in the style of an ancient Greek temple.

Why and why it was necessary to do - history is silent, although, it is obvious to everyone that it makes no sense. So the mystery of these ruins clearly requires another explanation.

text:
Marco Polo's book of travels was published in 1298 and was one of the few works that influenced the course of history. Much of the book is devoted to the Caesars of Tartary. This miniature from the book is called "The Counting Court of Kublai Khan".

Three bearded tartars in Russian caps at the table accepting gold - two count, the third gives out paper receipts. And what is this tale of paper money they tell you? Did Catherine introduce it? Well, well... Tartary used paper money back in the thirteenth century! And notice that all Tartars had European faces.

This is not Siberia "not historical", it is historians who know little about it.

text:
The fireplaces in the old photographs from the 19th century.

They don't look like they have wood burning in them. Do they?

It's impossible to heat a room that size with a fireplace. Only if you burn wood all the time. But everyone knows how much waste is produced by burning, don't they? Ash, dust and shavings from the wood, soot. And around the wooden floor and a painting on the fireplace, which from the constant high temperature will dry out and crack.

Where near to store firewood in such a volume that it would be "tossed"? Only the round-the-clock carrying of firewood by servants, probably. 

The furnishings and finishes of the fireplace do not suggest such utilitarian use. 

It is interesting to understand the meaning of the word "fireplace.
It's a verb - come in.
to enter, come in, come in, come in, come in, come in, come in, come in, come in, come in, come in.

text:
A divine tool that easily cut stone and iron.

Judging from the texts, it was a divine tool for working stone-the Shamir Worm (Solomon's Shamir). It could cut any stone, iron, and belonged to the devil Asmodeus before Solomon (Solomon only later got hold of it). It was with this tool that Solomon was able to build his famous "Temple to One God.
There are various interpretations of this "worm" (see above). But none of them give an idea of what it really was.

 In the end, it is some kind of tool (extraterrestrial?), which received the highest assessment of its capabilities from the local population, but the "natives" were not able to describe exactly how it worked.

text:
Until recently, it was considered impossible to extract DNA from mummies because it was believed that embalming destroyed the deoxyribonucleic acid. More recently, however, scientists have been able to develop a new method that allows DNA extraction.

They first tried the method on Neanderthals, and then moved on to mummies. As a result, they got the genes of more than 80 mummies, among which were the pharaohs. Detailed study of the genes shocked the scientific world, because as it turned out - the pharaohs have nothing in common with the Egyptians. Moreover, all ancient Egyptian rulers were Caucasoids.

The innovative method has pleased the scientific world and has strongly upset the government of Egypt. Authorities have reacted negatively to information about the color of the pharaohs, they believe that "white" deliberately change the history and heritage of Egypt, in order to assign it to themselves.

text:
How the USSR moved houses with their occupants

Soviet engineers loved to surprise their Western colleagues. For example, they moved houses weighing several thousand tons. Together with their basements. Without shutting off water and electricity. And the main thing - while the tenants were sleeping peacefully in their apartments.

They usually lifted the house with jacks and then set it on a new foundation on rails. Thanks to engineering findings it was possible to expand central Moscow streets and preserve historic buildings.

text:
That's how they do "marble" floors now, no one cuts or adjusts anything. They just made a screed, poured grease, and polished it. That's it. Well what fool would spend half his life to cut out of natural marble some statue or floor for the "temple" if they can either mold or pour?

Hence the perfect joints, impossible forms and industrial scale of Egyptian and ancient structures and sculptures. Remember also the armatures inside the statues in previous posts. Why only historians attribute a chisel and hammer to these "savages" is unclear.

text:
The Dance Plague.

In July 1518, Mrs. Trofeya began dancing, and she could not stop. A week later, 34 more people danced with her. A month later, the total number of dancers reached several hundred. They danced nonstop, resulting in 400 deaths from exhaustion, heart attacks and strokes. 

No satisfactory scientific explanation has ever been found for the phenomenon. None of the theories explain the incredible stamina required to dance for days without stopping.

text:
The horse-drawn streetcar (horse-drawn carriage)

Proof that electricity was used by Mankind much earlier than official history tells us. Think about it, how irrational is it to invest huge sums in the reorganization of the city, only to move the passenger flow was not on a flat road, but on the rails?

After some cataclysm, the ability to support the transportation infrastructure with electricity disappeared, while the railroad tracks remained, and, logically, these tracks were used by traditional horse-drawn traction.

The photo of Chicago, supposedly after the fire, looks more like the carpet bombing of Hamburg, Dresden, or Stalingrad.

text:
A vase that is 500 million years old?

One day in Dorchester, Massachusetts, a Precambrian rock (more than half a billion years old) was blown up, after which a metal object resembling a bell was discovered. But, in fact, it turned out to be a vase. And this vase was decorated with decorative elements in the form of flowers and vines, inlaid with silver.

What have we here? Another multi-million dollar nonsense. There is no other way to call it. What kind of vase was made 500 million years ago? Dinosaurs made it? Scientists like to stretch everything, showing us our long history and, at the same time, their incompetence. But the fact is, in 500 million years, they never learned how to make similar vases so they wouldn't rot away from time. The vase is clearly much, much less old, but how did it get inside the rock? There are questions, no answers.

text:
Everyone knows that Genghis Khan was a Mongol with an appropriate appearance: broad cheekbones, slanted Asian eyes. But look at how Genghis Khan is portrayed in European prints. There are several portraits of Genghis Khan in Marco Polo's Book of the Diversity of the World. Including the moment of his coronation and death. And everywhere - a man with a typical Caucasian appearance! The original book is preserved in the French National Library. The year of publication is 1264.

Marco Polo made a long journey to Asia. He knew exactly what the inhabitants of different countries looked like. So why did the great conqueror of all time turn out to be a European rather than a Mongoloid?

text:
Mysterious illuminations of the 18th and 19th centuries

They were used as an amusement performance and they were quite common. The use of fire is out of the question here, otherwise everything would catch fire in a jiffy, and fires, in those days, were feared no less than the plague. 

Looking at the engravings, there's no doubt that this is electricity. And the light is not coming from individual candles, but from the entire structure as a whole, in places with the highest concentration of electric field. The incandescent lamp was invented only at the end of the 19th century (1878), but what was lit in the 18th century is unclear.

text:
In Egypt there is an ordinary city of Zawiet el-Erian, just 2 pyramids and 5 tombs. But if the history of Egypt can be traced back thousands of years, this city is unknown who was built, as well as all its megaliths, underground level and pyramids, intended for an unknown pharaoh.

Stairs leading down from the surface led to the underground part of the city, to a huge granite sarcophagus that was half-built into the wall. In the construction of the pyramids were used granite blocks weighing only 40 tons.

In 1960, almost all territory of the ancient city was given for the military base, apparently, it was very convenient place for building. In 1964, all excavations were banned, and the city and its artifacts were inaccessible even for Egyptian research.

text:
In India, the villagers of Peramalla Padu have found and excavated an ancient temple, which, for the past 80 years was under a layer of sand. It is believed that it was built about 200 years ago. 

The elders said the sanctuary was completely buried under a layer of silt and sand when the Penna River changed its course. It happened so quickly that the locals did not have time not only to save the temple itself, but also to remove the relics from it. And only now, on their own initiative, have the villagers excavated the temple. By the way, during the excavations, the villagers came across a statue of Shiva. The find has already attracted the interest of scientists.

You can see that they didn't dig up the whole temple, but only the top of it. How deep would a river have to be to bring the whole temple and for what reason did it change its course?

text:
In 1920, Edward Lidskalnin bought a plot of land and built Coral Castle on it. He made, transported and installed the huge concrete blocks, weighing 30 tons each, by himself, by night, by lantern light.

When questioned, he replied: "I learned how the Egyptians and ancient builders in Peru, the Yucatan and Asia used primitive tools to lift and install stone blocks weighing many tons!" He took this secret with him to his grave, leaving scientists to continue puzzling over the mystery.

text:
I was reminded of Jonathan Swift's "Gulliver's Travels" (upper left picture). It's a funny fairy tale for children, quite famous, and I think most people have heard of it.

Except that it was about 20-25 years ago when I was a kid. Now I see huge doors, engravings of giants, majestic buildings, and the thought creeps in, "Did the author really make up this fairy tale or was it all real?"

Also in the story there is a line "We thought it best to stick to the old direction, rather than deviate more to the north, as in doing so we could be carried to the northwestern regions of the Great Tatary (!!!) or the Arctic Sea. So, think now...

text:
Science confirms that the crust of the mid-ocean ridges is the youngest, near the shores at the bottom is the oldest. When trying to superimpose Mercator's map of Hyperborea on the modern globe, the details did not fit together. But if you splice the map, impose it without the ocean floor, only with the shelves, then Scandinavia fits perfectly, Novaya Zemlya stands on the modern position, the coasts of N. America and Taymyr are also approximately in their place. 

Mercator's map of the 16th century showed that Iceland moved to the South over the centuries, Greenland was slightly turned around. Parts of Hyperborea: Svaga and Rai are now the northern part of the island archipelago of North America. The southern part of H'Ara is the Novosibirsk Islands. Franz Josef Land is also x'Ara. Spitsbergen is part of Thule. Each continent has inherited a little from ancient Hyperborea due to the movement of tectonic plates.

text:
Mavro Orbini referred to Bernardo Giustiniani and his History of Venice when describing the history of the Slavs:

"Then an indomitable Slavic tribe first invaded Istria and reached the outskirts of Venice. This tribe of Scythian origin, attacking with other tribes in the Roman Empire, has earned itself a glorious name for military prowess.

Slavs of Scythian origin? Considering that the Scythians officially died out in the 4th c. AD, and the Slavic ethnogenesis developed no later than the same 4th c. in the same territories, the relationship of the Slavs with the Scythians is quite real.

text:
Finding against history: lakes drained in China.

The Floating Dragon Caves were discovered after pumping water into a lake thought to be bottomless. The discovery of man-made structures completely contradicts history: the entrance to the underground structures was made thousands of years ago. Presumably, the caves were created during the Qin Dynasty, i.e. in 221 BC.

The average area of each of the 24 caves is more than a thousand square meters. The technology of excavations of such volume remains unknown. And in the historical sources there is not a single word about the construction or about the very existence of the caves.

text:
It could have been 1724. Mankind has lost 297 years of through history

This was stated by the German historian Herbert Illig. In 1911 he published an investigation which stated that the loss was due to regular changes in the calendars of different peoples, due to misinterpretation of documents or deliberate falsification. 

The most interesting failure was found in European history from 618 to 907. For example, the structures of the 9th century AD do not differ from those of the 10th century. There is no documentation of the rise of Islam in Persia and Europe during this period. There is no record of Jewish actions during the great upheavals-these 297 years are "missing" from many civilizations.

text:
How were pipes, bridges, and ships fastened with rivets in the 19th century? 

These rivets were even melted into hard-to-reach places, even though they were made of steel.

Today, this kind of perfect connection can only be achieved with a CNC riveting press.

In the old pictures there is a riveter's tool with some kind of hose attached to it. Apparently, this device melted the rivet, seating it firmly in the hole of the joint. No helpers, time, or effort were needed.

text:
At the bottom of Lake Tiberias (or Lake Kinneret) in Israel, a stone pyramid was accidentally discovered. Its size is impressive - 10x70 meters, and its weight is not insignificant - 60,000 tons. In our time there are very few ships, which weigh as much.

If not to believe in ancient divers, the pyramid is not less than 4000 years old (after this date the lake is well traced in history, it does not become shallow and does not dry up, how to build here?) Even by the standards of the officials, this means that in ancient times there was a highly developed civilization on the territory of Kinaret. Who else could have built a structure of this size without the help of special equipment? 

The matter is complicated by the fact that no such civilization has ever been heard of here. Yes, there were settlers, but there were still a couple of thousand years before the exodus of the Jews from Egypt and the secrets of pyramidal construction had not yet been revealed.

text:
The remains of 16 human hands, 3,600 years old, were found in Egypt 

There is a myth that soldiers cut off the right hands of their enemies to get gold in return. 

If you look closely at the bones, you can see abnormally long bones compared to a human hand. 

Assuming that the soldiers were caught by a tall man with long bones, how can one explain an entire pit with such exhibits.

text:
The American Devil's Tower consists of faceted formations and is 386 m high. According to the official version, it is magmatic recrystallized rock with sandstones, siltstones and shale interlayers.

Here officials could specify more precisely, how this may be an igneous rock, if it contains sandstones? The pillars look quite fantastic, reminding of the plant world, although I have associations with the quarry excavation - horizontal traces, vertical sections, selected rock around the mountain...

text:
Darwin's Theory 

We are often told that humans evolved from apes, even demonstrating a similarity in skull structure and 98% similarity in DNA. But not once have historians found transitional forms, because if man has gone through many stages of evolution, then there must be plenty of remains of transitional forms from ape to man.

Another funny thing is that our DNA also matches 98-99% with the pig, so maybe we are descended from pigs, according to the logic of scientists? But as we know, in all our conscious time, not a single monkey or pig has ever evolved into a human being.

text:
In the 19th century, at least four languages were studied. Here is Lenin's certificate

To these languages Lenin also learned English, Italian, Polish, Czech, and Swedish on his own.

Or, for example, Vladimir Dahl. The same one who published the explanatory dictionary. Russian was not his native language. His father Johann Christian Dahl, a Dane, knew eight languages: German, English, French, Russian, Yiddish, Latin, Greek and Hebrew. My mother knew five languages.

Such knowledge is considered genius nowadays.

text:
Giant Women in the 19th Century

This photo, "Giant Women on the Road to Raarsu," was taken in 1897 by Dr. Hughets. 

There are at least three tall women in the picture. The central one is 22 years old and is 230 cm tall. The lady on the right is over six feet tall.

Judging by the unique exhibit from the National Museum of Natural History of France, not only traces of Patagonian giants are missing from history.

text:
The photo shows the Sabu Disk from the Cairo Museum. 

Officials think it is a vase, although no Ikea has ever seen anything like it.

Okay, let it be a vase, but how was it made 5'000 years ago? Without CNC machines, without diamond nibs and drills, a token made of stone, with a cylindrical protrusion in the middle, where the wall thickness is accurate to the millimeter, and the finest stone blades are perfectly symmetrical and contain not a single tool mark.

The second question is why, with such a magnificent level of workmanship, other mummies were deprived of such a remarkable creation? Or did they have one single master for the whole Egypt, who died of happiness after creating the "vase" and took all the secrets of craftsmanship with him?

text:
In the case of the discrepancy between the modern appearance of the Tsar Bell and its old images on the engravings, another detail was found. 

On the lower edge of the upper pattern we can see traces of metal cutting. Hence the disappearance of the mats at the emperor's feet, and the king changing his turban for a crown, and the change in the appearance of the figures. Although officially no changes were made to the bell, only cleaned and restored. Nice restoration that destroyed the images.

Where was Amazonia and its warlike Amazons from ancient Greek legends? Those who think it was near Greece are wrong.

If you look at the scale of Fra Maur's map of 1459 , Amazonia falls approximately in the middle of the distance between the Caspian Sea and the Arctic Ocean, i.e. approximately on the triangle Syzran-Kazan-Nizhny Novgorod.

text:
In 1996, the journal Science published the results of a study of the meteorite ALH-84001

Isotopic dating shows that the 4.0-4.5 billion year old Martian rock fell to Earth near Antarctica 13,000 years ago

Scientists found microscopic fossils resembling traces of substances produced by decomposing microorganisms. 

Critics were left unhappy with their size. The bacteria found are 100 to 1,000 times smaller than typical terrestrial bacteria.

As usual. If a life form does not resemble Earth's, then it cannot exist.

text:
During excavations at the site of the bridge across the Yenisei, Krasnoyarsk and Novosibirsk archaeologists discovered a section of railroad laid, according to the official version, in the 1890s. No one can explain how the stretch turned out to be not only abandoned, but also under a thick layer of soil. 

To imagine that a person could have backfilled it on his own, willingly, is now impossible. Both rails and sleepers have always had and still have great value. The track sections that have not been used for a long time are usually dismantled to find a second life on private farms, or to be melted down. Consequently, we can talk about some kind of natural disaster: a flood, a village, etc.

text:
Salbyk barrow - Khakass Stonehenge.

Salbyk burial mound is located in the tract Salbyk, 60 km from Abakan in the Republic of Khakassia. It is often compared with the English Stonehenge, although the Siberian mound is much larger. And these plates raise many questions. The fact is that the height of some of them is 8 meters, and weighs about 60 tons.

Moreover, they were mined in the quarry, which is located 50 km from the mound. And it is absolutely unclear how exactly these multi-ton boulders were delivered here many centuries ago and how they could be installed in an upright position.

text:
After the Aral Sea dried up, the remains of an ancient temple were found at its bottom. Archaeologists who arrived at the site found that the structure refers to the 11th-14th centuries A.D. and that, oddly enough, it is a copy of the Yasawi mausoleum in Turkestan. Not far from the temple found were burial sites of warriors, also found workshops for the production of pottery for construction and entertainment.

The remains of people and cattle were found randomly scattered, which suggests that they died in a fairly short time, and this death was sudden. And there was no one to bury them. It turns out that the Aral Sea is not drying up, and this is not the sea at all, but the consequences of flooding.

text:
About lost technology: in 1920, engineer Royal Rife created the world's first ultraviolet microscope with a 50,000x magnification that allowed a live virus to be seen. Fifteen years later, Rife created a frequency generator - resonating with the frequency of the virus, the radiation struck the pathogenic microflora without damaging the surrounding tissue. 

Fourteen fully documented cases of complete healing of cancer patients and "American Medical Association" has achieved the cessation of research in this area, the use of his generator in the United States banned.

Experiments with the frequency generator were repeated by our contemporaries, confirmed the simplicity and effectiveness of the method to combat viruses and pathogens, but for some reason official medicine again refused to recognize the development.

The post is not about medicine, but about technology, which science does not allow to people.

text:
ID2020 is a prototype digital identity system. The project is supported by the UN and is part of the Sustainable Development Goals initiative.

According to the idea of the project, by 2030 it is planned to provide all people on the planet with a digital ID. The international document will contain all information about a person, including his place of work and education, as well as biometric data confirming his identity (fingerprints + iris).

A pilot version of the platform was completed in 2020, integrating all existing identity record-keeping systems. All this information will be stored using blockchain technology, that is, in encrypted form in a distributed database.

text:
Forgotten technology from the past

The first pedestrian died under the wheels of a car in 1896 - the "lucky woman", who opened the million-dollar statistics, was a resident of London Bridget Driscoll. The speed of the car that hit her was "insane" by the standards of that time - about 13 kilometers per hour, which was twice the maximum allowable limit. After this incident, engineers from all over the world began to think about how to keep people safe with a ton of cold metal moving on them.

One of the technologies that was supposed to prevent accidents on the roads was a bucket that opens with a button.

text:
Siberia without forests. Photos from the 19th and early 20th centuries.

There were few forests in some areas of Siberia even in the early 20th century, and those that were there were not as dense and impassable. And if we conclude even deeper, looking back into the past, then Siberia was completely devastated both humanly and in other biological components, and this catastrophe occurred quite recently on a chronological scale. Otherwise, we would have seen here in the early 20th century huge thicknesses of humus, peat bogs, impassable thickets, tall and voluminous pines (as tall as sequoias), taiga everywhere.

Google "19th century Siberia photos". You will see many photos from the late 19th century, with trees just beginning to grow.

text:
The largest known European two-handed battle swords are kept in the Leuwarden Museum in Friesia, the Netherlands. The total length of the sword is 2150 mm! Weight 6600 grams! Produced in Passau, Germany. In the middle of the 15th century.

Presumably this sword belonged to the rebel and pirate Pierre Gerlofs Donia, known as "Big Pierre", who, according to legends could cut off several heads with it at once.

text:
Argentavis is the largest flying bird known to science.

The Argentavis magnificens is the largest flying bird known to science. According to scientists, this extinct giant weighed 70 kg and was about 2 m tall. In addition, the bird had huge wingspan of about 7 m!

More than 6 million years ago, the Argentavis inhabited the central and northwestern part of Argentina, where paleontologists discovered its fossilized remains. As with the behavior of almost all extinct species, not much can be learned about the life of this bird. 

Interestingly, the life span of Argentavis was probably about 100 years and, having no enemies, these birds usually died of old age, disease, or accident.

Even with the version "opened the door from a horse" - at this height of scuffs, there should have been a rider not on a horse, but on an elephant.

text:
Something about St. Petersburg

Interesting old French postcard from the middle of the 19th century. More of the artist's imagination? That's what our "historians" will probably say? It looks like it was during the flood, and when the water came down and the ground dried up a bit - there was this (2 photo). The 3rd photo is an inscription on the first card in the old French language, which was translated by a professional translator. 

It says: "In many years to come, when new peoples will be changing, what a surprise will be for the traveler who dares to go to the ancient North Sea. He will be forced to halt his vessel before the gigantic figure of the King, towering over the ruins of a great city and barely crossing the remains of a castle. He will discover, standing alone, amidst the rushing shafts (waves), the Alexander Column, confirming once more the unconquerable glory of the immortal and Independent in Russia."

text:
Everyone knows the Great Wall of China, but for some reason few know about the Great Wall of India, which was built even earlier. This wall surrounds the fortress of Kumbalgarh, located in the west of India. It was once called the "guardian of death", or the "eyes of Mewar".

The length of the wall is about 36 km, in some places it extends up to 8 meters.  Despite numerous attempts, the wall has never been destroyed during the wars and the fortress was taken only once, and that by the fault of a traitor who sent water to Kumbalgarh.

text:
Kidnapped Liberia (Library)

It is believed that the Library of Ivan the Terrible held the treasures of the lost Library of Alexandria: the True Vedas, the unknown creations of Homer and Aristotle, the real texts of the Bible and the Fifth Gospel, as well as hundreds of scientific manuscripts and books. 

In 1600, the Greek Uniate Peter Arcudius, a European spy, visited Moscow in search of a library at the behest of the Vatican. Times of Troubles were beginning and the books may have been taken to Rome and hidden in the papal archives. Was it not on the knowledge stolen from Russia that the so-called technical and scientific progress of Europe in the 17th-19th centuries arose?

text:
The mysterious ghostly walls of Tibet

The photos taken by the German expedition in 1938-1939 show the Gyantz Plain of Tibet, its ghostly walls and fortified entrance.

After the return of the expedition began a debate that lasted for decades - are these formations natural? I do not know what arguments geologists, historians and scientists make, but, in my opinion, if there is an even straight wall, of the same width, with the same "towers" of the same height, separated by equal gaps - it is quite a man-made structure. I suggest that critics show at least one such creation of nature on the globe (after all, if nature created these walls in the Gyantz Plain, then there must be others).

text:
In 2000 in Novgorod, archaeologists found the oldest Russian manuscript - three wooden boards covered in wax and completely written with psalms, which became widely known and were called the "Novgorod Psalter. Judging by the radiocarbon analysis and the inscription that in 999 the monk Isaacius was made a priest in Suzdal, this book is the oldest example of Slavic writing. 

A few years ago, an exhibition of Novgorod archaeological finds was held in Sweden. A leading Swedish newspaper summarized the event as follows: "When our ancestors carved runes in stone, the Slavs were already writing letters to each other. So who is the uneducated barbarian here?

What could it have been if mankind had no flying machines in those days? A more intelligent life form? This fact is officially documented, the documents are in Switzerland, the city of Zurich.

People described it as an aerial battle. It was followed by the appearance of a large black triangular object and then, its crash outside the city.

What could it have been if mankind had no flying machines in those days? A more intelligent life form? This fact is officially documented, the documents are in Switzerland, the city of Zurich.
Forbidden Science

text:
Chang Baori Well

Chang Baori Stepping Well (India) is located away from hiking trails. Its depth is 30 meters, the well has 3,500 stairs made of immaculate blocks. Resistant to earthquakes. It was built in the 9th century. According to local legend, it was created in one day by "white spirits". There are no quarries or traces of construction. Its official purpose: to collect groundwater. 

Let's turn on our heads, engage logic and imagination: stairs have no handrails, water carriers would be exposed to deadly risk. In addition, water stagnates and is dangerous to health. The structure resembles a silo launcher. The standard depth of modern rocket silos is 30 meters.

text:
The facts are adapted to different civilizations.

In the photo you can see two babies: Horus, the god of ancient Egypt, on the left, and Jesus on the right. And besides the scene depicted, they have quite a lot in common. Here are some facts for you.

Horus - born to the virgin mother Isis in a cave, Jesus was born to the virgin mother Mary in a manger (a stable for cattle).

Horus was born by the star Sirius, and Jesus was born by the "star in the East."

Horus tried to kill Seth, but Isis fled to the island of Chammis, and Jesus tried to kill Herod, and Mary fled to Egypt (!).

Neither Horus nor Jesus was married or had children.

What is my point? Because the coincidence of so many facts of life (and there are many more) is not coincidental. Perhaps it is the same moment in history, described by different people and adapted for different peoples and adapted to their realities...

text:
An 1892 bipolar Edison fan.

What an artifact! The fan is not powered by the mains, but by direct current. And the current is obtained in a system of several inductor coils with a closed magnetic core. The fan screw is supposed to rotate EVERYTHING, and the regulation is set with a golden lever. A neat design, just brilliant!

The very fact of existence of such mechanisms, a little more than a century ago, is just a mockery at the stupidity of modern akademics.

text:
Acambaro figurines. Mexico

A collection of figurines found during excavations, which began to be collected in 1944 by archaeologist Woldemar Julsrud. To date, there are 37,000 pieces. Of these, about 2,500 figurines depict dinosaurs. It is known that dinosaurs walked on our planet for tens of millions of years before the first humans.

There are two possibilities: either they are fakes (why?), or dinosaurs and humans lived at the same time, and it was not so long ago.

text:
Anna Yaroslavna, born somewhere in the 11th century. The youngest of the three daughters of Prince Yaroslav the Wise of Kiev. Consort of King Henry 1 of France and Queen of France. Also known in West European historiography as Anna of Russia.

A prime example of how they change history before her eyes. Before the change was written "Anne of Russia, Queen of France.
After change "Anne of Kiev, Queen of France.

Apparently, modern restorers know better who Anne was than Anne herself and the sculptor who made the statue.

text:
This map was purchased by Chinese collector Liu Gang in 2001 at an antique store in Shanghai for $500.

It is dated 1763 and bears the inscription: "This map was drawn by Mo Yi Tong, a Qing dynasty subject, during the reign of Emperor Gong Li in 1763 from an original map of 1418. The Chinese map, however, already shows both Americas. And both coasts, both west and east. And this is 74 years before Columbus arrived there.

text:
And again about 9/11. 

There are a lot of strange details on the cover of one of Michael Jackson's records. This album was released shortly before the 9/11 tragedy. Now for the details:

- Look at the checkered floor. This is a sign of the Freemasons. The checkered floor often decorates the rooms where Freemasons gather.

- Behind Michael's back is New York City and dust clouds. If you look at the recordings after the September 11 attacks, you can see that all of New York was covered with dust.

- The singer's feet are positioned exactly where the two twin towers are.

- But the most interesting thing is the hands. Imagine in your mind the face of a clock and arrange it around Michael Jackson. And it turns out that one of his hands is pointing to 9 o'clock and the other to 11 o'clock.

Conclusions are up to you!

text:
Historical math and calculations for the temple of Angkor Wat:

Built sometime in the 12th century, the area is 162 hectares, three times the size of the Vatican.

Of the tools for construction and processing - a pick, shovel, cart and the hands of grateful workers. By the most conservative calculations, the workers would have had to mine-work-get-deliver-stack a ton of stone in a minute.

The historian is not a builder and not a mathematician, he is not engaged in boring calculation of volumes. They could have attributed at least some technology and equipment to the Khmers, so as not to get out of the slender history.

text:
In 1780 Catherine II signed a decree on the establishment of the city of Perm. In the official history of our country before that date there was no city with that name.

But on the Western map of 1596 the city already exists, and even it is known when it was founded. Paragraph from an English historical treatise: "...town of the name of Permevelic, the city of Perm on the Kama, for this was onl founded in 1568". There's also Tyumen next door.

text:
Tibi Dam. Built in 1594.

The 42-meter dam was built incredibly competently for its year of construction - 1580. After 14 years the construction was completed. Not only is it arch and gravity-type - it is also located in the place where the river crosses a high rocky ridge. The dam rests against the rocky shoreline, and the pressure of the water is pushing against it.

Design institutes work on such structures. And all modern dams and levees are made of reinforced concrete. And here - stone blocks.

By the way, many modern dams are already deteriorating; they are either in an emergency condition or require constant maintenance.
And how many blocks had to be cut down, moved and laid? And all this in 14 years.

text:
Tmutarakan Stone. Russians in the Crimea 400 years before the appearance of the Crimean Tatars

The Tmutarakan stone is a marble slab with a Cyrillic inscription in Old Russian carved into it. It was found in Taman, ten-fifteen meters from the sea. Here in the summer of 1792 the huntsmen of Suvorov built a redoubt to protect the wharf. And adapted the found large marble block as a threshold of their barracks. Here a mysterious inscription and saw the commander of the huntsmen. Currently, the stone is stored in the State Hermitage Museum in St. Petersburg.

The inscription reads: "In the summer of 6576, indiction 6, Prince Gleb measured the sea from Tmutarakan' to Kerch, 30,054 fathoms". That is, in the year 1068 prince Gleb measured the sea on ice from Tmutarakan' to Kerch, measuring the width of the Kerch Strait between the two parts of his princedom.

text:
In 1996, researchers discovered an interesting phenomenon in China. Pipes were coming out of the Baigongshan Mountain. It is clear that man in ancient times could not do this, too sophisticated technology would have to be used. But who had something to do with it?

The official position of scientists is that the trees have eventually fallen under sediment (it often happens in the mountains), there flowed water, filled with elements of iron. It covered the trees, forming something like a shell. The trunks and branches of the trees gradually turned to coal, but the iron shell remained.

Can you imagine the trees themselves arranged in even rows, clearly one above the other, three big trees and one smaller one in a row? Although in nature there is a process of calcification, when the biological tissue accumulates metals or turns into a mineral, but nature is not a loader, it will not stack logs according to a ruler.

text:
The buried Hermitage in St. Petersburg

Here is the Hermitage. Note - the first floor is much lower than the second and looks down-to-earth. And the windows, the very windows that were supposed to be above the ground, are sunk into it almost completely. Many halls in the Winter Palace are below ground level. Who would have made submerged rooms in a swampy area? 

Moreover, a semi-basement is knowingly more expensive than the first floor. It is always cheaper to just make a foundation and put the first floor on it than to arrange a second-grade room and waterproof it.

The third picture is an example of what a palace should look like.

text:
During the excavations of Harappa and Mohenjo-Daro, skeletons were found in the streets of the cities. People were simply lying unburied in the streets of the city. What could cause such a situation? There were no visible signs of violent death. These skeletons are among the most radioactive ever found, with radioactive levels 50 times higher than normal.

Another curious sign of the ancient nuclear war in India is the giant crater near Bombay, a crater 2154 meters in diameter, located 400 kilometers northeast of Bombay.

No traces of meteorites were found nearby, although this crater in basalt originated from the impact. The pressure from the impact was over 600,000 atmospheres and was accompanied by heat, causing glass balls to form in the basalt.

What was it? A nuclear explosion or an unexplained natural cataclysm?

text:
If you need a loupe and an expert to determine where on the rock is a natural chip and where are the traces of primitive tools, the traces of rock processing in Ollantaytambo put the official science in an awkward position. 

Instead of traces of chipping with some chisel, we see almost polished surface at the place of rock separation. Suppose the Incas separated the rock and then polished the quarry walls? Absolutely useless work.

There is a possibility that the stones were carved with high-tech tools, but this version is no longer satisfactory to scientists.

text:
Several hundred dilapidated megaliths and structures have already been found in the Urals and the Old Lens quarry fits in too well with the legacy of old civilizations

Officially, talcumagnesite was mined here. All quarries show traces of excavation at the bottom - at the Old Lens the bottom is evenly tiled. All over the world, quarries are built with a ramp to take out tons of soil - the Old Lens is built with steps. The official theory says that a certain engineer came up with the technology to cut the bricks of rock right in the quarry. But talco-magnesite is mined in the form of powder, and the equipment in the quarry is not designed for cutting bricks.

Since 1974, the quarry was mothballed and until 2017 regularly pumped out the water that filled it. But, as soon as in the early 2010s people began to take an active interest in the quarry and put its photos on the Internet, the pump suddenly failed and sunk the quarry.

text:
For a long time now I have been thinking that "modern man" and "18th-19th century man" are very different creatures. Modern man is more like a hybrid of "that" man with some kind of primitive creature, maybe an ape.

Previously, people created, read books, poetry, went to the theater, had beautiful cities, houses with stucco and columns, courtyards decorated with fountains and statues. 

Now people live in concrete chicken coops with tires in their yards, they don't read books, and their entertainment is TV, YouTube, games, and booze. The worst thing is that they are happy with everything, some people are so used to it that they don't even want to hear that it is time to change something in their lives. 

People themselves have become more like talking monkeys in their pants.

text:
On Catalina Island in the Pacific Ocean, the remains of people whose height exceeded that of mankind were often found. If you don't look at the abundance of photographic collages online, the main evidence remains newspapers and magazine clippings mentioning finds of extraordinary size.

For example, the excavation of Ralph Glidden that was written about in the newspapers. The largest Catalina Island skeleton found was 290 cm long. The question that all those who have actively researched its history have come to is, where are these skeletons today? The same newspapers say that Schlidden gave the skeletons to the Museum of the American Indian in New York, but they were never exhibited, remaining in the storerooms.

text:
Mosaic from the ancient Roman city of Palestrina. 100 BC. 

Depicts a recognizable dinosaur (similar to iguanodon). The inscription is easily readable in Russian "crocodilopardalik". Pardus or pardalik in Ancient Rus was called a leopard. Two proofs in one: the proximity of "extinct" reptiles to humans and the Russian writing before the Cyrillic alphabet.

text:
While before the advent of DNA analyses, historians claimed that all elongated skulls were obtained by humans through artificial deformation, modern studies of the genome of the Paracasan skulls disagree with this.

The skulls are a quarter the volume and 60% heavier than normal human skulls. The structure also differs: Paracas skulls have one parietal surface, while human skulls have two.

The director of the Paracas Museum of History sent five samples of hair, skin, teeth and skull pieces for genetic analysis and it turned out that the mitochondrial DNA, which is inherited from the mother, with an unknown mutation that does not occur in humans, primates or any other animals. Simply put, this is an entirely new humanoid creature, a far cry from sentient man, Neanderthal man, or Denisovian man. 

I do not know if these people will find a place in the genealogical tree of modern man, but the skulls from Paracas are not going to fit into the theory of linear evolution.

text:
Photos of Moscow in 1852.

First of all, Moscow is white stone. This is very unusual. 

In the photo there are unmaintained streets and buildings, dirt in the very center of the city. And this is, after all, the heyday of the Holstein-Gottorp-Romanov Empire.

Most confusing is the fact that only 40 years have passed since Napoleon's fires. Why is the city, its very center, so shabby? It is a dilapidated city that did not survive the cataclysm and has not been rebuilt for 20-30 years. That is exactly the impression I get.

text:
New York City above and below ground, 1913.

At a time when for most people (look how the adults and children pose, although photographing the street) a camera was something absolutely fantastic, the builders built this "fork" underground. 

Of course this is not a sewer and the people themselves are photographed "for the memory" in this tunnel. Because they themselves are shocked by the discovery. What brickwork! How precisely the radii and angles are aligned and observed. Such precision is necessary for a sewer! Yep.

text:
A large root system has been discovered under Devils Tower in Wyoming.

A huge and startling discovery was made at Devils Tower in Wyoming. Scientists from the Wyoming State Parks Department were conducting photographic seismic readings under the tower when they discovered an incredibly large fossilized root system under the tower. The Parks Department released a statement saying, "We discovered what looks like a giant root system flowing from the base of Devil's Tower. The root system has been measured to a depth of 6.5 km. and a width of about 13 km. We are currently conducting research and tests to confirm that it is indeed a root system and not a coincidence." This discovery is on the verge of rewriting history and science as we know it.

text_entities.text:
A large root system has been discovered under Devils Tower in Wyoming.

A huge and startling discovery was made at Devils Tower in Wyoming. Scientists from the Wyoming State Parks Department were conducting photographic seismic readings under the tower when they discovered an incredibly large fossilized root system under the tower. The Parks Department released a statement saying, "We discovered what looks like a giant root system flowing from the base of Devil's Tower. The root system has been measured to a depth of 6.5 km. and a width of about 13 km. We are currently conducting research and tests to confirm that it is indeed a root system and not a coincidence." This discovery is on the verge of rewriting history and science as we know it.

text:
The official version of the origin of Baikal is that the lake is of tectonic origin. It is the deepest on the planet. But studies have revealed a number of structures, which could not have been explored by other means before. 

It was possible to find out that the southern part of the lake has a rather strange relief: the bottom of the depression goes down relatively flat along the eastern shores and very steep along the western shores. Against the background of these studies, we can assume that the slopes of the depressions are completely unnatural and look more like a quarry excavation.

text: Robert Hubert, French painter (1733-1808). He is known for his picturesque fantasies whose main motif is parks and real majestic ruins, many sketches of which he made during his stay in Italy. Robert's paintings were highly valued by his contemporaries. His paintings are represented in the Louvre, the Carnival Museum, the Hermitage in St. Petersburg and other palaces and estates in Russia, in many major museums in Europe, the United States, Canada and Australia. There are many questions about what the painter painted on his canvases, but historians did not bother to summarize that this is only the "imagination" of the author and considered the topic closed.

text:
The golden mask of the pharaoh Tutankhamun, shown by X-rays.

Until recently, archaeologists believed that the mask was made of a single piece, but it was a loud bombshell when this mask was X-rayed.

And the surprise was that this mask contained more than one piece that was welded together by a very precise welding process, invisible to the naked eye, then everyone was stunned by the knowledge and advancement of past civilization in alloys and goldsmithing.

text:
Megalithic stone versus modern technology.

In human history, larger stones have been lifted and moved, such as the lower blocks of the Egyptian pyramids, the trilithons of Baalbek and Stonehenge. Where did the car driver go wrong? Judging by the descriptions of the transportation process in antiquity from our historians, modern people have the wrong tactics. They should have taken wooden skids, tied them with string and hauled them with a human engine. Then they would have had no problem getting the stone to the place.

text:
The Lost City of Shicheng

This Chinese city has stood safely on the surface for more than twelve centuries until the Chinese government decided in 1959 to create an artificial lake called Qingdao, known as the Lake of a Thousand Islands.

The construction of a hydroelectric dam resulted in 573 square kilometers of land being submerged. The islands that remained on the surface of the lake occupy an area of about 86 square kilometers. Once submerged, Lion City has a chance to survive even longer. No sunlight, no wind, no erosion. Every year, thousands of divers come here, making Shincheng one of the most visited diving sites not only in China, but also in the world.

text:
2639-2506 B.C. The material is black diorite.

Diorite is one of the strongest materials on Earth.

It can resist neither alkali nor acid, perfectly capable of withstanding the influence of the environment and time. Because of its longevity, it has been used so that objects made of it could survive up to 3,000 to 5,000 years later.

Scientists and textbooks claim that it was made with stones, sticks and copper tubes 3,000 to 1,000 years ago BC. They didn't know iron then and the tools were primitive.

Maybe our builders should be given sticks and copper to build properly? Otherwise it's a regressionðŸ™ˆ

text:
Studying the map of Daniel Cellarius Ferimontanus in 1590 the Pyramids were found near the river Tartarus and the city of Tartarus.

And already in our days researchers started to talk about these pyramids: "Among the mountains of Altai a sensational find was discovered. In the North-Western part, were found at an altitude of 800 meters pyramid-shaped mountains, most likely of artificial origin, this explains the accuracy of the faces and the geometric structure of the pyramids ... on the walls were found writing, resembling the Scandinavian runes, namely several runes identical to the High Futhark".

Only 400 years had passed between the map and the "sensation". Anything new is the thoroughly forgotten old.

text:
The Japanese island of Yakushima is a UNESCO World Heritage Site because of its perfectly preserved rainforest. While tourists are interested in nature, waterfalls and rare animals, the real monument of history is a bit in the shade. 

There are some unusual megaliths preserved on the island.  One of them is a huge vertical stone, with traces of machining on the very top and a flat platform carved at an angle of 90 degrees. It is unknown how the ancient builders climbed to such a height and what tool they used to cut the top.

text:
In one of the oldest Indian temples of Mahabalipuram stands a basalt column about 1.5 m high (the original height was 4 m). Unlike other artifacts, the pillar was lucky to be examined and measured by researchers. 

To begin with, the pillar with 16 facets is made of basalt (6-7 points on the Mohs scale). On the left are the calculations on the model needed to hold out the perfectly flat facets. On the right are the results of measurements, exactly 157.5Â°, as in the calculations. 

Historians would try at least once to make calculations and cut such a column without a single error, even by 0.5 Â°, with a hammer and chisel. Although, why, if they pay for the sounding of already accepted versions?

text:
Historical math and calculations for the temple of Angkor Wat:

Built sometime in the 12th century, the area is 162 hectares, three times the size of the Vatican.

Of the tools for construction and processing - pickaxe, shovel, cart and hands of grateful workers. By the most conservative calculations, the workers would have had to mine-work-transport-deliver-stack a ton of stone in a minute.

The historian is not a builder and not a mathematician, he is not engaged in boring calculation of volumes. They could have attributed at least some technology and techniques to the Khmers, so as not to get out of the slender history.

text:
Daniel Keller's map of 1590 is valuable not only for the outlines of the countries, but also for the signatures left by the cartographer. 

"Sarmatia Asiatica and Scythia had long been inhabited, with the Persians and the Medes continually waging war and with their surrounding neighbors. The Sarmatians and Scythians fought Alexander the Great with great fanaticism, but very hard."

"Beyond the Volga to the east opposite the Caucasus Mountains live the great Tartars, the chief and oldest of which are the Yezahadars, the Perekops, the Kozans, the Nagai and the Cossacks, collectively they are called the Horde. "

"The islands of Yapan, which Marco Polo calls Zipangri...pay tribute to the Great Ham" - I can already see the Japanese sailing to get a yoke to reign.

"The Hungarians descended from the Yugros" - yes, yes, the ancestors of the Slavs populated Europe. Historians don't like it, but the evidence is already too much.

text:
Compare images of the "ruin tower" in Tsarskoye Selo. Robert Hubert (1783), Ivan Belsky (1788) and Ivan Ivanov (early 19th century) recorded the Tower for posterity

Hubert was not in Russia, and his painting was based on sketches by Count A. Stroganoff. The painter painted his version from sketches and Catherine 2 was satisfied with the work, having written: "I have the best opinion of Robert's picture". That is, the painter's work was quite realistic.

If you look at later images of these ruins, you can see quite an ennobled tower, which may well be passed off as a newly built.

I. Ivanov's work already shows a park and a more or less restored tower. The modern view does not resemble the ruins at all.

The closer to the present, the more restoration the monument survives and looks better. It seems that Catherine did not build this Tower, but simply turned the found ruins into a symbol of victory. Most likely this was normal practice for St. Petersburg.
