text:
The lie of the "cultural layer" was born in 1960-1970 in the USSR during the excavations of Novgorod, when archaeologists found wooden planking going into the ground. They decided that they were wooden sidewalks, but why so many of them? The answer was found, they decided that the wooden decks went into the ground every year, and every year they were laid anew. Thus, by the number of sunken layers of logs they "managed" to date the very first sidewalk. 

The scientists were not confused by the identical preservation of logs at the top and bottom. Scientists also apparently were not aware of such a concept as a "path" - a road made of wood through the swamp, and if the swamp is deep, the path is immediately stacked with several rows of logs until the logs are on the surface, and you can walk on them. If the "ancient bridges" is an ordinary walkway through the swamp, then the same preservation of logs finds its own explanation - they were laid at the same time.

text:
Sixty ancient settlements with stone houses underwater found

Archaeologists found them in the Arab-Persian Gulf and dated the construction to 5,500 B.C.

The same officials talk about the flooding of the Persian Gulf basin about 8,000 years ago. 

It is logical to assume that the rise in water levels flooded the ancient cities, the inhabitants went to the coast of the gulf. 

It turns out that the Sumerians, formed in the 4th millennium BC, were only the successors of other highly developed civilizations.

text:
Today there are over 5,000 known manuscripts of the New Testament and none of them are the original author's originals. They are copies overflowing with errors and inaccuracies that distort the meaning and prevent proper understanding. Inattention, fatigue, poor lighting, illegible handwriting, marks in the margins were taken as part of the text, sometimes the text was read aloud and scribes wrote it down-remember how many mistakes there were in the dictations?

In 1707 a book was published by the scholar John Mill who analyzed about a hundred Greek manuscripts of the New Testament and found more than 30,000 discrepancies. That's an average of 300 per manuscript, with only important distortions and outright errors taken into account.

But yes, the text of Scripture has come down to us from the depths of time. The question is, how much of it is left of the original?

On the left, the year 890 above the arch in Roman letters,
on the right, the M was added to the photo after the restoration, and the building has drastically changed the date to 1890.

We already had records, books, and engravings with substituted chronology, but not many such evidences have survived. Still, photography is an extremely useful invention!

text:
The largest living organism on Earth 

"Pando" is a colony of aspen-shaped poplar (USA, Utah). Scientists have determined that 47 thousand stems come from a single once living poplar. All 47 thousand stems have a single root system, and can be called a single organism, which weighs 6 thousand tons. Pando is 80 thousand years old, which makes it one of the main candidates for the title of the longest-living organism on the planet.

text:
In 1960, the American historian and professor Charles Hapgood discovered in the Library of Congress a world map published in 1531 by the French geographer Aurons Finet, which depicts the Antarctic continent.

In 1569, the Flemish cartographer Gerard van Kremer (Mercator) created a collection of geographic maps called the Atlas. Kremer included the above map as well as several maps depicting Antarctica.
Mercator and Finet wrote that in compiling their maps they used maps created many centuries ago.

Now Antarctica is almost entirely covered by ice, the greatest thickness of which reaches four kilometers. The entire contour of the coastline is hidden by floating ice shelves. So the outlines of the Antarctic landmass, not to mention the topography of its surface, became possible to determine only by seismic exploration, which began in 1949 a joint Swedish-British Antarctic expedition.

text:
Diorite is a very hard stone that is not subject to corrosion and can withstand acids. But what does its "Mohs hardness of 6" mean? It seems to us that it is possible to make any item, but it just needs a little bit more time.  Scientists always say that ancient man created such objects almost on an assembly line, using only wood and copper.

On the left are vases and a diorite figurine. They are 5,000 years old. On the right is the researchers' attempt to replicate the diorite vase with copper tools. This is the result they got in six months. Someone is either lying about the production technology or about the level of civilization.

text:
The first electric lighting in cities appeared in 1879-1880

To provide such illumination as in the photos and engravings, it was necessary to conduct equipment, set up, start production before that and produce a colossal amount of bulbs, wires and the rest of the equipment. And where would the power to generate that much power come from? Not to mention the fact that Frankfurt boasted about similar illumination back in 1730, 150 years before the official date.

Or one could simply use atmospheric electricity, etheric, with tin amalgam capacitors. The same ether that D. Mendeleev put at the top of his periodic table.

text:
The sign of Allatra.

It is a circle with an inverted crescent underneath it. It is found on almost every continent: in the architecture of buildings, on mosques, on stupas, on churches. 

This suggests that knowledge used to be unified. Perhaps that's why they don't tell anything about this sign in rewritten history classes? 

And yet it is one of the few surviving evidence that we are one big family. And we are united as humanity.

text:
Looking at maps of South America you can find a long rounded trail at the Drake Passage. Moreover, on maps of 1570 this strait is not yet present and America is connected to Antarctica.

It turns out that the catastrophe occurred after the 16th century, but there is no record of a huge celestial body falling and destroying part of the continent? Didn't see the flying asteroid, or didn't notice the missing land?

text:
Albert Fernick's 1888 photo of the Eiffel Tower is photographed in an unfamiliar way. It's not the angle, but the stone base of the tower. 

Of course, heavy structures and buildings need foundations or piles to keep them from sagging. What is now hidden from the eyes of tourists and miraculously survived in the picture is confusing - stone blocks and metal supports stand on the old brick walls. The masonry and buried arches seem suspiciously familiar from previous posts about the flood and clay drifts.

"On the ruins of the old world we will build a new world."

text:
The Lake of Death

This place is not far from Pereslavl-Zalessky. The lake is famous for the fact that every year a large number of tourists drown there. And those who have managed to get out, say that as if from the depths someone is pulling down. But the strangest thing is that to date not a single body has been found. The locals try to avoid this strange place, and certainly none of them can be made to swim in the terrible lake. The old-timers tell how they once saw a man who had swum to the middle of the lake and then suddenly just disappeared somewhere. All that was seen were air bubbles on the surface of the water. And then, on the same day, but only at night another person disappeared. To date, no one can give an explanation for this phenomenon. By the way, even divers don't dare dive into the depths of the scary lake.

text:
What is medievalism?

The first Latin phrase recorded in 1469 is "media tempestas," where the word tempestas means not just time, but "a time of storms, cataclysms," that is, it conveys the clearly negative nature of events of the preceding time period. 
Then appears the form "media antiquitas" (1494), "middle antiquity," the interval from about the middle of the thirteenth to the middle of the fifteenth century. In French, the word antique, like antico in Italian, came into use in the fifteenth century; it comes from Latin, but in Latin "antequos" means "before any event. 

And here's an interesting coincidence. 
In the 14th century, because of constant storms, seafaring in the Atlantic ceased.Since that time, people began to build dams and dikes - in Holland and in Moscow! Excavations near the Borovitskaya Tower of the Kremlin have uncovered a four-tiered dam. Traces of the "Dunkirk Transgression" remain in northern Germany - silt-covered forests and villages.

text:
According to official data in 1914 there were 80792 ancient structures on the territory of the Russian Empire.

54'174 temples, 25'593 chapels, and 1'025 monasteries. As of 1987, only 6,893 remained. So 7,3884 structures were destroyed or remodeled. This is an effective destruction of history and erasure of memory!

text:
In the Italian chapel of the Chapel of San Severo, in the historic center of Naples, everywhere you look there are sculptures of amazing beauty. 

Their realism and detail is striking. Nowadays, such fine work is possible thanks to a 3d printer and a CNC machine. 

But how did they do it in the 18th century and why didn't they learn? There are a lot of sculptures like this around the world, and they are not unique to that era.

But in the textbooks it's the same as usual - a chisel and a hammer and 7 years of workðŸ˜…

text:
The mystery of the ancient map, which is several hundred years ahead of its image. 

The Piri Race map still leaves many questions. 

This map of 1500, is still a mystery to many scientists. Even the simplest person who has only seen an Yandex map will probably ask himself: How was it possible to create the present earth 500 years ago? 

If you dig a little deeper, a number of other questions pop up, one of which is: How did the cartographer manage to create a map of America, if at that time it was only known about it by hearsay? 

It is worth noting that some of the lands on the map, in those years was not known to people at all. They were discovered decades after this highly accurate map was created. Antarctica was discovered three centuries later. But most surprisingly, the subglacial continent has the clear outlines of today. Many scientists agree and believe that the map was made thanks to data from other civilizations.

text:
In modern Great Zimbabwe the remains of the old town of the early 12th century were found. We found traces of active trade, large-scale mining of ore, developed blacksmithing, which indicates an unusually high, compared to its neighbors, level of cultural development in the city. Well-designed planning of the city, separating fortified stone part and wooden "settlement" for poor people. Numerous stone temples.  

Simply put, poor hungry pygmies, as the Africans are now represented as, were not capable of creating such a thing. All the evidence adds up to a picture that there was an advanced civilization, of which, however, the history is silent. But you can read about the primitiveness of the population in any textbook.

text:
Shanidar Cave

In Iraq, at an altitude of 750m above sea level, the Shanidar Cave is famous among archaeologists. Its uniqueness is that the cultural layers are mixed with layers of silt, sand, shells and small pebbles.

And this in a cave that has never been a seabed! Archaeologists have discovered four disasters that befell not only the cave itself, but also the man who lived in it.
 
What did the Mayans say? We are the fifth civilization living on Earth, and the previous ones were destroyed by cataclysms?

text:
Take a look at the painting called "The Suicide of Saul," which was painted in 1562. So people knew about dinosaurs back in the 16th century?

If you look closely, you will see 3 dinosaurs in the center of the painting, with riders sitting on them. Many people would think they were camels, but they weren't.

The ancient legends of many nations mention dragons. If you go into detail, this mythical creature is very similar to dinosaurs. In other words, dragon is the folkloric name for a dinosaur. 

How could these ancient animals get into myths and legends, if, according to the generally accepted scientific theory, dinosaurs became extinct tens of millions of years before the appearance of man?

text:
Tibi Dam. Built in 1594.

The 42-meter dam was built incredibly competently for its year of construction - 1580. After 14 years the construction was completed. Not only is it arch and gravity-type - it is also located in the place where the river crosses a high rocky ridge. The dam rests against the rocky shoreline, and the pressure of the water is pushing against it.

Design institutes work on such structures. And all modern dams and levees are made of reinforced concrete. And here - stone blocks.

By the way, many modern dams are already deteriorating; they are either in an emergency condition or require constant maintenance.
And how many blocks had to be cut, moved and laid? And all this in 14 years.

text:
Manna from heaven is some kind of food that God sent to the Jews from heaven. Believers will see confirmation of God's existence, ufologists will see that UFOs handed Moses a food printer.

There is a simpler explanation. Manna can be found in the Sinai Peninsula export list, in the botanical reference book it is the plant Tamarix Mannifera. In 1823 the botanist G. Ehrenberg published an article, Symbolae Physicae, explaining that manna is simply the secretion secreted by tamarisk trees and bushes when they are attacked by a certain species of aphid found in Sinai. 

In 1483 Breitenbach wrote: "This heavenly bread falls almost at dawn and hangs in balls on the grass, stones and twigs. It is sweet as honey and sticks to the teeth" - it is picked at dawn because it is food for ants and simply melts in the daytime temperatures.

text:
Have you heard about the War of 1812 in America? No, there are interesting coincidences between their history and ours! Both wars started at the same time - June 12 and June 18, 1812 and both ended in 1814 with the signing of peace treaties. In both cases the official reason was "trade problems between the states. 

The official version is that British ground troops (10,000 men) first went as far inland as Detroit, then up to Montreal, down through Lake Champlain, all to attack New York. Look on the map to see where Detroit is, where Montreal is, and how much of a detour it takes to get to New York.

St. Petersburg and New York had no fortress walls, but the British and Napoleon persisted in going inland, avoiding the main cities. Napoleon burned Moscow and blew up the Kremlin, and England purposely burned Washington, D.C., with the White House and the Capitol. But the major seaports of St. Petersburg and Philadelphia, which were cooler than Moscow and New York (and defenseless)

text:
You have to agree that the slab-lined terrace at Lake Shira in Khakassia is hard to take for a natural formation. The stone blocks are too equally shaped and perfectly matched to each other. The plates of Lake Shira were mentioned due to the study, which was conducted by Gennady Kovalenko.

The conclusion of the Siberian scientist is unambiguous - this masonry has an artificial origin. The study showed that, unlike all other shoreline rocks, the fragments of these plates have magnetic susceptibility.

The rectangular blocks on the southwest shore of Lake Shira are particularly well preserved. The gaps between the plates are completely absent. On the eastern shore 15 slabs with cut ends were found.

The megalithic masonry on the Shira Lake is not inferior to the analogues in Ancient Egypt or South America. Could it be the legacy of an ancient civilization? But who and when could have created this mysterious object? What was its purpose?

text:
The Polish village of Grabowo is suddenly famous for a sensational find. An ancient sword was unearthed near it, during the extraction of limestone. The find is at least 2.000 years old, but the age in it is not the most valuable thing. 

Spectrographic analysis showed that the sword contains 90% aluminum. You may ask, what's so unusual about it? People didn't start mining aluminum until two centuries ago.

text:
No warlord was so feared as Attila. In 445-453, under the leadership of Attila the Hun and their allies conquered Germany, France, Northern Italy and imposed tribute on the Roman Empire.

Below is a coin depicting Attila. There is no mention of any Mongolian appearance, and the image of horns was explained by scholars as belonging to the royal family, they say, a purely Scythian attribute. The Scythians themselves did not know about such an intimate detail such as the horns of their kings, and that is why their other rulers look normal. And scientists have not explained the fur ears in any way.

text:
Specialists-cartographers discovered on a geographical map of 1606 a fairly accurate image of Antarctica, and, most surprisingly, without its ice cap. But where did medieval geographers get information about the coastline of this distant continent, and indeed in the relatively recent past it was free of ice?

According to current scientific beliefs, ice has bound Antarctica for millions of years. The assumption made by scientists that this was a map of the ice sheet did not prove to be true - the outlines were exactly the same as the subglacial outlines, which could only be obtained with the advent of technology in the 20th century.

text:
According to historians, 200 years ago Alexander's column, weighing 600-700t, manually raised for 1.45 hours. 

In our days in Astana, the support for the tent "Khan Shatyr", weighing 1500t, was lifted by the best engineers of our time for 2 days.

It is a shame to spend years in studies and weeks for calculations, to organize the work of the best specialists of various colors and a heap of special transport, and then to read that you were surpassed by a dozen of peasants and horses?

text:
A year ago, the media broke with reports of a discovery in the American city of Alton: Gary Machens bought a house and during renovations discovered a tunnel under the building. The entrance arch is made of limestone and the tunnel itself is a 2.7m high brick arched room

The plans for the mid 19th century building show no tunnel or other structures. Back then it was a wooden village from the cowboy movies, and a stone building could only be seen in New York City and would be called a "palace." Even judging by the excavated portion, the amount of work was enormous. Valuable brick went into the construction, and the houses on top were built of wood for another 50 years. 

While the discovery, which does not fit the history, is waiting for the verdict of the researchers, let us recall the buried cities of the United States and the prehistoric tunnels all over the planet.

text:
In the mid-1960s, a sword of Guojian was found in China, dating back to the 5th century BC. 

A sword is like a sword, were it not for one two buts - the sword has a unique alloy, and the scabbard in which it was kept was fitted so tightly that it literally created an airtight environment.

An alloy of bronze, copper, tin, lead and iron added sulfur. Closer to the center, the blade contains more copper, which increases its flexibility and strength, while the edges have increased tin, making them tougher. A unique creation! A masterpiece! Which, according to historians, was made with a hammer and chisel only with a hammer, anvil and horn 2,500 years ago.

text:
A unique panorama of St. Petersburg in 1861.

160 years ago an unknown photographer made a circular panorama of the city from the Admiralty tower. Until recently, its only copy was kept in the library of the Marble Palace.

In 2011, a LiveJournal user published a retouched version of the panorama. A look at the old footage shows that the Palace Bridge is still floating, the Admiralty Embankment has not been reconstructed, and the Rumyantsev Garden does not exist.

text:
In 1832 it took 1.45 hours to raise the Alexander Column, weighing 600 tons.

The Tsar Bell weighs 200 tons and the method to lift it was developed in 1831, but it was impossible to lift it by this method for the next 5 years. 

How is it possible that at one and the same time, the same people have the conditions to do a more difficult job, but are scratching their heads in a stupor, not knowing how to do the same thing for a simpler and lighter object? 

Imagine the movers who lifted a piano into your apartment, but couldn't lift a chair.

text:
In the Mediterranean Sea, on the island of Sardinia, there are quite a few impressive objects of the past, created about 4,000 years ago. The unknown civilization of the island perfectly processed megaliths, created everything in the right geometric shapes, but all this is not so important.

An interesting well, called Santa Cristina. The well is considered sacred, and it was built from machined blocks. There is a hole in the roof of this structure, into which, as it turned out, every 18 years and 6 months the moonlight perfectly spills.

In addition, the day before the moonlight, at midnight, from the hole in the sky you can see the position of the star Sirius. The ladder itself into the well was created at a special angle of 38Â°, and obviously this is not just for fun. Scientists have not figured out how 4000 years ago, supposedly the ancient people so calculated and built everything, but the fact remains.

text:
Restorers of the Savior Transfiguration Cathedral in Chernigov were supposed to help preserve the cathedral and eliminate cracks, chips and efflorescence. But creative nature went further and from the cathedral of the 11th c... 

The original ancient stone columns were bricked up, giving them the appearance of "ancient Kiev-Russian", in accordance with the dominant Soviet historical paradigm, of course. The omission turned out to be colorful, but to the historical accuracy has nothing to do.

text:
This is the 1865 customs terminal on the Pacific coast.

Customs, like any other government agency, by definition, cannot function without channels of communication with a single center. And if there are hundreds of kilometers from the customs terminal to the center, the courier communication for obvious reasons disappears at once. Without the means of communication, such a duty collection point would be an easy prey for maritime robbers.

And looking at this photo, try to guess what kind of communication there was. And that's before Popov and Marconi.

text:
In the seemingly recent past, there are enough oddities and inconsistencies. For example, some people noted the complete absence of people on the pictures of St. Petersburg and Moscow streets, although in other cities there were always people

And even if the photos were taken early in the morning, this fact is not explained, but the most interesting is another thing - the bird's-eye view photos

Already in the middle of the 19th century you can see pictures of very good quality, although cameras appeared only 20-30 years ago

In addition, some pictures were taken as if from something frozen above the city. There were no helicopters back then, nor were there "normal" controlled airplanes. So how were pictures taken in this quality and right over the city?

text:
"Waffle Rock," located on the shores of Lake Jennings Randolph. There seems to be nothing special about it, but if you look closely at the outlandish, regular geometric pattern, many questions arise. The imprint on the rock is controversial, whether it is a geological formation or a remnant of ancient technology. According to some scientists, this huge piece of rock could have originated 300 million years ago.

Those who have seen the rock are confused by its construction and composition. The lines are so parallel and so smoothly polished that it is hard to imagine that it could have been produced by natural phenomena. To this day, no one knows for certain for what purpose, by what or by whom this structure was created. Everyone offers their own theory, trying to explain the incredible origin of this piece of stone.

text:
200 years ago Russia had a subtropical climate?

As strange as it may seem, but there are many obvious inconsistencies and facts in the history, which are completely contrary to the official chronology. There are many such facts, but for starters it is fruit not typical of many parts of modern Russia. Well-known Pushkin wrote about pineapples, which he tasted at the landlord in the Kaluga region.

Also about 300 years ago there were vineyards, not only in the southern cities as now, but in Russia in general. In St. Petersburg, for example, there were palm trees, as well as in Moscow. Now, all this can be seen only in some southern cities. But most interestingly, in the Pskov chronicles there were mentions of crocodile attacks in 1581.  But if you consider these and other facts, what could have caused the climate to change so much over several centuries?

text:
Thomas Edison with his electric car in 1910.

Equipped with Edison's modern battery, the Bailey Electric was able to travel 100 miles on a full charge.

In September 1910, the electric car competed against much larger gasoline-powered cars in a 1,000-mile endurance race. As the saying goes. All new is well forgotten old.

text:
Prince Mikhail Scherbatov published a huge work "History of Russia from the earliest times" in seven volumes. The book describes in detail the events, their participants by name, the history of clans, variants of names of places and cities. By the way, considers the Scythians the ancestors of our nation, lists the Scythian kings and gives them a detailed description.

Interesting data on the founding of Veliky Novgorod: "Novgorod was also called Uhrat and Nemagard, built at the same time as Kiev by the Slavs who came back from the Danube, about half a century after the Nativity of the Savior. The name of Novgorod was given to distinguish it from the city built before, which was called Slaven, at a distance of a verst from Novgorod, which was completely ruined by plague and war". Slavic city which existed till 5 century A.D. and which became a basis for Novgorod, how do you perceive it? Sensation?

text:
What is this?
This is a real pyramid made by the Egyptians.

Along with the "perfect" ancient structures, there are "not perfect" ones. They are quite consistent with the time of creation.

Most likely, people tried to repeat what they already see. But it turned out as they could - clumsily and not symmetrically.

There are many such examples at Giza. There is the Cheops pyramid, and there are already crumbling small pyramids, they are more like sand hills. You can say for sure about them - the ancient Egyptians built them.

text:
Another issue of Tekhnika-Young (1936) describes the revolutionary CHP technology.

In short, the problem with expensive electricity was that to produce it, you had to heat water steam to 365 degrees and then create a pressure of 200 atmospheres. And the metal parts from such numbers were covered with scale, rusted and required frequent replacement.

But in 1914, the first mercury-water stations appeared. Already in 1933, such a unit worked on an industrial scale at the General Electric Company station. And it seems everything was fine - mercury at 8 atmospheres gave 500 degrees, the equipment does not oxidize and rust, and installation takes ten times less space. The world was on the verge of cheap electricity and, as it turned out, World War II. Countries had no money, cheap electricity with expensive initial construction was not part of the plans for post-war reconstruction. 

Too bad, the current electricity bills don't suit me at all

text:
Mayan Pyramid

This is the same Mayan pyramid in one of the most famous cities of Chichen Itza. The first photo shows how it was first found in 1892, and the second photo shows how it looks now. 

Archaeologists sure know their stuff, and life in the rainforest is amazing how quickly the plants there absorb the man-made structures. 

I wonder how many other surviving buildings stand around the world that we just haven't found?

text:
The tsarina of Russia was supposed to give birth with midwives, her husband, older relatives, and sometimes with a minister, immediately after the birth of a tsarevich or tsarevna was announced a decree-manifesto on the birth of a royal baby, where the king himself inscribed the name.

All the more strange to read "Genesis of the Russian Tsars" by I. Zabelin, who was surprised to find that there is not a single document or mention of the birth of Peter 1. The official announcement of the birth of the heir? A manifesto? Entries in the personal diaries of courtiers or in letters? Nothing. Not even the place of birth is known.

This also surprised M.Bogoslovsky: "There were various legends about his place of birth, which was not precisely designated in the official announcements... About the time, or rather about the hour, of Peter's birth there is also disagreement.

text:
"Devil's balls" are spheres made, as a rule, of bone, and the technology of their manufacture is striking - here it is as if one ball is carved inside another solid ball, and the inner ball is able to rotate in absolutely any direction. And quite often there are several inner spheres, one inside the other, and the other also inside the other and all carved.

Such spheres were produced in large quantities in ancient China. Representatives of official science said that this was done with primitive tools. So they would take a hammer and chisel and repeat it. Now it can't be done even with CNC machines.

 Same place, 110 years apart. There used to be antique style buildings all over America. And then they were torn down so that no one would have any questions. You don't even have to write about how things used to be better. They built skyscrapers around this place and the ancient building could have been left untouched, but they tore it down anyway, and built a typical shopping mall, of which there are many all over the world now.

text:
An unusual mask was found in Florida. Experts determined the mask to be 12,000 years old, marveled at the technological process, and discovered that it depicts an Inca deity. 

But how the ancient Incas created the mask of iridium - have not figured out. There is very little iridium in the bowels of the earth - just an admixture of other metals. Its main stock is found in fallen meteorites. Discovering it in 1803, scientists described the metal as "hard, refractory, with high corrosion resistance. Let's assume that the Incas were lucky enough to get a meteorite and they could make a mask out of the capricious iridium. It remains to be clarified - how did the ancients extract iridium from the meteorite?

text:
Frankfurt, 1730. 

The coat of arms of the Russian Empire on the most honorable place. But that's okay, because the Germans have always been a close people - the Academy of Sciences in Russia consisted entirely of Germans (with the exception of Lomonosov and a few other scientists).
Pay attention to the illumination. 

There is almost no detailed information. But the fact of the illuminations does exist. And it was not gunpowder or any other combustion. Can you imagine how many candles need to be kept burning to illuminate this area? There must be more such staff with ladders than all the guests in the image. And the dripping wax, the wind?  

There is a suggestion that these are ether condensers - the very atmospheric electricity. And ether, by the way, has been removed from the Mendeleev table.

text:
The Rostov administration refused to build the subway for decades, citing the proximity of groundwater (let's omit the fact that St. Petersburg stands in a swamp). 

The historians justified the unreality of myths about Rostov's underground structures with the theme of proximity of groundwater.

The statements of historians and administrations in 2000 did not prevent a whole KAMAZ truck from falling into the pit in st. Socialisticheskaya st., from running into the underground gallery near Pervomaisky park, and then a local TV report showing the result of demolition of a merchant's house in st. Suvorov was broadcasted. The typical picture - rows of brick arches, powerful brickwork, which we see all over Russia, Macedonia, the United States and in general in all corners of the Earth. 

Excavate in depth, of course, did not. There is no underground Rostov. The groundwater is there.

text:
In 1906, Alfred Filippovich Vakano, owner of the brewery, offered 15 thousand rubles to the Duma for a sewer project, and the project was commissioned to a German engineer from Frankfurt am Main, W. G. Lindley. In the middle of 1909, construction began.

By 1918 in Samara 35.4 kilometers of sewage network had been built, they were made of brick, with the depth of up to 22 meters, and represented underground passages up to one meter wide and about 1.75 meters high.

That's 35 kilometers in nine years! By hands! By bricks!

text:
The Olympic Games came from the site of Olympia in ancient Greece, where the games were held. There were 293 games held at the sacred site, but then something happened...

They found Olympia in 1766, and a century-long excavation began. A lot of artifacts were scattered among museums, but we got photos of the excavations - a deep pit that buried a whole city with temples, arenas and houses under a layer of clay. The official historians tell us that there were strong earthquakes in 521 and 552 A.D., and in the 7th century A.D. there was a landslide from Mount Kronos and an overflow of the Alpheus River. This soil destroyed ancient Olympia so that it was forgotten for a thousand years.

How much clay must there have been on little Mount Kronos that a five-meter-long landslide descended from it? 
A river spill? From Olympia to the river is at least 300 meters. Even if the Alpheus River rises a few meters, there would be no such flooding.  And to the sea in a straight line is 12 km.

A river spill? From Olympia to the river is at least 300 meters. Even if the Alpheus River rises a few meters, there would be no such flooding.  And to the sea in a straight line is 12 km.
Forbidden Science

text:
Former DARPA director and current Google executive Regina Dugan wants you to swallow identification microchips.

She explains how the microchip works when it is in the body. Inside the pill is a small chip with a switch. When you swallow the pill, the acids in your stomach act as an electrolyte that powers the chip. The switch turns on and off and generates an 18-bit ECG signal in your body so that your whole body becomes your authenticator.
"You put your hand to your computer, your phone, your doorbell-and you're authenticated."

FYI, the video was filmed in 2012, so you can imagine the technology already exists.

text:
Archaeological investigations in the area of Pompeii are delightful. Not everyone is happy, because the plumbing system with taps, valves, and faucets, similar to modern ones, does not fit much into the history of technological progress. Valves were created in the 18th century, faucets in the 13th, and in Pompeii they already existed 2,000 years ago.

Archaeologists dig out, and then the scientists have to think how to explain the findings and not to destroy the foundation of a coherent chronology.

text:
In Nepal, there is a gorge that is even larger than the Grand Canyon. There, at a height of 50 meters, there are thousands of holes right in the rock.

No entrances, ladders or climbs. To get there, scientists could only with mountaineering equipment, stumbling upon an ancient city in the rocks.

To answer how a certain people could hollow out a city in the rock a few thousand years ago and how they lived at such a height without any means of ascent, the officials could not say.

text:
Feodosia earrings - an artifact of the past, which is impossible to recreate

In 1853, the famous artist I. Aivazovsky organized excavations of burial grounds near Crimea. In one of them was found this unusual artifact 2500 years old. When the earrings were examined by jewelers, it became clear that the artifact was unique. No jeweler in the 19th century was able to recreate it, as the miniaturization and detailing of the product is at the highest level.

Pictured: North America. Early 20th century. Cutting down huge forests.

text:
A group of researchers can influence history more than venerable scientists. Thus, enthusiasts have shown that ancient peoples were able to build a real network of tunnels, under the mountain systems: Altai, Sayan, Himalayas, Urals, Caucasus, Carpathian Mountains, under the plains and going under the rivers and seas. The tunnels go tens and hundreds of kilometers underground and this is only a part that we know of.

To ascribe the origin of tunnels to natural reasons does not turn out - labyrinths and traps are not created by water that once again confirms the developed skills of ancient peoples

text:
Financier J. P. Morgan was the owner of the White Star Line, and he invested a considerable amount of money in the Titanic. 

Before he set sail, he worked on a plan to create a U.S. Federal Reserve System to regulate the banking system.

Some were outspoken critics of Morgan's ideas, and all of these people booked a seat on the ship first. They were Benjamin Guggenheim, Isa Strauss, and David Astor.
Morgan and a few of his close friends canceled their trip on the Titanic at the last minute and survived. His opponents remained on board and died during the ship's sinking. 

The Federal Reserve was already established the following year, 1913.
This concerned the Rothschild family and even the Illuminati Society.
Bribing members of the crew - to sacrifice people's lives to accomplish their goals - was already a tradition.

And don't forget of course, the Titanic was insured...

text:
Under the asphalt in Kronstadt

It is clear that blacksmiths in primitive forges used primitive tools to forge such perfect one-to-one "horseshoes" and I wonder, for what transport?

And there were many of them, but they were melted to metal where they could, and somewhere covered with asphalt, as in this case.
Here's a curiosity, when the asphalt was covered up, didn't people have any questions? After all, you don't need asphalt here.

text:
There were other clocks on the Spasskaya Tower until the end of the 17th century

This is a picture of the chimes on the Moscow Kremlin, which counted 16 hours a day ("3I" in this case means "zero hour").
But Peter the Great changed Russia's system of weights and measures from Russian to European.
It turns out that our ancestors divided the day not into 24, or even 12 hours, but precisely into sixteen.
 
An hour was divided into HOURS, one hour had 144 parts; one part (a prototype of a minute) had as many as 1296 fractions.

Why, as they say, "the primitive bearded men" had the need to count 1296 seconds?

text:
Granddaughter of the great Alexander Suvorov - Aripina Ilyinichna Suvorova was born in 1810 and died in 1956. She lived 146 years.

Little information has survived about her, but what is known is astonishing.
Agafia took monastic vows and carried her love of God all her life. Even before the revolution she decided to go on a pilgrimage to Jerusalem and did so. And in the literal sense of the word. She walked to Jerusalem, prayed to the Christian shrines there, and returned to Russia on foot. In 1918 on a denunciation of atheists as a harmful element alien to Soviet power, at the age of 108 years was arrested and condemned to 24 years of hard labor. She was released at the age of 132 and was settled in Engels, Saratov Oblast.

text:
Sculptural portrait of Maria Duglioli Barberini

1621. Preserved in the Louvre. And it is marble.

For the 1600s, if the official science is to be believed, it was a piece of cake to make such sculptures - without special machines or technology, simply, by hand, using the means of the "primitive Middle Ages".

In the present, even a CNC machine would not do this. This was either cast or 3D printed. Marble. In the 17th century.

text:
Moving roads of the 19th century

The moving electric sidewalk (street of the future) was presented at exhibitions in 1893 and 1900 in Chicago and Paris. It was 3.5 km long and had 9 stops. Fourteen thousand people could pass on the sidewalk at the same time. The exhibition of 1900 lasted 7 months, and during that time 50 million people were able to ride on the electric road. It was said that such sidewalks would soon be in operation everywhere, but we never got around to it.

I wonder why?

text:
Who dug Baikal and the Black Sea?

1 photo - still operating Udachny diamond mine, Republic of Sakha (Yakutia)
2 photo - flooded mine, nowadays it is often called Lake Baikal
3 photo - another flooded mine, which is incorrectly called the Black Sea

You do not need to be a spanner in the sky to understand the origin of the last two. Only who and what was extracted there remains a mystery. Most likely forever.

text:
The Sumerian civilization itself is one of the most mysterious known in history. But the so-called Sumerian list of kings raises even more questions

At the site of Sumerian cities experts have found a large stone with the listed events of the past and all the kings of the Sumerians, some of whom ruled for 20-30 thousand years

In total such "long-lived kings" there were 7 and in total they ruled for about 240 000 years, and then Sumerians describe a global flood, and governors already began to rule adequate terms on 10-20, a maximum of 40 years

It is hard to imagine that an ancient civilization made it all up, and what is the point?

Without even realizing it, our dear American partners are preserving our history. And better than they do in Russia itself.

The engraving shows the goddess of Glory and Oleg's shield at the gates of Tsargrad from the book "The Temple of Glory of Russian Heroes, 1803. It is clear why the book is unknown - it says that Novgorod is over 2000 years old, that Rurik came from the Lake Ilmen region, about the Slavic goddess Glory, of which no one has heard now, about the Slavic civilization, the same age as Solomon. Not the most popular ideas in the modern world, right?

text:
Each time before landing, astronauts carry a small suitcase in one hand. These suitcases are connected by flexible tubes to the spacesuits and supply them with air. Mobile ventilation is needed because of the tightness of the spacesuit: vapor and its own heat production quickly create an unbearable climate and overheating.

A similar device on the bas-reliefs of the Sumerians and Mayans was called "bag of gods". Here it is enough that the Sumerians and Mayans lived across the ocean from each other and painted identical briefcases of their gods who descended from heaven. And remembering the modern analogue in the cosmonauts, the question of the origin of the ancient gods can be considered closed.

text:
That's how they built it?

Historians claim that the buildings are not backfilled. This is a feature of the architecture of the time, allegedly, so built. Here, looking at this photo, I have a question: "They built this way too?"

They also say that buildings sag, but again I have the question, "How could it have sagged HOWEVER?" It's obviously not heavy enough to sink that much under the ground, and why hasn't it cracked and warped?

text:
At the ruins of the ancient Mayan city of Lubaantun, British archaeologists found a polished crystal human skull. Its size corresponded to the size of an adult woman's skull. It weighed about 5 kilograms.
 
The skull is made of a single piece of crystal, which consists of three joints. It is impossible to process such a piece of crystal, even with modern technology. It must collapse due to the internal stress of the material. In addition, in both Mexico and Central America, there is no deposit of rock crystal. Where did the Indians get it from?

text:
A huge number of tektites!

In a nuclear explosion there is a rapid rise in temperature and near the source rocks and rocks begin to melt and evaporate, fusing into a vitreous formation.

This is exactly what was found during the excavations of Mohenjo-Daro, and the level of residual radiation there is still high. It would seem, what nuclear explosions in 1900 BC?

text:
The Jesuit missionary Martinius in the 17th century wrote a book called "History of China" based on ancient chronicles. In it he writes in ink on paper about the shift in the axis of the earth: "The pillar of heaven collapsed. The earth was shaken to its very foundations. The sky began to fall to the north. The sun, moon, and stars changed the path of their motion. The whole system of the universe came into disarray. The sun was in an eclipse, and the planets changed their paths."

Simply put, these annals testify to the global catastrophes of the past, the existence of which is completely ignored by modern official science.

text:
At the beginning of the 21st century, archaeologists from the British Museum dug up a document with a prayer in the Egyptian language, repeating almost word for word "Our Father".

Everyone was shocked by the date of the document - "the prayer of the blind man" written down by Pharaoh Ehnaton (the pharaoh who believed in one god) belongs to the year 1000 BC, i.e. before the official appearance of Christianity.

As well as before the official appearance of Jesus Christ, who gave (or most likely reminded) people of the "Our Father" prayer.

text:
NASA and French scientists studied 100 crater funnels. They were all formed by meteorites falling about 350 million years ago.

All of them are the same size 2-3 km, except for a couple of very large craters.

The independent researchers immediately pounced on the scientists with uncomfortable but fair questions:

in 350 million years, there shouldn't be a trace of the craters - erosion, exposure to animal and plant life would have flattened them long ago, or smoothed them out as if they never existed. Houses have been covered by a cultural layer for 100 years and craters have not been covered for 350 million years, by age they should be deeper in the ground than the dinosaurs.

The same size is found in shell or bomb craters, because meteorites and asteroids do not have the same "caliber".

So, there is a very high chance that the craters are of artificial origin?

text:
What do you see in this photo?

The picture shows the Nazca Plateau in Peru. In fact, it's just a mountain that has had the top cut off evenly. It sounds simple, but how could it be done with ancient tools? And most importantly, why?

To answer the question in the title - I can see a runway from any modern airport in the world. But then a new question arises: Why did the natives in Peru need a runway?

text:
International exhibitions of the past were record-breaking in their speed, architectural beauty, and cutting-edge technology. In 1915 in one year they built pavilions for the San Francisco exhibition and one of the central elements were fountains with prefabricated columns.

At night the stone columns turned into light columns, where the xenon! In the daylight it is visible that the material is not transparent, even if you crammed all the bulbs available at the time inside you still do not get that brightness.

Despite the preservation of the technical and construction documentation of the exhibition, there is one white spot in the history - there is no mention of any substation, nor of the wiring, nor of the required power to operate the devices.

text:
The name of the scientist, inventor, physicist and meteorologist Nikolai Myshkin you will not find in any physics encyclopedia. 

All Myshkin knew was that the Earth's atmosphere contains a huge reserve of electric energy, regardless of weather, cloud cover, time of year and day. All he did was to create a way to utilize atmospheric electrical energy, creating collectors of electricity in the form of plates with hundreds of metal points. The experiments were successful: the engine worked perfectly on electricity "stolen" from the sky. 

The First World War, 1905 and 1917 destroyed the existing installations and closed the way for Myshkin's research. Perhaps, when the hydrocarbon reserves run out, mankind will remember the Russian inventor and his working system for obtaining atmospheric electricity.

text:
In the Rostov region there is the Voskresensky Cathedral of the early 18th century. Near the church there are the remains of a tombstone stele made of stone that looks like black granite or basalt. There is no similar rock in the vicinity and why would you bring it hundreds kilometers away?

But that is not the main mystery. The stone has an inner corner with smooth edges. There were no machine tools in 1706; neither were there disk saws, and you cannot get such a quality of work with a pen.

The researchers have addressed to the stone works technologist with a direct question how to receive such an angle in granite by modern methods. The technologist honestly answered that there was no way. To make a sharp inside angle with such quality of treatment is impossible, there are no such tools and technology. Were there any in the early 18th century?

But that is not the main mystery. The stone has an inner corner with smooth edges. There were no machine tools in 1706; neither were there disk saws, and you cannot get such a quality of work with a pen.

The researchers have addressed to the stone works technologist with a direct question how to receive such an angle in granite by modern methods. The technologist honestly answered that there was no way. To make a sharp inside angle with such quality of treatment is impossible, there are no such tools and technology. Do you have a good idea of the daily volume of food of the beasts of the Horde? And with several days of standing in one place? Do you still believe in the number of Tatar-Mongolian troops?

text:
Stone rivers - a natural mystery

The Big Stone River in Russia is a chaotic pile-up of large boulders "flowing" down the slope of Mount Taganai in the Chelyabinsk region of Russia. The river is 6 km long and on average 200 meters wide. In some places it is up to 700 meters wide.
 The river is filled with large boulders of quartzite (a strong and durable rock) and aventurine (a variety of quartz, containing mica and iron compounds, which give it a shimmering effect) weighing up to 9-10 tons each. The depth of the stone layer is as much as 6 meters!
 The origin of the stone rivers is still reliably unknown. There are many theories, some of them are quite plausible, others are like a fairy tale.

text:
A giant statue of Buddha found under a high-rise building in China

A shocking discovery in the Chinese city of Chongqing - under the base of one of the local high-rise buildings found a huge ancient statue of Buddha. We are talking about a nine-meter statue that was created about a thousand years ago.

The Chongqing authorities ordered the removal of debris from an apartment complex, which resulted in the discovery of a nine-meter statue of Buddha under a cultural layer in one of the courtyards. The statue, stripped of its head as well as some elements, is still striking.

text:
The unprecedented drought in Europe has once again made visible the "Hunger Stones" in some Czech and German rivers

Previously, these very stones were used to indicate desperately low water levels in rivers, which foreshadowed famine.

In the picture you can see a stone from 1616, which came out due to a drought on the Elbe River.
On it is written: "If you see me, weep. And there are other dates next to it: August 11, 1921 and June 20, 1934, there are also the years 1930 and 1944...

There had never been anything like this before, and here it is again!

text:
DUBROVITSKAYA CHURCH

Ð³. Podolsk. Dubrovitsy
Dubrovitsy Church is the only church in Russia, crowned not with a dome or spire, but with a golden crown and very richly decorated with sculptures of white stone.
This mysterious church with a mysterious history was created at the time when Dubrovitsy estate was owned by Prince Boris Golitsyn, the tutor of Peter the Great.
The temple was built from 1690 to 1703. The names of the creators of the temple remain unknown, which is one of its many mysteries...

text:
1) New York City has 11 letters.
2) Afghanistan has 11 letters
3) Ramsin Yuseb (terrorist who planned to destroy the Twin Towers in New York City in 1993) is 11 letters
4) George W Bush has 11 letters
This may only seem like a coincidence, it will be more interesting next...

1. New York City is the 11th state
2. There were 92 passengers (9+2=11) on W11.
3. There were 65 passengers in plane W77, which also flew into Gemini (6+5=11)
(4) The tragedy occurred on September 11, or 11.09 (1+1+9=11)
5. The emergency phone number in the U.S. is 911 (9+1+1=11)

Are these only coincidences? Read on!

1) The number of victims on the plane that crashed was 254 (2+5+4=11)
2) September 11 is the 254th day of the year (2+5+4=11)
3) 3.11.2004 Madrid bombings (3+1+1+2+0+0+4=11)
4) The tragedy in Madrid happened in 911 days, after the tragedy in New York (9+1+1=11)

text:
In 1872 George Smith is studying the text on an Assyrian tablet and it looks very familiar.A man named Uth was living in the city of Shuruppak when the gods decided to destroy all life on earth by sending a flood. The god Ea warned Ut to build himself a ship and take all living things. 

The text turned out to be an exact copy of the Noah myth and was replicated by newspaper writers. But uncomfortable questions arose: How did the story of the flood in Mesopotamia migrate to the Bible? Why did the Assyrian divine pantheon shrink to a single being in the Bible version? And who actually stole the original story?

text:
Diorite is one of the strongest minerals on Earth.
 
It does not succumb to alkali or acid, perfectly withstands the influence of the external unfavorable environment and time. Because of its longevity, it has been used so that objects made of it could survive up to 3000-5000 years later. 
 
Scientists say that it was made with stones, sticks and copper tubes 3000-1000 years ago BC. They didn't know iron then and the tools were primitive. 
 
Maybe our builders should be given sticks and copper to build properly? Otherwise it's a regression.

text:
In the seemingly recent past, there are enough oddities and inconsistencies. For example, some people noted the complete absence of people on the pictures of St. Petersburg and Moscow streets, although in other cities there were always people

And even if the photos were taken early in the morning, this fact is not explained, but the most interesting is another thing - the bird's-eye view photos

Already in the middle of the 19th century you can see pictures of very good quality, although cameras appeared only 20-30 years ago

In addition, some pictures were taken as if from something frozen above the city. There were no helicopters back then, nor were there "normal" controlled airplanes. So how were pictures taken in this quality and right over the city?

text:
Many people still believe that the theories of contact between past civilizations and other extraterrestrial civilizations are conspiracy theories and nonsense. But if you look at all the facts, it no longer seems that way.

In 1930, the Mayans found tablets with amazing images of unknown vehicles, and in principle, the same unknown beings, along with much knowledge of the structure of the planets and the solar system.

Except that these findings lay in storage for about 80 years, and only in 2011 were they presented to the public.

After that, the findings became a controversial sensation for history, which in a short time was simply forgotten, like many such artifacts.

text:
For several years, experts have been arguing about a fresco that shows a church and above it, a strange disk-shaped object, very reminiscent of a UFO. 

In the fresco, the unidentified object seems to be setting the structure on fire. Scientists are debating the fact that they cannot figure out the true meaning of the painted object. Some say that the UFO does not actually emit fire - it is just dirt. Others doubt that the fresco depicts a UFO at all.

text:
While before the advent of DNA analyses, historians claimed that all elongated skulls were obtained by humans through artificial deformation, modern studies of the genome of the Paracasan skulls disagree with this.

The skulls are a quarter the volume and 60% heavier than normal human skulls. The structure also differs: Paracas skulls have one parietal surface, while human skulls have two.

The director of the Paracas Museum of History sent five samples of hair, skin, teeth and skull pieces for genetic analysis and it turned out that the mitochondrial DNA, which is inherited from the mother, with an unknown mutation that does not occur in humans, primates or any other animals. Simply put, this is an entirely new humanoid creature, a far cry from sentient man, Neanderthal man, or Denisovian man. 

I do not know if these people will find a place in the genealogical tree of modern man, but the skulls from Paracas are not going to fit into the theory of linear evolution.

text:
What religion was practiced in temples and churches in Russia and Europe in the 18th century? Where are the Orthodox and Catholic crosses? For example, you will not see a cross on an 18th century engraving of the Anglican church Ault Hucknall Churches, but in modern photos there is one. Mostly we can see different weathervane, balloons, antennas, stars and mythical animals on spires. But what about the main Christian symbol, the cross?

Of course, the church says that the symbol of the cross has been with them for 2,000 years, on all temples and icons, but it seems that up to a certain point the cross was not the most popular symbol of faith. The ones that have been in use suggest pagan beliefs and that the church has somewhat exaggerated its popularity.

text:
The closed Egyptian city of Zawiet el-Erian.

Zawiet el-Erian is a city in Lower Egypt, located between Giza and Abusir. Zawiet el-Erian has two pyramidal complexes and five truncated pyramid-shaped mastaba tombs. 

It is now a closed city because it is home to a secret military base. Access to Zawiet el-Erian has been closed since 1964 and excavations are strictly forbidden.

In photographs taken before this period, we see absolutely stunning structures and traces of a grand civilization. Scientists and explorers cannot visit these places, and no one knows in what condition these unique historical monuments are today.

Approximate diameter of the find is about 40-46 meters. This allows us to determine the possibilities of the map.
Forbidden Science

text:
Parkas' elongated skulls were finally sent for DNA analysis. Let me tell you right away that they turned out to be human. Although no alien DNA was found in the skulls, the results were able to stump scientific traditionalists. 

All the skulls belonged to the Native Americans, but in the DNA found traces of haplogroups that lived in the Black and Caspian Seas, and in the foothills of the Caucasus. How the ancestors of the Indians 3,000 years ago crossed the Bering Strait and reached the Pacific Coast of South America, scientists are not specified. 

As, indeed, it is not specified why the volume of the skull of the Indians is 1.5 times larger than usual, there is no sagittal suture and traces of artificial deformation.

text:
An earthquake in Italy in 2017 caused deep-rock landslides. In the town of Girifalco, layers of rock caused by an ancient flood collapsed. Hundreds of artifacts, many older than the official history of mankind, were discovered.

Dinosaur figurines, among others, were discovered. The site of the landslide was cordoned off by the military. Under the pretext of debris removal, most of the items were removed. This statuette of an allegedly extinct stegosaurus survived and is now in a private collection, while the others were destroyed.

text:
We don't pay attention to minutiae.

Please consider this seemingly ordinary bas-relief. Immediately you can see two groups of people of different heights. But not everyone pays attention to the fact that there is also a third group at the bottom right. It may well be that there are three types of people depicted: giants, people of ordinary height, and a kind of transitional type. One would think that those below are children, but they are depicted with beards. And that adds even more questions than it answers.

Who do you think the ancients depicted?

text:
Monk Fra Mauro's map depicts two countries called India and a third country, India Cin, in China. It is necessary to specify in each historical document about India - which country was mentioned?

For example, the myth of Alexander the Great: "...Deep snow was falling, making it difficult for the Macedonians to approach.... About 30 men died, they drowned in the snow...Where were the Indians who dressed in animal skins...and tunics made from the skins of sea seals...".

Read Aristotle further:
"...There is a valley where diamonds are mined. Alexander, my pupil, reached the valley. This valley borders the lands of India... Summer lasts six months and six months winter."

There remains only one place on Earth where the Macedonian could see harsh winters, clothes made of hides, and even diamonds were mined - this is Asian India, now the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia).

text:
In 1985 there was a sensation. On the Japanese island of Yogaguni similar pyramids were discovered. The first studies revealed that the stone objects occupy an extensive area almost all around the southern shore of the island.

The central structure is a stone massif, called a monument, which is a rather complex structure, the base of which is a high platform 200 meters long, 150 meters wide, and 25 meters high. There are flat terraces on it, which go down in massive steps. The architecture of this structure resembles the pyramids of the ancient Incas and is 5000 years old. 

Do you think this is an ancient submerged city where people once lived or a natural mountain formation? So far, no one can make a definite conclusion, and the mystery of the underwater pyramids will continue to excite the minds and imagination of researchers for a long time to come.

text:
Edward Lidskalnin he built the so-called Coral Castle in Florida. He was short (about 1.6 m) and weighed about 50 kilograms, but such modest size did not prevent him from single-handedly moving stone blocks weighing up to 30 tons. At the same time he always worked alone.

A small number of eyewitnesses differ in their versions: two teenagers claim to have seen the huge stones floating in the air; others assure that they saw some equipment resembling a wooden tripod and some ropes (but even this equipment did not look powerful enough to lift such massive stone structures). 

Edward Lidskalnin is said to have used some kind of small black box, which he himself called a "stabilizing perpetual motion machine. Lidskalnin himself claimed to have discovered the secret of the Egyptian pyramids. It is a pity that he did not have time (or did not want) to share it with mankind.

text:
There is a quarry near Mount Nokogiri in Japan. It is dated from the Edo and Togukawa shogunate period, from about 1603 to 1868. There is nothing unusual about the quarry. Similar excavations are found almost all over the world. But if you examine the walls of the quarry closely, you can notice that there are horizontal strips on the stone.

There is no doubt that they were left by the people who mined here. But no tools of that time left such traces: clear horizontal stripes. But modern mining equipment can do this. But where did the Japanese of the Middle Ages and Renaissance get it?

text:
Gods from all over the world found a universal tool, like a nuclear suitcase - the vajra. China, Idia, Tibet, Sumer, Greece, Ancient Rome, Scandinavia - ancient peoples clearly saw this object-weapon. That it was a weapon is clear from the description of its use. The gods could strike enemies with lightning or cut mountains with a vajra. 

If the idea of a lightsaber as a controlled source of plasma lightning is quite familiar, thanks to the fantasy world, the fact that the gods of the ancient world had a single weapon across the planet is somewhat alarming. Unlike the same descriptions of flying machines, the description of the vajra is absolutely identical in all peoples - one form, the same use, the same technique. Too common and detailed an object for a simple fiction!

text:
The Margrave's Theater in Bayreuth, Bavaria, Germany.

The theater building was built between 1744 and 1748 in the Baroque style by the architect Joseph Saint-Pierre and is rightly considered a jewel of the so-called Bayreuth Rococo style. Its construction was timed to coincide with the marriage of Elisabeth Friederica Sophia of Brandenburg-Beileit, daughter of Margrave Friedrich III of Brandenburg-Beileit to Duke Carl Eugene of Wurttemberg. The interior was created by decorators Giuseppe Galli-Bibien and his son Carlo in the late Baroque style.

Why aren't they built like this now, would someone please explain?

text:
In 1906, Alfred Filippovich Vakano, owner of the brewery, offered 15 thousand rubles to the Duma for a sewer project, and the project was commissioned to a German engineer from Frankfurt am Main, W. G. Lindley. In the middle of 1909, construction began.

By 1918 in Samara 35.4 kilometers of sewage network had been built, they were made of brick, with the depth of up to 22 meters, and represented underground passages up to one meter wide and about 1.75 meters high.

That's 35 kilometers in nine years! By hands! By bricks!

text:
Ring from a private collection

This ring has long been in the private collection of the Dukes of Marlborough. Imagine how many artifacts lie quietly in their custody.

It is believed to be the ring of the Roman emperor Caligula and to be at least 2,000 years old. That's about it.

The most interesting thing is the processing. Sapphire is very hard, and working with it is a troublesome business. It is impossible to replicate it without high-precision optics of high-tech tools.

In previous posts we wrote about unique jewelry. And such a ring is not the merit of just one talented craftsman who has dedicated his life to this endeavor. It takes industry and industry to make it. Let me remind you, the ring is at least 2,000 years old.

text:
Many people still believe that the theories of contact between past civilizations and other extraterrestrial civilizations are conspiracy theories and nonsense. But if you look at all the facts, it no longer seems that way.

In 1930, the Mayans found tablets with amazing images of unknown vehicles, and in principle, the same unknown beings, along with much knowledge of the structure of the planets and the solar system.

Except that these findings lay in storage for about 80 years, and only in 2011 were they presented to the public.

After that, the findings became a controversial sensation for history, which in a short time was simply forgotten, like many such artifacts.

text:
Electricity in the 17th century.

The engraving is of Paris, 1681. Note the "chandeliers" in the middle of the street and on the building facades on the sides. Remind you of anything? The usual electric chandeliers. But the use of electricity began only in the 19th century. 

My clever reader (and you're all like that ;) ) will say: "So these are candles, are you crazy?  Yes, very similar, if it weren't for a few "buts". 

1. The light is "solid", like from a chandelier, not spotty, if there were candles.
2. Height of placement. Candles burn out, they need to be replaced, at this height it is difficult to do so
3. From the previous point it follows that at this height, of course, there will be a wind. And candles are very easily blown out by the smallest gust of wind (sometimes even a wave of the hand is enough).

There are many more examples like this.

Electricity in the 17th century.

The engraving is of Paris, 1681. Note the "chandeliers" in the middle of the street and on the building facades on the sides. Remind you of anything? The usual electric chandeliers. But the use of electricity began only in the 19th century. 

My clever reader (and you're all like that ;) ) will say: "So these are candles, are you crazy?  Yes, very similar, if it weren't for a few "buts". 

1. The light is "solid", like from a chandelier, not spotty, if there were candles.
2. Height of placement. Candles burn out, they need to be replaced, at this height it is difficult to do so
3. From the previous point it follows that at this height, of course, there will be a wind. And candles are very easily blown out by the smallest gust of wind (sometimes even a wave of the hand is enough).

There are many more examples like this.
Forbidden Science

text:
A strange find, Antarctica.

During excavations in the La Paille region, archaeologists discovered unusually elongated skulls.

The discovery stirred up the entire scientific world. In addition to the unusual shape of the remains, also shocking is the fact that according to scientists for many years it was believed that man had never been to Antarctica before...

The globe is interesting - the old North Pole is near Greenland, and now it is offset by about 15Â°.

text:
This mummy of a giant (2 meters 54 centimeters, while in life it was 20 cm taller) was found by hunters near San Diego, USA in 1895. It was immediately sent to the Smithsonian for study. And strangely enough, it was studied and the results reported to the public. The authenticity of the mummy was confirmed by the Smithsonian's chief anatomist, Professor Lucas, as well as by the head of the American Bureau of Ethnology, Professor McGee.

But guess what happened next? That's right. About a year later, even the aforementioned guys "changed their minds" and said the mummy was fake. How they studied it for such a long time and didn't notice is a mystery. The public raised a fuss and demanded an independent examination, but the answer of the Smithsonian representatives was brilliant: "The mummy was destroyed because it is a fake and is of no value or scientific interest". Well, as you know, "there is no body, there is no case". 

This is approximately the way history is made in our country

text:
A piece of rock with a solidified imprint of a shoe sole in its surface was found in the coal beds of Nevada. 

Not only the contours of the sole were visible, but also a series of stitches that fastened the parts of the shoe.

The engineer showed the find to geologists at Columbia University, who considered what they saw an imitation, although they acknowledged that the coal piece of rock may date back more than 5 million years.

They did not dare to go any further with the research. Everything is clear here - they were "eaten" by official science. The only known photograph was published in a New York newspaper in 1922.

text:
Anomalies on the surface of the Moon.
 
Some images taken by various satellites show very strange things on the surface of the Moon. It seems that there are artificial structures on the Moon, which vary in size from quite tiny, usually parallelepipedic in shape, to "obelisks" at least 1.5 km high. 
 
Fans of paranormal phenomena have even "found" among these objects a large castle "hanging" high above the surface of the Moon. All this as if it points to an advanced civilization, which previously lived on the Moon and allegedly built complex structures. 
 
NASA has never refuted these strange theories.

text:
Are modern man and 18th- and 19th-century man different beings?

Let's ponder. Previously, people created, read books, poetry, went to the theater, had beautiful cities, houses with stucco and columns, and courtyards decorated with fountains and statues.

Today, people live in squalid monotonous conditions. Entertainment: TV, YouTube, games, and alcohol.

Man today is more like a hybrid of the man from the previous centuries.

The worst thing is that people are happy with everything. Some people are so used to it that they don't want to change anything in life.

text:
This is the oldest ship on active duty in the military (if removed, correct me). The oldest in the world! When and by whom was this ship made? Because there are many naval powers in the world.

 The ship is called "Kommuna" (actually "Volkhov"). This ship is already 102 years old. Built during the reign of Nicholas II at the Putilov plant. The first Russian warship catamaran, as well as the first rescuer of submarines. All one hundred and two years the ship served for Russia, participated in the Great Patriotic War and in the Second World War, even in the exercise "Kavkaz-2016".

 Wikipedia : "During the construction a special forged ship's steel was used, nicknamed "Putilovskaya", the manufacturing method of which was later lost".

The condition of the hull of the Kommuna, made of Putilov's steel, remains almost perfect to this day - the iron structures that were installed on the catamaran at a later time are rusting and turning into rotten metal.

text:
The Carpen battery is an uninterrupted and self-contained power source that lasts more than 70 years without interruption or recharging. Such a mini-perpetual motion machine with 1 volt of power.

Why is the museum where it is stored attacked by crowds of journalists, scientists and researchers? The museum management gives the perfect justification - the battery is not shown to scientists and visitors, because the museum has no money to properly protect this miracle specimen.

There is security for an exhibition of jewelry, but for a perpetual motion machine - too expensive?

text:
The Italian "Bomarzo pyramid" is carved in solid rock. It is 16 meters high and another 7-8 meters underground, making it the largest monolith in Europe.

The road to it is cut in rocks in the form of a canyon. The stone planking with the traces of transport - parallel grooves from wheels, but on steps there are no expressed traces of erosion or "wear and tear". Around the pyramid the remains of megalithic structures, i.e. there was a large and developed settlement of unknown people and unidentified epoch.

These facts are not enough to interest the scientific community, so since the discovery in 1911 there have been no archaeologists or scientists here. But the pyramid was in advance called a ritual altar, ignoring the presence of nearby settlements and traces of vital activity.

text:
Inkerman quarry. 1890.

In the photo we can see the kerfed pass 100 meters wide through the hill. The height of approach is 80 meters. There are huge niches in the walls with one-story houses.

Some of these niches are the beginning of the catacombs. Large-scale underground mining of limestone was performed here.

During the Second World War, the catacombs housed headquarters, a hospital, a sewing shop, and warehouses. Trucks could easily go inside. During the retreat, the entrances were blown up.

By the way, there are ancient catacombs under almost every city. Near Odessa, the length of catacombs is 2,500 km.

text:
Saddam Hussein had a "stargate."

Michael Sallah believes that Hussein wanted to get alien technology and leave all the major world powers far behind. Some (e.g. Europeans) were fine with this, but the U.S. tried to stop Saddam. This was the reason for all sorts of inspections: specialists were not looking for chemical weapons, but for traces of an "alien teleport. But that is not all. Aggressive foreign policy of the USA, according to supporters of a hypothesis, was caused not only by a desire to get new technologies, but also to prevent the invasion of the Earth by aliens. The latter, as one can guess, had to penetrate through the "stargate" of Hussein.

text:
Uzbekistan has unique archaeological monuments. But information about them hardly reaches the general public. And if it does, it does not get the resonance it deserves.

There are probably more ruins on the territory of Uzbekistan than in any other country in the world. Some were destroyed two thousand years ago, some in the 11th-15th centuries AD. All this not just says, but screams that a climatic catastrophe took place there. Local - or worldwide.

text:
Varangal Fort in India

Past civilizations left plenty of monuments of "incredible manual labor with primitive tools" in India. Many of which are now buried under piles of garbage.

And it is no coincidence that the collapse of this civilization came during the "expansion" of European barbarians to the peninsula.

This ancient complex with uniquely complex architecture was built in the 12th century entirely of granite.

According to European officials with a jigsaw and a hammer. Of course, they will never admit that they are leaving behind ruins which cannot be reproduced by the achievements of European civilization.

Hollow columns in Pompeii

It is difficult for the average person to imagine how hollow objects were made. But no one is surprised by a hollow porcelain jug or vase. But marble, or rather its thin layer, an imitation, can easily be obtained from gypsum - polishing it with formic acid - a narrow circle of specialists know about it.

text:
Greek Fire

Ancient history is full of surprises. One of them is the super-flammable mixture that the Byzantine Empire launched at its adversaries. Some believe that Greek fire was a precursor to napalm. Like the infamous 20th century invention, Greek fire managed to burn even when in contact with water.

It was used in naval battles and in sieges of fortresses. Copper pipes, barrels, and earthen vessels were used for throwing, which were thrown with the help of throwing machines. This highly effective weapon existed until the 14th century, and then disappeared somewhere. Along with the secret of manufacture. And a century later the Byzantine Empire disappeared as well.

text:
Mehmed-Ali Mosque, Cairo, late 19th century

The glass vessels are placed on separate metal pendants coming from somewhere in the ceiling. Why such complications?

There are a lot of vessels, and their size is quite decent. How is it possible to periodically ignite, and most importantly, to fill such vessels with an incomprehensible substance if they are hung high up?

Assuming that the liquid in the containers burns, where are the traces of soot? And to be in a room with fire overhead is very strange.

It looks complicated and impractical.

text:
A group of researchers can influence history more than venerable scientists. Thus, enthusiasts have shown that ancient peoples were able to build a real network of tunnels, under the mountain systems: the Altai, Sayan, Himalayan, Ural, Caucasus, Carpathian Mountains, under the plains and going under the rivers and seas. The tunnels go tens and hundreds of kilometers underground, and this is only the known part.

It is impossible to ascribe the origin of tunnels to natural causes - labyrinths and traps are not created by water, which once again confirms the developed skills of ancient peoples.
