text:
Timgad is a lost Roman city on the edge of the Sahara Desert, hidden under the sand for almost a thousand years. The area now belongs to Algeria, but the first mentions of Timgad date back to the 18th century. Although at that time, no one believed in a Roman city lost in the sands of the North African desert.

Perhaps the most impressive are the photographs of Timgad from above. Because the blocks resemble quite modern and recognizable floor plans. Let's just say that the modern principles of urban design are not so modern. As you can see, the Romans built exactly the same way. Today it is considered one of the oldest examples of such urban planning.

text:
The Vatican Library is one of the most guarded sites in the world: its protection is more serious than that of any existing nuclear power plant. In addition to numerous Swiss guards, the library is guarded by modern automatic systems that form several levels of security.

 The secret archives of the Vatican became known in 1611 under Pope Paul V. Only a limited number of people could get in. Some scientists with a letter of recommendation can get into the holy of holies, but the entrance is regulated and allows two people per year. At the same time, the entrance to the archive does not imply free movement and access to any documents. The visitor indicates the topic of interest, and the appropriate literature is selected.
 
Such closeness raises questions and gives rise to versions about what the Vatican archives actually hold, probably the library of Ivan the Terrible and the Library of Alexandria.

text:
The Margrave's Theater in Bayreuth, Bavaria, Germany.

The theater building was built between 1744 and 1748 in the Baroque style by the architect Joseph Saint-Pierre and is rightly considered a jewel of the so-called Bayreuth Rococo style. Its construction was timed to coincide with the marriage of Elisabeth Friederica Sophia of Brandenburg-Beileit, daughter of Margrave Friedrich III of Brandenburg-Beileit to Duke Carl Eugene of Wurttemberg. The interior was created by decorators Giuseppe Galli-Bibien and his son Carlo in the late Baroque style.

Why aren't they built like this now? Instead, every speck of dust is blown off such masterpieces with awe. Because it cannot be repeated...

text:
The South Pole was discovered by R. Amundsen's expedition in 1911?

It is believed that before him "the way to one of the most inaccessible places on Earth" no one could overcome.

We would argue. Look at old maps that show South America and Antarctica as continents connected by an isthmus. It was free to walk across it.

The present-day Drake Passage, the characteristic trail on the seafloor, and the strange arrangement of the islands suggest that South America and Antarctica may have been one land.

The ancient peoples had no problem moving around. They walked farther and farther away.

text:
In the United States, from the beginning to the middle of the last century, 19th-century buildings were demolished en masse, and sometimes these buildings were only a couple of decades old. What was wrong with them? There is no official answer, of course, there are all kinds of vague motives such as impracticality, and most often no clear reasons were not at all.

What do these buildings have in common? First, an architectural style that combines elements of different eras, in particular, antiquity and the Gothic. Secondly, the scale of the buildings, most of them were simply cyclopean, such as Pennsylvania Station in New York City.

Third, not explicit, but in my opinion, which clarifies the reasons for the mass demolition of these buildings, namely that there were certain symbols and images in the interiors and exterior dÃ©cor which were forbidden in the new world.

text:
The mystery of the ancient map, which is several hundred years ahead of its image. 

The Piri Race map still leaves many questions. 

This map of 1500, is still a mystery to many scientists. Even the simplest person who has only seen an Yandex map will probably ask himself: How was it possible to create the present earth 500 years ago? 

If you dig a little deeper, a number of other questions pop up, one of which is: How did the cartographer manage to create a map of America, if at that time it was only known about it by hearsay? 

It is worth noting that some of the lands on the map, in those years was not known to people at all. They were discovered decades after this highly accurate map was created. Antarctica was discovered three centuries later. But most surprisingly, the subglacial continent has the clear outlines of today. Many scientists agree and believe that the map was made thanks to data from other civilizations.

text:
The mystery of the ancient iridium mask 12 thousand years old

Amazing artifacts of antiquity are causing a sensation not only among people, but also among scientists. When an old mask made of an unusual unearthly metal was found, many hypotheses were expressed.

But none of them could explain how ancient people managed to extract iridium from a cosmic body.

The mask was found in Florida. The uniqueness of the mask lies in the fact that it is made of the rarest metal - iridium. There is no such metal in the bowels of the earth. It can only be found in meteorites that fell to the earth's surface.

Experts have determined the age of the mask. The age of the mask was determined: about ten to twelve thousand years. The mask is very fine work and many archaeological experts are surprised at the technological process used in the manufacture of this artifact.

text:
Welding technology was known in the 19th century, but apparently was not considered as effective as riveting. They fastened everything from pipes to bridges to ships with the same ease as nails to wood. They were somehow melted into even the hardest-to-reach places, even though they were made of steel.

Today, such a perfect connection can only be achieved with a CNC riveting press. But you understand yourself - it's difficult, expensive, and also noisy and vibrating. But how did our ancestors do it?

In the old pictures there is a riveter's tool, to which some kind of hose is attached. Apparently, this device melted the rivet and firmly seated it in the hole of the joint, requiring no helpers, no time, and no effort.

text:
A puzzle for scientists was found in Shelbyville, Illinois, USA. The town was founded in 1827, which is very recent by historical standards.

How the town ended up 4-5 meters above ground is a mystery. It seems that it was built recently, the sea and oceans are far away, typhoons do not reach the center of the country. There is, however, a lake about a kilometer from the city, but in order for it to reach the city and turn it into a small Atlantis, it will take a whole sea of water to pour into it.

The excavated structure itself is also impressive - the arched openings, columns, and red bricks seem vaguely familiar. In most of the excavated cities, surprisingly, the buildings are built as if from a template.

text:
Slavic Vendian village in Germany survived to this day. The main feature is the circular construction (Circular Villages)

The Slavic peoples in the 8th-9th centuries occupied huge territories, reaching as far south as the Byzantine Empire and as far west as the Kingdom of the Franks.
All of the Pomerania and most of present-day Germany were inhabited by the Polabian Slavs. They were so named for their residence on the Elbe River, which the Slavs called the Labe. They plowed the land, kept cattle and were engaged in trade along the rivers.

It was the Polabian Slavs who founded the city of Berlin. All cities with the accented ending in -in,-ov-its-au refer to Slavic names. Berlin, Schwerin, Witzin, Lubov, Teterev, Lutov, Kemnitz, Dobranitz, Lubenau, and Torgau are all Slavic names.

Juan Escobar's words can be believed, given how the CIA and FBI have turned a blind eye for years to the U.S. drug bust.

text:
The Rosenthal Effect

A psychological phenomenon in which a person's expectations of the fulfillment of a prophecy largely determine the nature of his actions and interpretations of the reactions of others, which provokes the self-fulfillment of the prophecy. 

For example: a group of college students (none of whom knew each other) were divided into pairs. One person in each pair, chosen at random, was given special information: some students in the pair were told that their partner liked them, and some that they didn't. The pairs of students were then given the opportunity to meet and talk to each other. As the researchers predicted, those students 
who thought they liked their partner were nicer to their partner. They were more frank, disagreed less on the topics discussed, and were generally more cordial and agreeable than students who thought they did not like their partner.

text:
Why people believe in chemtrails 

In 2007, Louisiana State Television reported that the skies were covered with airplane tracks and that concentrations of barium salts were seen in the atmosphere HIGHER than normal. The TV station concluded that chemtrails were to blame. 

It turned out that the TV channel made a mistake and miscalculated the concentration. But in the minds of people it was fixed that the population was poisoned from airplanes.

text:
The Classified Census: How Millions of Soviet Citizens Disappeared

In 1937, a census was conducted in the Soviet Union. After it was completed, it was classified and those responsible for it were arrested.

It was supposed that more than 165 million people lived in the USSR at that time. In fact it turned out that the population was not more than 162 million people. 

Where several million Soviet citizens disappeared to remains a mystery

text:
"Enemy of the State" is a predictive film.

The main character tries to convince those around him that their every move is being tracked by the secret services. In 1998 such a plot seemed unrealistic. 

But 15 years later it became known that the U.S. is really conducting mass surveillance. The film predicted events when Edward Snowden was declared an enemy of the state.

text:
This unusual boulder is located in Wyoming (USA), and in narrow circles of "initiates" (among climbers), this place is quite famous - there is one of the extreme routes to the cliffs Dihedrals (Dihedrals Wall).
In translation sounds like "Falling Block" (Falling Block) or "Cube". 

There is little information about it. But what you can see on the photo is quite admirable: the huge size - the height of the block is about 23 meters (75 feet), two fairly flat facets are located almost at 90 degrees, and strange parallel grooves indicate the traces of machining.

text:
A map with the continents of Liberia and Asgard.

Strange as it may seem, Hitler was convinced of the existence of more advanced civilizations of the past, and wanted to find the knowledge and technology of the past.

But the most interesting thing begins after the Germans visited Tibet and the monks, who supposedly had something to tell them about past civilizations.

Immediately afterwards, the Ahnenerbe headed for Antarctica, and judging by documents and maps, they tried to get into the hollow part of the Earth through a passage in the glaciers. To what extent this succeeded is unknown, as is whether or not anything can be found there at all.

But purely for coincidence, it is strange that right after Tibet, Hitler became interested in Antarctica, and together with the maps headed for the mysterious continent. In any case, it is impossible to know the truth.

text:
A model of an unknown city in stone.

There are many mysteries with this find. A unique thing for ancient times. A real 3D model of an ancient city. And scientists have not been able to determine what kind of city it depicts. At the moment, almost everything connected with this find remains a mystery. There is no mention of the layout in ancient sources, its age is impossible to determine what city it depicts too.

The layout is carved from granite, and this indicates the great capabilities of its creators, for it requires appropriate tools for processing. The question remains and how the ancient Indians were able to depict the city in volumetric model? To achieve such accuracy is necessary to look at the city from a great height, and for this you need equipment.

Did the ancient Indians have such knowledge? If so, where did they come from? And if not, then who built this model, when and for what purpose?

text:
In April, while digging a fountain in Vladivostok, workers discovered an underground tunnel. The procedure in such cases has long been defined - archaeologists and historians are sent to the site, construction is suspended. 

But the situation turned into a scandal, and it was not possible to preserve the historical heritage - the workers destroyed the find before the arrival of specialists. Article 7.14.1 by the way. The historical discovery is now destroyed together with the tunnel, and frankly, the situation is not good! I do not even know what is worse - falsification of history or its intentional destruction.

text:
The Maya Train is a major railroad project (1,472 kilometers) that will take tourists to the Yucatan Peninsula during the day and be used to transport goods at night. During construction, the media erupted with photos of figurines depicting extraterrestrial beings embraced by a typical Mayan.

While people argue whether the figurines are real or not, the National Foundation for Tourism Development got away with a short statement "Fake. The images are made of modern materials, despite the presence of Mexican symbols as well as those of Peru."

What about radiocarbon analysis? Metallography, spectral analysis, stone structure determinations? These seem to be the very analyses that allow you to tell if you have found an ancient artifact or if you are a victim of forgers. Fake or not, where is the research?

Briefly about how the scientific community works.

Did you always think Stonehenge was several thousand years old?

You thought it was built by Druids and extraterrestrials, because scientists are very vocal about it. Dozens of documentaries have been made about it. But on television they would not say that it was reconstructed in 1954-1958, that is completely redone, moved from another place and rebuilt again from the metal blocks with plaster (that is a fake).

text:
Daniel Keller's map of 1590 is valuable not only for the outlines of the countries, but also for the signatures left by the cartographer. 

"Sarmatia Asiatica and Scythia had long been inhabited, with the Persians and the Medes continually waging war and with their surrounding neighbors. The Sarmatians and Scythians fought Alexander the Great with great fanaticism, but very hard."

"Beyond the Volga to the east opposite the Caucasus Mountains live the great Tartars, the chief and oldest of which are the Yezahadars, the Perekops, the Kozans, the Nagai and the Cossacks, collectively they are called the Horde. "

"The islands of Yapan, which Marco Polo calls Zipangri...pay tribute to the Great Ham" - I can already see the Japanese sailing to get a yoke to reign.

"The Hungarians descended from the Yugros" - yes, yes, the ancestors of the Slavs populated Europe. Historians don't like it, but the evidence is already too much.

text:
Mavro Orbini referred to Bernardo Giustiniani and his History of Venice when describing the history of the Slavs:

"Then an indomitable Slavic tribe first invaded Istria and reached the outskirts of Venice. This tribe of Scythian origin, attacking with other tribes in the Roman Empire, has earned itself a glorious name for military prowess.

Slavs of Scythian origin? Considering that the Scythians officially died out in the 4th c. AD, and the Slavic ethnogenesis developed no later than the same 4th c. in the same territories, the relationship of the Slavs with the Scythians is quite real.

text:
Science confirms that the crust of the mid-ocean ridges is the youngest, near the shores at the bottom is the oldest. When trying to superimpose Mercator's map of Hyperborea on the modern globe, the details did not fit together. But if you splice the map, impose it without the ocean floor, only with the shelves, then Scandinavia fits perfectly, Novaya Zemlya stands on the modern position, the coasts of N. America and Taymyr are also approximately in their place. 

Mercator's map of the 16th century showed that Iceland moved to the South over the centuries, Greenland was slightly turned around. Parts of Hyperborea: Svaga and Rai are now the northern part of the island archipelago of North America. The southern part of H'Ara is the Novosibirsk Islands. Franz Josef Land is also x'Ara. Spitsbergen is part of Thule. Each continent has inherited a little from ancient Hyperborea due to the movement of tectonic plates.

text:
Mysterious Crimean pyramids

In 1991, a unique complex of seven underground pyramids was discovered in the Crimea. Their height is 45 to 52 meters, and the tops are almost at ground level. They had been discovered by the scientist Vitaly Goh, who had been searching for the underground water sources.

In 2001, the Crimean pyramids began to be studied by scientists from different countries. The opinion of all the scientists agreed in one thing: these pyramids are real and unique. They scanned the pyramids with different newest devices and as a result they discovered new pyramids. Among all the pyramids that were found in the Crimea the pyramid that is located near Ai-Petri is considered to be the largest. Under one of them was found a statue of Sphinx, it is smaller than the Egyptian Sphinx, but externally it exactly repeats its outlines, but looking to the west.

It turned out that there is a cut inscription with the title: Adil Giray Great Khan of Tartar, Perekop, Crimean, Nogai. Cut out was a small mention of the Tartar Khan and what lands belonged to it. Trifles, against the background of global falsification of history!

text:
Vegetarianism in the 1860s

Did you know that vegetarianism in pre-revolutionary Russia was commonplace?

In Russia, vegetarianism came in the mid-1860s, when the first society of vegetarians appeared in St. Petersburg.
It was called "neither fish nor meat" as a joke. At the beginning of the century it was headed by Alexander Petrovich Zelenkov, a doctor of medicine and a surgeon. His wife in 1913 published the first vegetarian cookbook with the title "I Don't Eat Nobody".

The ideas of renouncing meat became very popular among educated youth, students, and intellectuals.

text:
Popadance is not just a word from the vocabulary of science fiction writers. In 1880, an American farmer bought coal for his fireplace, mined from a depth of 90 meters. As he began to crush it, the farmer came across an old ring. 

The problem is that the rock was dated at about 60 million years old, but mankind appeared only 2.6 million years ago. The little coal-rock hitter was called Eve's Ring and the ring quickly became one of the most controversial finds.

text:
In 1651 the Dutch painter Abraham van Westerfeld visited Kiev and made a number of amazing drawings. The ruins of the city and beggars, cripples begging for alms.

The Polish diplomat who visited Kiev in 1596 has signed a note to the drawings: "The monuments of former greatness remain: the gates of ancient structure, high that two carts, put one on the other, don't reach their tops. In the city itself there are many destroyed churches. One of them remains - St. Sophia, but even that, in such a miserable form, that worship does not take place in it.

It turns out that Kiev was once a grandiose city, but some mysterious events destroyed it, and its mysteries remained in the past.

The Tatar-Mongol yoke opposed Catholicism

It is no coincidence that the campaign of Batu Khan to Russia and the campaigns of the Teutonic Knights took place in the same period of time.

By the way, the Teutonic knights carried out a real genocide in the captured Russian cities. Batyi's nomads never ravaged Russian churches.

Batyi's army invaded the European lands, which were under Catholic rule. Such legibility indicates that the main task of Khan was not to conquer Europe, but to fight against ocatholicization.

text:
NASA deliberately colored the Martian photos red, because "because of the reddish hue of the surface given by the mineral maghemite," Mars was called a red planet.

I won't point out that photo conversion reduces sharpness by about 15%, we lose fine detail and can't distinguish the presence of minerals, water and metals because of the color and decreased contrast.

For decades, NASA denied the accusations of photo redaction (although they were caught by the fact that the color details of Mars rovers have changed their colors in the pictures) and suddenly they announced that the Perseveranc apparatus images convey the real color of the planet - golden, grayish, gray-blue sky over Mars, quite familiar to the earthly eye landscape. 

A logical question - how can we believe the results of their missions, if for several decades they gave out false information about the "red planet" as the truth?

text:
In 1901, W. Flinders Petrie studied a cave with an ancient Egyptian burial and found two horoscopes on the ceiling. When trying to establish the date, it turned out that the horoscope did not care that traditional Egyptologists attributed the find to the 1st century AD. The planets categorically didn't want to fit into that time frame and hinted that the scientists were some kind of Capricorns.

Finally, the researchers spat on the dates and just reconstructed the position of the planets. It turned out that one buried died in 1049, and the second in 1065 AD. Now I understand why many artifacts, drawings and frescoes are so well preserved - banal error of dating. The question is, how real are the rest of the figures of Egyptian history?

text:
Saying "my brain" is not correct, because it is most likely not our brain, but our own.

Special studies were conducted in which a person placed in a tomograph was given simple logical tasks. The results of these studies were so surprising that at first the scientists themselves refused to believe them. The fact is that, judging by the activity recorded by the tomograph, it took several seconds from the moment the brain made a decision to the moment the person gave an answer. 

For the speed of nerve impulse propagation this is a very long time, i.e. we could not put it down to mere delays. It turns out that even a few seconds before we give an answer to some task, the brain itself has already made a decision about what answer to give. But what is even more striking is that after that the brain sent a special impulse to the person, something like: "don't worry, you made the decision purely on your own.

text:
"Black Day" on Yamal.

Almost 90 years ago, Soviet geologists working on the Yamal Peninsula witnessed the onset of the "black day". It was a kind of mystical phenomenon - a cloud of absolute darkness suddenly fell on the land.

In addition to the already frightening phenomenon, all the radio stations on the peninsula were suddenly silenced. No matter how hard people tried, they couldn't pick up a working radio station.

Of course, scientists made an attempt to understand and overcome the frightening phenomenon. At its simplest, they launched several flares into the sky. However, an unusually dense cloud of darkness took over the sky over the area. Not a single particle of sunlight could penetrate this blockade, and the flares simply disappeared in this darkness.
Surprisingly, there was no ash in the cloud, or any other particles that could explain such an astounding phenomenon.

Meanwhile, the "black eclipse" lasted for an hour, after which the anomalous haze dissipated on its own.

text:
The 'Pit of Despair' Experiment

In 1971, psychologist Harry Harlow decided to study clinical depression on monkeys.

The scientist placed the babies for eight months in a cage, very similar to a pit.

All the subjects could see from the outside world were the hands of the experimenter, who put food and changed the bedding.

At first the monkeys tried to get out, but then fell into a state of apathy. Then came depression, from which the animals could not get out. After the experiment was over, attempts were made to socialize the monkeys, but the attempts to reintroduce them to society ended in complete failure.
The macaques did not want to respond to their congeners, becoming completely "unhuman. Their actions were slow and insecure, and some of them became "crazy".

As a result of this experiment, it was concluded that primates (and humans) need the society of their own kind for normal development.

"Social creatures can be destroyed by destroying their social bonds."

text:
Iran has a system of water tunnels that still supply water to remote areas to this day. The system built by the ancient Persians is simple: hundreds of tunnels run from high water-saturated areas at a minimum angle to arid regions throughout the country. 

This is not a new discovery, but it has been possible to appreciate the technological level not so long ago. Imagine, 5 BC, 50.000 tunnels built (from 7 to 80 km), a total length of 350.000 km (almost the distance from the Earth to the Moon). Each tunnel has vertical wells (17.5 million in total), the deepest of which is 300m. At the same time the walls and the bottom of the channel are stone, made in the form of giant sectional stone pipes.

Today, similar structures are built using similar technology, but how the Persians accomplished this more than 2,500 years ago is difficult for archaeologists to explain.

text:
In Tula, the ancient capital of the Toltecs, enormous five-meter basalt columns in the form of warriors, mounted on a stepped platform, called "statues of Atlantes", are still preserved.

"Atlantean statues" attract researchers with strange "outfits" and objects, which historians interpret as cult-religious (symbols of priests - Toltecs), and representatives of alternative views consider objects of highly developed civilization.

In the center is a pneumatic jackhammer.

text:
Overlaying old maps on modern terrain, finding old Tartarian cities would be difficult. How can you not believe in point impacts on the planet, when perfectly flat craters are at the site of each city?

In Siberia, such sinkholes often become "devil's lakes". In Mongolia, on the other hand, rivers and lakes often dry up, and the craters clearly show that only flat land, different in color from the surrounding area, is left in place of the city. Space bodies enter the atmosphere at an inclination, and to imagine that thousands of fragments fall all over the planet at right angles, leaving a crater of 5-7 km. is something from the realm of science fiction. They didn't manually tear down the mountains and earth with a shovel, did they?

text:
China's 7,000-year heritage

They are some of the earliest and largest groups of petroglyphs in the world.Together, the petroglyphs form an art gallery, stretching for about a thousand kilometers.

The total number of petroglyphs of Yinshan exceeds 50,000, and it is the largest cluster of rock art in the world.Most of the images are in the Hari mountain range, stretching 5 kilometers, on Black Mountain.

The petroglyphs of Yinshan have a variety of subjects.

For example, they depict birds, animals, horseback riding and hunting, grazing, warfare, dancing, and everyday scenes. There are also depictions of the sun, moon, stars, various symbols and signs, deities and caves.

It remains unknown who left these petroglyphs for us and whether we fully understand their meaning.

text:
There is a remote area of the Northern Urals called Maly Chender. This is the very north of the Perm region. There is the Black Pyramid Mountain there. You can see that the neighboring mountains are irregular in shape. But this is an absolutely isosceles pyramid. The mountain consists entirely of quartzite. There used to be a mine at the base.

By the way, in the "most anomalous zone of Russia" - Molebka (Perm region), there are many quartzites. Under certain conditions, when the rocks are compressed, static electricity accumulates in them, i.e. they are such resonators and energy accumulators.  But here, the entire mountain is made up of quartzite. Often there are different visual effects: spheres, glows. Plus, there is the effect on people. They experience fear, physical sensations.

text:
There are a huge number of buried houses in St. Petersburg, early and mid-19th century.

The photos only show houses from three streets, but there are a lot of streets in St. Petersburg. Houses from Shpalernaya, Tchaikovsky, and Gagarinskaya Streets. All of them, according to pundits, were "built that way. Of course they were built this way, in the basement from time to time, to ventilate it is necessary to open a window, and how to open a window if there is no window? The basement must have a window, and in order to get more fresh air, there must be several windows. Only the scientists have not taken into account that in some houses, the door was half-under the ground, and the photographs show that the doors have been lifted, and some windows are so windowed that they cannot be opened, or the earth will soak into the basement. And in the last photo is the house of A.A. Rzewski. Built, according to scientists, in the early 19th century.

text:
During the era of general looting of the tombs of Egypt, Greece and Rome, there was evidence of lamps that burned from the time of burial.

Such a lamp was found in the tomb of Cicero's daughter, where it burned in an airtight room for 1600 years. Another was found in 1500 in the Bay of Naples, another in Antioch in the 6th century, in Indian, Chinese, Egyptian temples and even in Central and South America. 

The wicks of these lamps are made of fire-resistant asbestos. It is weather-alkaline-wear-resistant, though it conducts electricity poorly. But it can be the shell of the wick, protecting it for hundreds of years. Everlasting, no soot, impervious to the absence of oxygen, and the strange appearance of these products - electric light fixture as it were. True, no battery will last that long, but electricity in the atmosphere is endless. But as long as its existence is ignored by scientists, they will not solve the riddle of eternal lamps.

text:
Russian bylinas are also reflected and paralleled in the legends of other nations.

Bylina "Volkh Vseslavievich" - Prince Volkh with his troops goes to India. The Greeks went to India Dionysus, aka Bacchus, and the Hindus a similar myth is the legend of the arrival of the Aryans to India with Indra at the head. It is funny that the Russian Volkh, the Greek Dionysus and the Indian Indra were werewolves. Apparently, the others did not go to India.

In the byliny "The Death of Svyatogor," our hero Svyatogor dies the same death as the Egyptian god Osiris: he decided to try on a coffin (how could he not?), lay in it and could not get out. 

"Ilya Muromets and Falconer": Ilya fighting his unrecognized son. The Iranians have the bogatyr Rustam fighting his unrecognized son, and the Greeks have Odysseus fighting his son Telegon. 

The same stories recorded by different peoples under different names.

text:
Another event that history does not mention happened in 1465, right on the wedding day of King Alfonso II of Naples.

It was then, in October, that the inhabitants noticed the Sun take on a strange dark blue hue, after which darkness ensued, like nighttime.

After that, it rained for many more months in Europe, flooding many basements and villages. For several years the fish in the ponds froze, and the trees and grass did not grow.

Already in the 20th century, it was said that it was because of a volcanic eruption, only what kind, have not been found. But what is most interesting, such a small ice age occurred in 1816, and all also tried to write off Tambora volcano located in the southern hemisphere, but stronger volcanoes erupt quite in the northern hemisphere, they do not cause anything like this.

text:
While fighting in Flanders, Major Summerford was struck by lightning, leaving him paralyzed in his lower body. He left military service and went to Vancouver. In 1924, the retired major was fishing on the river bank when lightning struck the tree under which he was sitting. 

The major, barely recovered from the last lightning, was paralyzed on the right side of his body. Two years later Mr. Summerford learned to walk again and was even able to walk to a nearby park, but in 1930 lightning struck him again. This time the major was completely paralyzed and died in short order.

The story did not end with his death. After his funeral, lightning struck his tombstone three more times.

There are other examples of the selectivity of lightning. In 1899 it struck an Italian man dead. Exactly 30 years later, at the same place, lightning killed his son, and in 1949 his great-grandson was struck by lightning.

text_entities.text:
While fighting in Flanders, Major Summerford was struck by lightning, leaving him paralyzed in his lower body. He left military service and went to Vancouver. In 1924, the retired major was fishing on the river bank when lightning struck the tree under which he was sitting. 

The major, barely recovered from the last lightning, was paralyzed on the right side of his body. Two years later Mr. Summerford learned to walk again and was even able to walk to a nearby park, but in 1930 lightning struck him again. This time the major was completely paralyzed and died in short order.

The story did not end with his death. After his funeral, lightning struck his tombstone three more times.

There are other examples of the selectivity of lightning. In 1899 it struck an Italian man dead. Exactly 30 years later, at the same place, lightning killed his son, and in 1949 his great-grandson was struck by lightning.
Forbidden Science

text:
Perfect carvings

The columns of the Shravanbelagol temple complex (India) clearly demonstrate the high knowledge of the ancient craftsmen. The temple was erected in record time in the 10th century. 

Scientists can not answer the question of how the carved columns were created and why they are preserved in perfect condition to this day, because, without lathes and milling machines, it is simply impossible to make it.

text:
The French National Library has posted on the Internet 50 maps digitized in the form of a globe. If you compare the maps of the 15th-19th centuries, the ecliptic on them changes several times, up to its last turn in the 19th century. 

The ecliptic is "the circle of the celestial sphere through which the annual motion of the Sun, as seen from Earth, occurs in relation to the stars." For sailors, astrologers, scientists, and travelers, it is a very important thing, literally pointing to guiding stars and directions. As the observed celestial objects change, it means that the position of the Earth in outer space has changed.

What caused this shift remains to be seen, but the change of axes has already been confirmed on maps.

text:
In Bosnia they found a pyramid of 40-ton blocks, higher than the pyramid of Cheops. Steps lead to it, at the foot is a road of paving stones, in the depth are cut out terraces and stones with runes are found. A total of five pyramids were found in the valley at Visoko, connected by a network of underground tunnels.

The Bosnian Ministry of Culture first supported, and then turned away from the discovery of scientists: the pyramids made of stone really are, but they were created "in the course of natural formation, without human participation. Archaeologist Osmanagich called a landing of specialists from all over the world - Italian professors and famous Egyptologist Nabil Abdel-Swelim presented a report: the natural formation is not proven, the steps and terraces are man-made.

The ministry ignored the report, the "self-grew" version has not been cancelled.

A different geography of the Earth can be traced in a 16th-century fresco located in the small Italian town of Caprarola, with a population of about 5,000 people.

Each of the map frescoes is worth examining in detail, because the details are so unfamiliar to the eye. I'll start with my favorite - South America is connected to the beautiful and green Antarctica. According to official history, only in 1820, the land of Antarctica will be discovered and generally it will be proved to be a continent.

text:
Due to the fact that traditional geology claims that stone rocks form over millions of years, some researchers are convinced that artifacts in stone (slugs, rods, laths) are the same age.

Why should crystal growth, fossilization, and hydration take millions of years in nature? Modern cement hardens within a month, magma hardens within a couple of days, drilling mud hardens within an hour, even in water.

The rapidity of fossilization can be judged by one find - a coin from 1946, frozen in stone. It turns out that many controversial artifacts may be only a couple of centuries old.

text:
Egyptology claims that the sphinx was built during the time of Pharaoh Cheops or his son, 2.5 thousand years B.C. The basis for the questionable dating was that it could refer to this era by its "artistic features".

In 1857 in Egypt was found "Inventory stele", on which the Egyptian in stone was indicated that Cheops only repaired the damaged statue, and had nothing to do with the construction.

In the 20th century the American geologist R. Schoch proved that the vertical erosion marks on the Sphinx were the result of rainfall. But it had not rained in Egypt for at least 8 thousand years. 

Immediately after Schoch's publication, the Egyptian authorities began the restoration of the Sphinx. Now the lower two-thirds of the monument are closed with new masonry, and the top of the sculpture is scrubbed - almost no traces of erosion remain.

text:
Ni'ihau Island, Hawaii

Ni'ihau, also known as "Forbidden Island," has been privately owned by the Robinson family since 1864. The island has no telephone service, no automobiles, and no paved roads.

Solar panels provide the island's residents with electricity, and water comes from rainwater harvesting. Even relatives of the residents can only visit Niihau by special permission. What this family is hiding is anyone's guess.

text:
English television is trying to get to the bottom of a frightening phenomenon - why there are more unexplained deaths among the young and healthy in Britain. 

The presenter compared two graphs: covid vaccination rates and excess death rates. It turned out that Bulgaria had the lowest vaccination rate and the lowest excess death rate. And Portugal, on the contrary, has the highest mortality rate and the highest vaccination rate.

Coincidence?

text:
The word "robot" was invented in 1920. But the first robot, or automaton in the form of a maid, was invented in the 3rd century B.C. This miracle of ancient Greek robotics filled a bowl with wine by mixing it with water. The liquids were fed from two containers with tubes.

There are mentions of a mechanical pigeon capable of flying and created in 400 BC.

According to legend, even Ivan the Terrible had a mechanical servant.

Why then did mankind stagnate for many centuries and could be sent to the bonfire for mentioning such mechanisms?

text:
Mysterious phenomenon - Martha's lights 
 
The phenomenon has been observed in the United States in west Texas. The orbs, called Martha's lights, can change color and disappear when a person approaches them. They come in yellowish, bright orange, football-sized colors. In the middle of the last century, whole groups of people on horseback or in cars went on expeditions, wanting to get close to the lights to learn more about them. 
 
Their "behavior" seems reasonable: when a person is at a distance, the ball seems to watch him, it is worth approaching - it increases speed and disappears. 
 
Sometimes, according to eyewitnesses, the lights of Marfa merge with objects flying from the sky, emitting a bright light. At this time, the cars of people who were in the area of the phenomenon do not start. Unusual and mysterious phenomena.

The 19th century "lapota peasants" did not do a bad job.

text:
Klenke's 17th-century atlas, from which the images of the Tartars and Muscovites were taken (look, don't get confused!) is worth looking at not only in scanned form, but also in real size. The page format is 1.75 by 1.9m.

In Pereslavl-Zalessky there is a copy of the Gospel of enormous size. From the photo, I think the size of such books is clear. For people of our stature (and we are told that over the past centuries the population has increased in stature considerably, due to nutrition and comfortable conditions for life), such weight is prohibitive even for weight-lifters, for a gift version they are not worthy, and for their carrying or use special mechanisms are needed. Dozens of similar editions have survived, where even the font is excessive for a person of normal height.

"The sons of God began to enter into the daughters of men; from this were born giants..." Shall we add books to the selection of tall doors and pictures of giants?

text:
Virtually all of Perm has ancient rooms and passages underneath, no worse than those described in the Grustin legends. This is why, despite the subway plan drawn up by the USSR Council of Ministers and the constant collection of signatures, the city has never seen a subway. It is costly to stop the construction at every discovery and to change the route; it is expensive to reconstruct these buildings, and to destroy them is historical vandalism. So they stand mothballed, waiting for their archaeologist.

As in V. Rakov's poem "In memory of Nikolai Zarubin":
Under Perm there is a low sound and long voids,
The subterranean bee there fills the honeycomb,
There the time accumulates, thickening by winter,
And the body of the painter Nikolai slumbers...

text:
In Zaporozhye, a serious "cultural layer" was discovered in old Aleksandrovsk.

In this city, most houses built before the mid-19th century have windows under the ground. No one is surprised by this now, because in most cities in Russia and Europe this is the case. These houses are not "built that way" there are basement and semi-basement, but there is no point in making a full-fledged window with a frame and a sash, so then to bury it and leave a quarter of the outside, and often even then put a brick. The semicircular arches above the windows show that some of the windows are bricked up, and in one of the brickwork there is a hole through which you can see the window frame. Well, if that's not how it was built, then it is a "cultural layer".

text:
Atmospheric pressure and salt are evidence of disaster.

Virtually all living things experience salt deficiency in the body. In doing so, the body replenishes it by drawing salt from other tissues, destroying bones and muscles. When atmospheric pressure drops, blood cells swell and burst. To avoid this, it is necessary to salt the blood.

Inside a human cell, the pressure is almost 8 times higher than atmospheric pressure, indicating that we are made for other conditions. For example, the pressure in the air bubbles in amber is 8 to 10 atmospheres, which was the pressure when they were formed.

Imagine a cell like a balloon. It's already on the verge, a slight decrease in pressure, and it's ready to burst. That is why our bodies are weakened, our lifespan is only 50-100 years and most people, from small changes in pressure - suffer. Noah lived 900 years and there are legends that in Russia there were old men who lived 300 years, and now 100 years is considered longevity.

text:
Hardly anyone can imagine that only 300 years ago there was a subtropical climate in seemingly cold Russia, but many facts just say so.
Large windows and large doors, which are clearly not designed for a cold climate.

In the same St. Petersburg palaces have huge windows, all with a heating system not previously worked out. It is worth imagining what it is like to live in a building with dozens of huge windows, when no stoves are not enough for heating, though they did not exist then.

And only later thermal vestibules were made at the entrances, stove pipes, which were previously absent from the pictures, started to appear. So maybe the so-called 1816 "year without summer" was a turning point in the climate of Russia?

text:
My favorite moment in the story of the Alexander Column was its fall. While loading the column, 28 planks of flooring broke and the column fell to the edge of the ship, but 600 soldiers picked up the column and held it bravely for two days until they made new flooring for loading.

Now slowly and with numbers: 600 soldiers ran 36 versts (that's 40km in 4 hours. Let's omit that it was a marathon run - the column had to be saved!), and then held the column of 700 tons. That's over a ton per person (supermen, not soldiers). So still this 700 ton column didn't sink in 4 hours while waiting for the soldiers, it only tilted the ship a bit. For humanitarians, far from shipbuilding, it is recommended to read about "center of gravity", "angle of flooding and calculation of stability". The column will go into the water, turning the vessel upside down, no options.

To summarize: Montferrand's drawing is pure fiction, and it is unknown how the column was loaded and delivered.

text:
The Chinese ambassador Tulishen, who was passing through Siberia, wrote to his emperor in 1714:

"There is a beast in this cold country, which walks in the underground... The name of this beast is "mammunt", and in Chinese "hishu ..."

Surprisingly detailed describe the mammoth Siberians: "peaceful creature, 3.5 meters in the withers, with powerful tusks, with which he can deal with the master of the taiga - the bear.

Suppose that a few did survive and for some reason live in subterranean caves. Fantastic? Only for those who don't know that modern elephants don't just take shelter from bad weather in caves, but enter them for hunting - they chop up pieces of rock with their tusks in search of mineral-rich salts and chew them thoroughly. There is a finding of an entire mammoth skeleton in the Mammoth Cave. How did it get there, other than with its own feet?

text:
In the 1500s, in southern India, the astronomer Esthadeva wrote mathematical notes in ink on palm leaves. He wrote the forerunners of the system of calculus, demonstrating infinite extensions of series of trigonometric functions and a system of complex calculations

This was 400 years before Sir Isaac Newton had differential and integral calculus. Before Pierre de Fermat, Gottfried Leibniz, and other great mathematicians had developed methods for decomposing polynomials in algebra, solving equations by iteration, and infinite chain fractions-Esthadeva had already done so. True, the scientific world managed to forget about it for four centuries, but that's what scientists are still sinning about. 

All new is well forgotten old.

On the map of Antique Europe in 1595 by Maestro Ortelius there is no Roman Empire, but on the border with Gaul there is Scythia and Sarmatia. Could it be that the cartographer overlooked a huge empire?

The inconsistencies also lead to the main symbol of Rome, the statue of the Capitoline she-wolf, which was described by Pliny and Cicero in the 1st century. During the restoration in 2006 it turned out that the statue was created in the 11th or 12th century. If the ancient statues were created in parts and welded together, the Wolf Woman was cast all at once and in one piece, which was only possible during the Middle Ages. A novelty!

Another interesting detail - the statue was moved by order of Pope Sixtus 4 in the 15th century. That is, since the founding of Rome, the statue suddenly "appears" in the Middle Ages, and even at the personal command of the Vatican (ethically be silent about the love of the Holy See to meddling in history and falsifying it

text:
Joan of Arc, a 15th-century French heroine burned at the stake at age 19 as a witch and a heretic.

Thanks to Catholic Church propaganda, several remains were picked up from the scene of Joan of Arc's execution, which only surfaced in the church in 1867 - a piece of burnt cloth and fragments of a rib and thigh. These pieces were exhibited by churches and museums as objects of worship and evidence of a great history, until...

In 2006, two dozen scientists undertook analyses. The results: the tissue was not burned but simply stained with soot, the remains of the bones had been embalmed, and they belonged to a man who lived in the 7th-3rd century B.C. and a cat. The cat also lived in the 7th-3rd century B.C. and he too has had time to be worshipped by pilgrims, and scientists have argued about Jeanne's fine and noble bone.

What an embarrassing situation indeed. Apparently some especially sacred remains are forbidden to be examined for a reason

text:
Akhichhatra is an ancient city described in the ancient epic Mahabharata. In the 19th and 20th centuries excavations were conducted and the city turned out to be real.

During the excavations they found a pyramidal temple with an area of 187 hectares and a height of 22m. The remains of the earliest layers were dated at 2000 BC. Look carefully at the chronicle of the pyramid excavations. The structure is several thousand years old, and it was found not so long ago. Maybe after all scientists will pay attention that pyramidal hills sometimes are necessary to examine for a man-made structure?

Has it ever bothered you that the Scythians, being nomads by life, had the highest goldsmithing industry? 

If all the jewelry was made to them by the Greeks at the order of the Scythian nobility, then what kind of nobility could have nomads who do not even have a state: where they stopped, there is their homeland. And if the Scythians did not make the ornaments themselves, then why did the ordered articles have higher complexity and better quality than those made by the Greeks for themselves?

text:
About overpopulation.

"There are 7 billion people on earth, soon we'll have nothing to eat and the population must be reduced." We've all heard this story.

Let's use our heads. How many people can fit in a square of one meter by one meter? If it's tight? Four people. Now 7 billion divided by 4 = 1.75 billion square meters, or 1,750 square kilometers, which is less than the area of Moscow, its area is 2,550 square kilometers.

That is, the entire population of the planet can fit in Moscow, and there will be room left, but no one will tell you about it.

text:
Slavic Vendian village in Germany survived to this day. The main feature is the circular construction (Circular Villages)

The Slavic peoples in the 8th-9th centuries occupied huge territories, reaching as far south as the Byzantine Empire and as far west as the Kingdom of the Franks.
All of the Pomerania and most of present-day Germany were inhabited by the Polabian Slavs. They were so named for their residence on the Elbe River, which the Slavs called the Labe. They plowed the land, kept cattle and were engaged in trade along the rivers.

It was the Polabian Slavs who founded the city of Berlin. All cities with the accented ending in -in,-ov-its-au refer to Slavic names. Berlin, Schwerin, Witzin, Lubov, Teterev, Lutov, Kemnitz, Dobranitz, Lubenau, and Torgau are all Slavic names.

text:
Trovanites are rocks that grow on their own if water gets on them. The scientists' hypotheses are a little unclear, but approximate chemical forms have sort of been shown. Let's not specify that in addition to expansion, trovantes are capable of reproducing by budding, like regular mushrooms (which somewhat does not fit into a coherent scientific theory).

Studying the trenthans, I suddenly came to the conclusion that they have a lot in common with the polygonal mosaic of Sacsayhuaman. The same Voronoi mosaic structure, the same base-mushroom in the ground. Throw the trovent germs on the wall of the earthen terrace, they grow and no machinery is needed to install them, and no stones individually need to be carved. Look at the rock in California, the Crocodile trovent, and the Saxioman masonry. Do you believe that every stone was hand-carved?

text:
Compare images of the "ruin tower" in Tsarskoye Selo. Robert Hubert (1783), Ivan Belsky (1788) and Ivan Ivanov (early 19th century) recorded the Tower for posterity

Hubert was not in Russia, and his painting was based on sketches by Count A. Stroganoff. The painter painted his version from sketches and Catherine 2 was satisfied with the work, having written: "I have the best opinion of Robert's picture". That is, the painter's work was quite realistic.

If you look at later images of these ruins, you can see quite an ennobled tower, which may well be passed off as a newly built.

I. Ivanov's work already shows a park and a more or less restored tower. The modern view does not resemble the ruins at all.

The closer to the present, the more restoration the monument survives and looks better. It seems that Catherine did not build this Tower, but simply turned the found ruins into a symbol of victory. This was most likely a normal practice for Petersburg.

text:
Norimitsu Odachi - the sword of a huge samurai!

 One of the museums in Japan keeps a sword 3.77 meters long and weighing 15 kg.

There are also ordinary swords of enormous size, not only Japanese swords. Explanations for this length for the balance of the sword and the finishing of the blow are clumsy attempts to protect the usual picture of the world. One of the names is "one-and-a-half-handed", as if they were held with one-and-a-half hands, well that's a laugh. The most plausible explanation is the presence of people with somewhat large palms. However, in the official history the presence of giants is forbidden, so we have to invent various fairy tales and excuses, but the facts are before our eyes...

For a person of normal height to carry such a sword and, even more so, to fight in a duel - suicide. But if his master is three or four meters tall, then this sword will be quite suitable for him.

text:
In 1403-1406, the ambassador of the King of Castile, Ruy de Clavijo, traveled to Tartary (the one that, according to modern historians, did not exist). Upon his return, he wrote a very detailed report with precise dates, place names, and other important details.

Judging by the ambassador's notes, the Tartars ate meat, rice, melons, grapes, and corn. I.e., in Siberia in the beginning of the 15th century they ate corn without suspecting that Columbus would officially bring it to Europe in 90 years, and that corn would come to Siberia through Russia only during the Russo-Turkish War in the 18th century.

text:
A leading French scientist tweeted a picture of a piece of chorizo (pork sausage) and told his nearly 100,000 followers that it was an "image from a space telescope" of the nearest star to the Sun. 
 
Tens of thousands of people believed him without a doubt. 
The tweet received tens of thousands of likes and retweets. 
 
"Photo of Proxima Centauri, the nearest star to the Sun, 4.2 light years away from the JWST spacecraft. This level of detail. A new world is opening up day by day," was the commentary of the photo of the sausage. 
 
A typical example of how people believe everything.

text:
The granite head in Peterhof is unknown to history, there are no pre-revolutionary photos or drawings of it before the revolution, and the three most popular guidebooks are silent about it. The only mention is found in Lewis Carroll in "Diary of a Journey to Russia" 1.08.1867g.

"Here we were admiring... "Here we admired... a huge stone, hewn in the shape of a gigantic head with a face and eyes as mysterious as a meek sphinx, so that it seemed as if some Titan trying to free himself from the burden of the earth resting on his shoulders..."

But a copy of the sculpture was found, though the source is surprising "Religious Rites and Customs of the Several Nations of the Known World 4, Part 2, p. 8 "The Hindu God" , by Bernard Picart, 1731. Here Hindus and dervishes, around the pagodas and temples of Rama, revel in the background of an identical stone head. 

How could a human-sized stone head be overlooked and left out of history?

text:
The Hope Experiment 

In the 1950s, Harvard psychologist Kurt Richter conducted a brutal experiment: he put rats in a pool of water to see how long they would cling to life. 

It turned out that, on average, they gave up and drowned after 15 minutes. This was the case with one group of rats. 

As for the second, before the test subjects gave up, the researcher took them out of the water. He dried them, fed them, let them rest for a few minutes, and threw them back in. The rats were given hope. 

How long do you think they could last in the second round? Another 15 minutes? Ten minutes? 5? No, the whole 60 hours! 

The conclusion is obvious: because the rats believed in their continued salvation, they were able to force their bodies to perform the impossible and expanded their limit.

'As long as a man does not give up, he is stronger than his destiny' Erich Maria Remarque

It turned out that, on average, they gave up and drowned after 15 minutes. This was the case with one group of rats. 

As for the second, before the test subjects gave up, the researcher took them out of the water. He dried them, fed them, let them rest for a few minutes, and threw them back in. The rats were given hope. 

How long do you think they could last in the second round? Another 15 minutes? Ten minutes? 5? No, the whole 60 hours! 

The conclusion is obvious: because the rats believed in their continued salvation, they were able to force their bodies to perform the impossible and expanded their limit.

'As long as a man does not give up, he is stronger than his destiny' Erich Maria Remarque
Forbidden Science

text:
About 10 years ago, miniature lead books were found in a cave in Jordan. The 70 small books describe the life of Christ and the early years of Christianity.

Researchers at the University of Surrey in the UK used isotopic analysis to compare a sample of the books with a sample from 2,000 years ago and concluded that they were identical. At the same time they confirmed the correspondence of the text and grammatical constructions to the real ancient language. In the decoded part, it is written that Jesus is a prophet, that his teachings are a revival of the ancient Jewish religion.

It would seem that this is the conclusion of scientists about the antiquity and authenticity of the artifacts! But the content of the texts was highly disliked by the church and the Israel Antiquities Authority quickly declared the books to be forgeries, bypassing the results of their analysis.

Modern equipment and methods make it possible to study the Jordanian finds for a long time to come.

text:
Diamond City

Can you imagine a city that was built using 72,000 tons of diamonds?

Well, there you have it:

The Bavarian town of NÃ¶rdlingen has a perfectly round shape for a reason: It was built in a crater 26 km wide, left over from the impact of a huge meteorite 15 million years ago. The impact on the surface has created a zone of extremely high pressure, and as a result, all the rocks in this area just studded with the smallest (0.2 mm) diamonds formed as a result. 

Once settled here, people built a city out of the unique material, although until the 1960s they had no idea why all the stone surfaces in it gleamed in the sun. Even the textbooks said that NÃ¶rdlingen is located in the crater of an extinct volcano.

The city is small (20 thousand people), but very beautiful. It's one of only three towns in Germany where the city walls are completely preserved, and inside there are authentic burger half-timbered houses and crooked medieval streets.

text:
On old maps, the Ural River is listed as Yaik, or in Greek as Rymnus, or Rhimnius, Rhymmus, Rhimeus, Rhimnicus. Apparently, there was no such thing as spelling, so they spelled it by the principle of "as I hear, so I write. The river became Ural after the revolt of Yemelyan Pugachev.

It is known that Alexander Vasilyevich Suvorov had the title Count Rymniksky, for his victory at the River Rymnik in Romania. But as we see above the river Ural and was called in the ancient language Rymnik. So think on what river the armies met and against whom Suvorov fought.

Article Title:

"Electricity Derived from Air Drives Car."

This is Nikola Tesla's 1921 Pierce-Arrow electric car, powered by pure etheric electricity. It is a self-charging car; it does not run on batteries, oil, or gas.

Electric cars have been around much longer than many people think. It's not even a myth, just a cover-up of lost technology.

text:
In the photo you can see two babies: Horus, the god of ancient Egypt, on the left, and Jesus on the right. And besides the scene depicted, they have quite a lot in common. Here are some facts for you.

Horus was born to the virgin mother Isis in a cave, Jesus was born to the virgin mother Mary in a manger (a stable for cattle).

Horus was born by the star Sirius, and Jesus was born by the "star in the East."

Horus tried to kill Seth, but Isis fled to the island of Chammis, and Jesus tried to kill Herod, and Mary fled to Egypt (!).

Neither Horus nor Jesus was married or had children.

What is the point of all this? Because the coincidence of so many facts of life (and there are many more) is not coincidental. Perhaps it is the same real moment in history, described by different people and adapted for different peoples to their realities...

text:
Overlaying old maps on modern terrain, finding old Tartarian cities would be difficult. How can you not believe in point impacts on the planet, when perfectly flat craters are in place of each city?

In Siberia, such sinkholes often become "devil's lakes". In Mongolia, on the other hand, rivers and lakes often dry up and the craters clearly show that only flat land, different in color from the surrounding area, is left in place of the city. Space bodies enter the atmosphere at an inclination, and to imagine that thousands of fragments fall all over the planet at right angles, leaving a crater of 5-7 km. is something from the realm of science fiction. They didn't manually tear down the mountains and earth with a shovel, did they?

text:
The lie of the "cultural layer" was born in 1960-1970 in the USSR during the excavations of Novgorod, when archaeologists found wooden planking going into the ground. They decided that they were wooden sidewalks, but why so many of them? The answer was found, they decided that the wooden decks went into the ground every year, and every year they were laid anew. Thus, by the number of sunken layers of logs they "managed" to date the very first sidewalk. 

The scientists were not confused by the identical preservation of logs at the top and bottom. Scientists also apparently were not aware of such a concept as a "path" - a road made of wood through the swamp, and if the swamp is deep, the path is immediately stacked with several rows of logs until the logs are on the surface, and you can walk on them. If the "ancient bridges" is an ordinary walkway through the swamp, then the same preservation of logs finds its own explanation - they were laid at the same time.

text:
Sixty ancient settlements with stone houses underwater found

Archaeologists found them in the Arab-Persian Gulf and dated the construction to 5,500 B.C.

The same officials talk about the flooding of the Persian Gulf basin about 8,000 years ago. 

It is logical to assume that the rise in water levels flooded the ancient cities, the inhabitants went to the coast of the gulf. 

It turns out that the Sumerians, formed in the 4th millennium BC, were only the successors of other highly developed civilizations.

It was then, in October, that the inhabitants noticed the Sun take on a strange dark blue hue, after which darkness ensued, like nighttime.

After that, it rained for many more months in Europe, flooding many basements and villages. For several years the fish in the ponds froze, and the trees and grass did not grow.

Already in the 20th century, it was said that it was because of a volcanic eruption, only what kind, have not been found. But what is most interesting, such a small ice age occurred in 1816, and all also tried to write off on the volcano, but on what to blame, have not found

text:
Today there are over 5,000 known manuscripts of the New Testament and none of them are the original author's originals. They are copies overflowing with errors and inaccuracies that distort the meaning and prevent proper understanding. Inattention, fatigue, poor lighting, illegible handwriting, marks in the margins were taken as part of the text, sometimes the text was read aloud and scribes wrote it down-remember how many mistakes there were in the dictations?

In 1707 a book was published by the scholar John Mill who analyzed about a hundred Greek manuscripts of the New Testament and found more than 30,000 discrepancies. That's an average of 300 per manuscript, with only important distortions and outright errors taken into account.

But yes, the text of Scripture has come down to us from the depths of time. The question is, how much of it is left of the original?

text:
Ring from a private collection

This ring has long been in the private collection of the Dukes of Marlborough. Imagine how many artifacts lie quietly in their custody.

It is believed to be the ring of the Roman emperor Caligula and to be at least 2,000 years old. That's about it.

The most interesting thing is the processing. Sapphire is very hard, and working with it is a troublesome business. It is impossible to replicate it without high-precision optics of high-tech tools.

In previous posts we wrote about unique jewelry. And such a ring is not the merit of just one talented craftsman who has dedicated his life to this endeavor. It takes industry and industry to make it. Let me remind you, the ring is at least 2,000 years old.

text:
A group of researchers can influence history more than venerable scientists. Thus, enthusiasts have shown that ancient peoples were able to build a real network of tunnels, under the mountain systems: Altai, Sayan, Himalayas, Urals, Caucasus, Carpathian Mountains, under the plains and going under the rivers and seas. The tunnels go tens and hundreds of kilometers underground and this is only a part that we know of.

To ascribe the origin of tunnels to natural reasons does not turn out - labyrinths and traps are not created by water that once again confirms the developed skills of ancient peoples

text:
Financier J. P. Morgan was the owner of the White Star Line, and he invested a considerable amount of money in the Titanic. 

Before he set sail, he worked on a plan to create a U.S. Federal Reserve System to regulate the banking system.

Some were outspoken critics of Morgan's ideas, and all of these people booked a seat on the ship first. They were Benjamin Guggenheim, Isa Strauss, and David Astor.
Morgan and a few of his close friends canceled their trip on the Titanic at the last minute and survived. His opponents remained on board and died during the ship's sinking. 

The Federal Reserve was already established the following year, 1913.
This concerned the Rothschild family and even the Illuminati Society.
Bribing members of the crew - to sacrifice people's lives to accomplish their goals - was already a tradition.

And don't forget of course, the Titanic was insured...

text:
The Olympic Games came from the site of Olympia in ancient Greece, where the games were held. There were 293 games held at the sacred site, but then something happened...

They found Olympia in 1766, and a century-long excavation began. A lot of artifacts were scattered among museums, but we got photos of the excavations - a deep pit that buried a whole city with temples, arenas and houses under a layer of clay. The official historians tell us that there were strong earthquakes in 521 and 552 A.D., and in the 7th century A.D. there was a landslide from Mount Kronos and an overflow of the Alpheus River. This soil destroyed ancient Olympia so that it was forgotten for a thousand years.

How much clay must there have been on little Mount Kronos that a five-meter-long landslide descended from it? 
A river spill? From Olympia to the river is at least 300 meters. Even if the Alpheus River rises a few meters, there would be no such flooding.  And to the sea in a straight line is 12 km.

text:
Former DARPA director and current Google executive Regina Dugan wants you to swallow identification microchips.

She explains how the microchip works when it is in the body. Inside the pill is a small chip with a switch. When you swallow the pill, the acids in your stomach act as an electrolyte that powers the chip. The switch turns on and off and generates an 18-bit ECG signal in your body so that your whole body becomes your authenticator.
"You put your hand to your computer, your phone, your doorbell-and you're authenticated."

FYI, the video was filmed in 2012, so you can imagine the technology already exists.

text:
Archaeological investigations in the area of Pompeii are delightful. Not everyone is happy, because the plumbing system with taps, valves, and faucets, similar to modern ones, does not fit much into the history of technological progress. Valves were created in the 18th century, faucets in the 13th, and in Pompeii they already existed 2,000 years ago.

Archaeologists dig out, and then the scientists have to think how to explain the findings and not to destroy the foundation of a coherent chronology.

text:
In modern Great Zimbabwe the remains of the old town of the early 12th century were found. We found traces of active trade, large-scale mining of ore, developed blacksmithing, which indicates an unusually high, compared to its neighbors, level of cultural development in the city. Well-designed planning of the city, separating fortified stone part and wooden "settlement" for poor people. Numerous stone temples.  

Simply put, poor hungry pygmies, as the Africans are now represented as, were not capable of creating such a thing. All the evidence adds up to a picture that there was an advanced civilization, of which, however, the history is silent. But you can read about the primitiveness of the population in any textbook.

text:
Tibi Dam. Built in 1594.

The 42-meter dam was built incredibly competently for its year of construction - 1580. After 14 years the construction was completed. Not only is it arch and gravity-type - it is also located in the place where the river crosses a high rocky ridge. The dam rests against the rocky shoreline, and the pressure of the water is pushing against it.

Design institutes work on such structures. And all modern dams and levees are made of reinforced concrete. And here - stone blocks.

By the way, many modern dams are already deteriorating; they are either in an emergency condition or require constant maintenance.
And how many blocks had to be cut, moved and laid? And all this in 14 years.

text:
What can a connoisseur of Hebrew learn from reading the Torah in its original form? Mauro Bijino answers:

"...The Old Testament (OT) does not speak of God.

The Bible became a sacred text for monotheistic religions because of the manipulation of key terms. The Masoretes (Jewish scribes who in the 6th-9th centuries "established" the meaning of the contents of the ancient texts) and theologians did this.

Translating literally, it turns out that the NT tells of a treaty between Yahweh the warrior of the Elohim group and Jacob's family and nothing else. The rest is a reworking by the theologians."

An ordinary people's history book that has been greatly embellished and diluted with fantastic details.

text:
In "Bellum Tartaricum...", translated into English in 1654, there is a portrait of the Emperor of the Eastern Tartars who conquered the Chinese Empire.

The appearance of the ruler brings to my mind our boyars, who wore fur-lined caftans and the hat of Monomakh as a symbol of royal power. However, Asian rulers were not entitled to either.

text:
In the 17th century Martin Martinius published a book in Latin titled "Bellum Tartaricum or the Conquest of the Great and Most Famous Chinese Empire by the Tartars...".

The story of the conquest of China begins, "The most ancient nation of Tartars in Asia, which was the progenitor of many nations..." - And true, the peoples of Tartary at that time were noted from the coast of the Bering Sea to the very borders of Muscovy, and with such a prevalence, it is not surprising that this nation was related to many peoples living here. Only one historical mishap - officially, such a people never existed, and the nearest people suitable for the habitat (the Scythians), according to the same academic history, died out back in the 4th century BC.

text:
The stele of the pharaoh Cheops is rarely exhibited in museums, but often lies in the storerooms. The whole reason is in the text on the stele - the Sphinx stood before Cheops, the Great Pyramids too, Cheops himself built only the temple of Isis, which in size and technology is strongly inferior to both the pyramids and the Sphinx. Such is the degradation of technology, of which the hieroglyphs are carved in stone.

Official historians do not recognize this translation of the inscriptions, but could not provide their own sensible version. As soon as independent Egyptologists and translators offer to help the officials with the translation, the stele disappears from the expositions at once.

text:
When were the railway tunnels actually built?

Officially the tunnel under the railway crossing appeared in 1875 in Sevastopol.

Imagine, 1860, the city destroyed to ruins. The Crimean War destroyed completely Nikolayevsky bastion, Malakhov kurgan tower, the fortifications of the Historical Boulevard.

Instead of reconstructing the city people are starting to make brick tunnels in places where they could just dig a passage? 

Probably underground tunnels appeared long before the 19th century.

text:
The history of ancient Egypt is based on the dynastic lists of the pharaohs from the temple at Abydos, built by Pharaoh Seti 1 in the 14th-13th century B.C. All of the pharaohs listed their predecessors, which modern history for some reason does not account for. 

The Palermo stone was created 1,000 years before Seti 1. On the diorite slab are carved the names of 120 kings of the pre-dynastic era.

The Turin papyrus is poorly preserved, but we can read the names of 10 neteru gods on it. The dates of their reigns are also indicated, and at the end of the text the total is summed up: "Shemsu-Gor - 13'420 years, before Shemsu-Gor - 23'200 years, the total is 36'620 years.  Such terms of the ancient Egyptian civilization are not stacked in the accepted history of development of mankind.

The Egyptian priest Manetho in the 3rd century BC compiled a history of Egypt, where the history of the country was 24'925 years. 

And it was not the fantasy of one ancient historian.

text:
Grooves in the stones of Gotland

On the Swedish island of Gotland there are more than 3,600 stones with chamfers, notches or cuts.

Scientists' hypothesis: swords were sharpened on the stones and left such grooves. According to the marks on the stones, it appears that the sword was held perpendicular to the surface. But this is not conducive to sharpening. 

It is interesting that identical traces are found on the stone slopes of Gotland.

text:
Nature magazine study names exact year of Viking presence in North America

On three wooden objects identified the annual rings.They compared their characteristic trace of a spike in radiocarbon levels. Counted the total number of rings and get the exact date - 1021 AD

Columbus wasn't the first, after all.

text:
New York City above and below ground, 1913.

At a time when for most people (look how the adults and children pose, although photographing the street) a camera was something absolutely fantastic, the builders built this "fork" underground. 

Of course this is not a sewer and the people themselves are photographed "for the memory" in this tunnel. Because they themselves are shocked by the discovery. What brickwork! How precisely the radii and angles are aligned and observed. Such precision is necessary for a sewer! Yep.

text:
A large root system has been discovered under Devils Tower in Wyoming.

A huge and startling discovery was made at Devils Tower in Wyoming. Scientists from the Wyoming State Parks Department were conducting photographic seismic readings under the tower when they discovered an incredibly large fossilized root system under the tower. The Parks Department released a statement saying, "We discovered what looks like a giant root system flowing from the base of Devil's Tower. The root system has been measured to a depth of 6.5 km. and a width of about 13 km. We are currently conducting research and tests to confirm that it is indeed a root system and not a coincidence." This discovery is on the verge of rewriting history and science as we know it.

There is interesting information about the sign of Allatra. It is a circle and under it is a crescent with legs up. It is found on almost all continents in the architecture of buildings, on mosques, on stupas, on Orthodox churches. This suggests that the Knowledge used to be unified. But why this sign is not told about it in history classes? Because they say divide and conquer. And this knowledge on the contrary says that we are one big family. And we are one as humankind. That's why this information is silenced.

text:
Prince Mikhail Scherbatov published a huge work "History of Russia from the earliest times" in seven volumes. The book describes in detail the events, their participants by name, the history of clans, variants of names of places and cities. By the way, considers the Scythians the ancestors of our nation, lists the Scythian kings and gives them a detailed description.

Interesting data on the founding of Veliky Novgorod: "Novgorod was also called Uhrat and Nemagard, built at the same time as Kiev by the Slavs who came back from the Danube, about half a century after the Nativity of the Savior. The name of Novgorod was given to distinguish it from the city built before, which was called Slaven, at a distance of a verst from Novgorod, which was completely ruined by plague and war". Slavic city which existed till 5 century A.D. and which became a basis for Novgorod, how do you perceive it? Sensation?

text:
Mayan Pyramid

This is the same Mayan pyramid in one of the most famous cities of Chichen Itza. The first photo shows how it was first found in 1892, and the second photo shows how it looks now. 

Archaeologists sure know their stuff, and life in the rainforest is amazing how quickly the plants there absorb the man-made structures. 

I wonder how many other surviving buildings stand around the world that we just haven't found?
